campaign.story:
Dragon Dice® is a collectable dice game for 2 or more players. Originally made famous in 1995 by TSR, Dragon Dice® has continued to expand and evolve under the reign of SFR Inc. and currently offers a large range of truly exceptional dice to be used with its innovative tactical game system.

The Frostwings are one of Dragon Dice®'s most sought-after species. Out of print for some time, the player community chanted for their return and the gods of Esfah™ have answered. Pledge your service to the denizens of the frozen tundra to witness the Frostwings take to the skies once more!
Furthermore, due to years of player feedback, if we reach funded status, not only will Frostwings be available once more, but one of the biggest missteps taken by TSR will be corrected.  That's right, once the project is funded, we will be remaking the Large unit mold, thereby making the Magi, one of the most useful units from this species, more readily available!
Dragon Dice® has a huge range of available dice, each offering different abilities and tactics, allowing you to compose your perfect army. Due to the large number of options, new players should always start with our 'Starter Rules', which give players an insight to the core mechanics of the game focused on the 2-player experience.
The following video is designed to make learning Dragon Dice® a breeze:
 Our 2-player starter set contains everything you could need to get started on your Dragon Dice® adventure: A total of 40 stunning quality dice, 2 paper playmats and a copy of the 2-player starter rules (also downloadable below).
V4.0 RULES DOWNLOADS
(click to view and download):

For those of you already experienced with Dragon Dice®, the full rules have recently undergone an update focusing on streamlining the gaming experience and are now presented in full graphical format along with a range of species reference sheets. The new Dragon Dice® V4.01 full rules set can be downloaded here:

High res versions of these files (for printing) as well as additional documents in support of our rules, including an FAQ and our awesome new online rules wiki can be found on the SFR website by clicking here!
Want to know a little more about each of the species in Dragon Dice®? You can check them all out by clicking here!
What is a 'kicker'?
You will notice that the pledge tiers (as well as the campaign add-ons) include large numbers of 'kickers'. A kicker is the standard pack size for Dragon Dice®. Kickers for the various species all contain the following four small six-sided units, two medium six-sided units, one large six-sided unit and one Monster (10-sided) (any kickers that contain different assortments of dice are detailed in the add-ons section)...

US, UK and AU-friendly shipping!
We will be shipping all rewards from one of 3 hubs around the world - US, UK and Australia.  As such, if you reside in the US, UK or AU areas your rewards will be shipped locally and there will be no customs duties or fees applicable. unfortunately, our UK distributor is no longer able to ship EU orders without Custom/Duty fees, so all EU orders will be shipped via the US, and custom fees may be applied.

updates.update_userinfo: The Home Stretch and a few things to note...
updates.update_content:
With only a few days left to go, the response to our Frostwings campaign has been anything but chilly, and we have you to thank for it.  With your support, we're going to see not only Frostwings returning to Esfah, but Dwarves, Lava Elves and Goblins as well, along with units celebrating 25 years of battle, and much more!
We're most excited however, about being able to bring you a brand new die, "Earthfang"!  Taken from Esfah lore, Earthfang is a powerful axe capable of great things...

We've passed our last Stretch Goal, thanks to your support!
that means, every pledge at Yeti tier or higher, will receive, in addition to the random Alt Ink monster surpassed earlier in the campaign, an additional set of 4 Alt ink Monsters, (Frost Ogre excluded).

We've also increased the per backer limit on the Add-on page for the Full set of 5 Alt Ink monsters to 2 per backer.  that means, depending on the tier you backed at, you can own as many as 3 of these coveted monsters to add to your armies, or to just make your friends jealous.

We've surpassed the Stretch Goal amount to unlock "Earthfang", a powerful melee oriented relic your units can carry into battle to vanquish your foes!  Every backer pledging at Yeti tier or above will receive one free Earthfang die.
We've also decided to make the Alt Ink Monster sets available prior to the post-campaign pledge manager.  Sunday, April 25th, at 6PM EDT, we will be making 50 sets of Frostwings Alternate Ink Monsters available as add-ons, (limit 1 set per backer)

and things are moving at a good pace.  We're happy to report, that we have already received a test run for quality control, of both the production run that will be in the Kickers, and the Alternate Inks.
First, since the original Alternate Inks were released in 2001, there is a very noticeable difference between now and then, both in the plastic and the ink...

campaign.story:
As a regular D&D spell caster I have always found it frustrating trying to keep track of how many spell slots I have and even more so when other people don't realise they have overused their spell slots. I scoured the internet for ways to keep track in a simple, and cost effective way. I found spell trackers and similar systems but most were outside of Europe and incurred large postage costs.

So I decided to make my own. These have been super handy and simple to use for everyone. They are made to fit standard 16mm D6 dice, so you will finally have a way to use up all those unlucky dice that never get thrown anymore. Each Spell Tracker is 8cm by 10cm. They are made from 6mm Birch Ply Wood.
Basic Natural Colour
Since making them, I have played with colours, designs and all sorts of ways to make them more personal to my character. I am trying to include these options in the pledges so that you can also have a personalised Spell Tracker. 
Example colours
Example colours
If this Kickstarter goes well I am hoping to add more gaming accessories and cool items. I have already began working health trackers, dice boxes, and spell trackers for character types. 
Colour options
Dice are not included, these may be added as an Add-On in the future.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
All Spell Trackers are made at home by myself so the risks are minimal. I have already been testing out ways to speed up production and ensure quality whilst testing out designs, and I am comfortable that I will be able to fulfill all pledges. 

The only challenge I foresee will be if I have any failures with my machines, however at worst this would only delay the production minimally.

Tiny Epic Dungeons is a fully cooperative dungeon crawler for 1 to 4 players set in the fantasy world of Aughmoore. 
Here's a look at everything included in a base pledge: 
This image is updated with unlocked stretch goals.
28mm scale Factory Sample Photo (not final color).
Miniatures painted for example purposes only. Miniatures in the game will come unpainted.
In Tiny Epic Dungeons players control a band of Heroes exploring a treacherous dungeon in search of the fearsome Dungeon Boss.
Heroes make their way through the dungeon one room at a time. Around every corner goblins and ferocious minions seek to block the Heroes’ path.  Where there isn’t an enemy, traps are set, ready to spring on even the most prepared Hero.
Tiny Epic Dungeons features a modular dungeon that is unique with each play.
The game is played over 2 ACTS: the Dungeon and the Dungeon Boss. In both acts the players are constantly struggling against the waning firelight of their torch which decreases each turn. When the torch goes out, the Heroes are forever lost in the darkness.
After clearing the dungeon of all its minions and finding the entrance to the lair, players must engage in an epic battle against the Boss. Each boss has unique abilities and a lair with a unique environment that gives various advantages and disadvantages depending on the skill used and where the Hero attacks from.
These Epic Monsters cannot be slain by mere swords, axes, arrows, and the occasional spell. Ritual Rooms around the dungeon must be used to lower their magical bond to the dungeon. The Dungeon boss must be lured to these rooms to lower their defenses and allow the Heroes to strike the final blow!
Victory in Tiny Epic Dungeons is achieved by defeating the Dungeon Boss!
In order to do that, the Heroes will need to collect Legendary Loot, and Supreme Spells. 
Heroes of old crafted loot to honor the ways of their clans. Bear, Lion, Phoenix, and Panther. Heroes can discover pieces from these ancient sets that grow more powerful the more you collect. 
Will you be the greatest warrior the Bear clan has ever seen? Or will you make the Panther clan proud by stalking your prey and striking with surprising force, unseen before the moment of impact.
The story is yours to tell in...
When you pledge for a Deluxe copy of Tiny Epic Dungeons, you will receive the base game PLUS the Deluxe, Potions & Perils, components shown below.
This image updates with unlocked stretch goals.
The Potions & Perils mini expansion brings a whole new element to the game in the way of Potions and the perilous alchemists that concoct them... the Mixy Goblins!
Mixy Goblins are added directly to the goblin deck and are encountered like normal goblins. Except, they are not like normal goblins.  When you defeat a Mixy Goblin, something explodes! You'll draw a Potion Card to see what the effect is. Each Potion Card will describe a peril that occurs when you kill a Mixy Goblin and will also leave you with a handy potion for use later!
Additionally,  the mini expansion brings new Dungeon Bosses, Minions and Goblins to the game. Each presenting a unique challenge that will test even the best players! 
***Kickstarter-Limited Exclusivity - Deluxe content will not enter regular distribution. However, it will be available in limited supply at conventions, through contests, online at the BGG promo store, and directly from Gamelyn Games on our website or through our Amazon store.
This image updates with unlocked stretch goals.
In Tiny Epic Dungeons: Stories players dive deeper into the lore of Aughmoore. 
The Stories expansion introduces a new Story Mode that has Heroes completing Side Quests and adventuring deeper into the dungeon, descending Multiple Floors and eventually fighting multiple Dungeons Bosses at once!
In addition, Stories offers a slew of new Heroes, Loot, Dungeon Rooms, Dungeon Bosses, Minions, and Goblins! 
The Stories expansion will come in a box of the same thickness and quality of Tiny Epic Dungeons. It will share the same length and height as well. Making them great for storing side by side!
The Stories expansion is available in the 'Gameplay All-In' reward tier or as an add-on in CrowdOx after the project.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The publication of a board game is a highly involved process. It can be prone to many mistakes and delays, even for experienced publishers.

We are proud to say that we're prepared for the task at hand and have years of experience in successfully producing board games and fulfilling Kickstarter projects.

Here are the steps we take to prepare and reduce the likelihood of mistakes and delays:

1. We have done significant pre-production. This includes having all the illustrations for the game complete and the graphic art over 95% complete. The production quote is in hand and ready to be initiated.

2. We are working with an experienced manufacturing partner. We are familiar with their production requirements, timelines, payment schedules, communication methods and Chinese freight arrangements and costs for when it comes time for shipping. We will provide tracking information for the boat when the games leave China.

3. We are working with an experienced fulfillment partner. We are confident that they can handle any amount of work we send their way. They have fulfilled many projects and have proven to be communicative, punctual and respectful when dealing with our customers.

Above all, I am 100% dedicated to backer communication. I will be transparent with our process and involve our backers as much as possible. I will be present daily during the project to answer any questions and I read every comment. I will provide regular updates and supply photos of the progress.

Thank you for your trust in us! Let's bring Tiny Epic Dungeons to game tables around the world!

campaign.story:
“Excellent system! Finally, a military game that strikes a great balance between beefy simulation and fast-paced, narrative-oriented play. If I had to summarize it quickly, I'd say it's a great amalgamation. It mixes some of the better concepts from various systems to create a unique engine that's well-suited to its task. In essence, you might say it's the love child of the Cypher system (Numenera), FATE (FUDGE, more specifically), and a game I played a while back called In Harm's Way: Wild Blue. It's got a nice, sleek system, plenty of source material to get you rolling, and more in supplementary content”.
 Customer Reviews
Since publication in 2017 Ghost Ops has been Ennie nominated and has become a Gold Bestseller on DriveThru RPG. Over the last couple of years, I have also been hard at work gathering the likes and dislikes about the game, talking to the fans about what they would like to see and what should change and finally I am ready to bring Ghost Ops back with a Second Strike!
Since Ghost Ops launched it has had massive success with a thriving Facebook community, players from all over the world ranging from active military, veterans, and civilians who all love to test their skills against the worse the world can offer. 
The core rules will have a facelift based on feedback from the fans of the game, but the foundations of both versions will stay the same meaning that all the sourcebooks and missions that have been already released will still be usable with Second Strike.
So what will change?
The first big change will be the characters, in the original characters were members of the I.C.O. but I learnt that some players ignored that so this time the game will allow you to play as:
I.C.O. Operators (A fictional Special Forces unit similar to Tom Clancy's Rainbow 6)
Swat Teams
Special Agents
Private Military Contractors
Special Forces
Not only does this widen the scope of backgrounds and character skills but also the types of missions that you will encounter.
Actual Artwork from the book
The 2nd Change will be to Backgrounds.
Backgrounds in the core game were a huge hit with fans so in Second Strike I will be doubling the number of countries available to choose from, and along with the changes in character types as shown above the backgrounds linked to each country will grow also, offering a whopping 200 background choices.
The Game will also offer five different world settings
The original game was set in modern-day, but many people asked about cold war settings or World War Two, so both the Operators section and Handlers section will be expanded to cover various timelines allowing you to experience Special Operations from World War Two, Vietnam and beyond. The Handlers Section will contain everything you need to run Ghost Ops along with the Modern Day setting. I will then include all the settings unlocked during this campaign to the Handlers section expanding it with up to 5 more settings from the Second World War to Near Future.
There will also be some significant changes to the original rules, these have been designed to make combat faster with new weapons and armour rules, and to make the character creation more open for you to make the Operator you want with new skills, abilities, and talents.
The Core book will continue to use the popular FeralEngine with some tweaks but there will also be an optional rules section allowing you to play the game using 2d6 or a D100 percentile ruleset.
Art from the Core Book
 Savage Ghost Ops will also be upgraded and expanded into a whole new game using the SWADE rules which will be created by me with consultation from Thomas Clegg.
 There will also be a 5th edition Ghost Ops bring Special Forces to the World's oldest RPG. So if you love 5e and would experience in a way never experienced before grab the 5th edition Bundle.
The Hardback will be just available for the standard rules (FeralEngine plus optional 2d6, D100). This will be a 300+ size book in a standard format (8.5x11). The hardbacks will be offset printed, so stitched. With a ribbon for saving your place.
The Savage Ghost Ops bundle will come with a link to buy the softcover from DTRPG for the cost of Print and Postage.
This is a mock up and is subject to change
The book will have all new artwork and layout and be much bigger than the original. I am hoping to add missions that will fit each of the character types, so whether your players want to be SWAT or Special Agents etc there will be a mission for them to get started.
If you would like to be involved in our social media we have a number of places you can join us for a chat.
Facebook - https://www.facebook.com/groups/GhostOpsRPG
Discord - https://discord.gg/p9skxB8
Or you can join our Patreon and gain special discounts, free missions and other stuff for just $3 per month - https://www.patreon.com/Ghostops
The Ghost Ops Patreon has a few members and it would be nice to see it grow as being a member gains you discount, free and exclusive content, previews and first refusal on games that I will run over Discord and all for just $3 per month.
I want to offer something to our members so the following are exclusive to Patreon and will unlock as more people join.
At 25 members you will each receive an exclusive mission
At 50 members you will each receive a unique NPC Terrorist Cell
At 75 members you will each receive a second exclusive mission
At 100 members you will each a unique setting for the game.
Addons will be added here as we unlock them but if you would like to purchase other RPGs created by FeralGamersInc then there is a list below with the special Kickstarter price.

There are Four kinds of Stretch Goals available:
Internal - These will be added to the books and will be mainly character types and setting guides.
PDF - These will be separate PDFs and will be missions and city guides.
Physical - These will be physical rewards such as GM Screens, Dice, Collected Mission Books etc.
Addons - These will open up new addons that can be added to your pledge, such as special editions, custom dice etc.
The Shadow War setting written by Bradley Clark will be added to the Handlers Section, with the character choices and gear of that era added to Operators Section. This will allow players to create OSS, SAS and Resistance characters to act behind enemy lines during the Second World War. *Internal Stretch Goal*
A Mission using the Shadow War setting will be added to the core book. *Internal*
A PDF will be released to all backers highlighting the various Gangs and Cartels the Operators will face throughout the world. This will include locations, NPC profiles and mission plots. *PDF*
The Vietnam setting will be added to the core book, allowing you to experience the war against the Viet Cong as CIA Operatives and Special Forces. *Internal*
 FeralGamersInc has partnered with Word Forge Games to help bring this project to life. FeralGamersInc has created awesome games such as The Black Iron, The Ruin, Delve and Stranded and with Word Forge Games experience in not only SLA Industries but a number of board games like Devils Run and Astroforce, everything is looking good for the future.
Jay Lasarde - Creator of the original Ghost Ops, also the bestselling Black Iron, Delve Second Edition, The Ruin and a number of other successful RPGs. Jay has been a roleplayer for almost 40 years and still loves playing three times per week.
Thomas Clegg - Will be the consultant on the SWADE version of Ghost Ops A gamer since the release of Advanced Dungeons and Dragons (way back when) and a data contributor at different times to various Herolab (character creation software) datasets, I recently felt the need to give back to the gaming community I am very fond of. With the advent of official community-created content programs for both Torg Eternity and Savage Worlds on DriveThruRPG, I took the leap into the publishing side of things with a supplement entitled Legion Of Grace for Torg Eternity as well as three supplements for the Savage Worlds Adventurer's Guild; Calensville Caverns (a post-apocalyptic setting location), Into The Depths (an adventure intended for use with the Calensville Caverns supplement), and Gunsmithing 101: A Guide to Modern Firearms (a supplement providing more in-depth options for firearms in Savage Worlds)
Shipping
All PDFs will be sent via DriveThruRPG
We can not ship to Brazil, Russia, Afganistan, Singapore. Shipping can change at any point and the prices below are estimates.
 UK: £6 (Royal Mail 2nd class 'signed for')

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is not my first Kickstarter and though the current world situations have made things complex I am confident this will be completed on time. This is mainly due to me partnering with Word Forge Games who will help me not only with offset printing the hardbacks but also distributing the rewards to the backers via their numerous distribution hubs. This has taken some of the burdens off my shoulders freeing me up to work on the game full time. For someone that is used to doing everything themselves, this is a big part sorted.
Years of feedback and chatting with the community has led to me creating a tighter, faster and more complete rule system and cover other systems which have been asked for without those becoming to cumbersome, which means Ghost Ops now has something for everyone.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I have not run the campaign portion of a kickstarter before, but I did bring Steven's struggling Healer's Dice campaign from 0% fulfillment to fulfilled in under 5 months. We have already sourced out the dice and addons from the various manufacturers, and will be able to get them made within the funding budget. Shipping costs have fluctuated drastically over the last few years and we are committed to keeping the cost as low as possible. Our estimated fulfillment date is December of 2022. We want to learn from the previous campaign's successes and failures, and take almost two years before the promised fulfillment to make sure that all teams involved can work together to achieve the goal. 

We value all of your support and promise to keep posting updates, even if the pictures aren't perfect or if it is just a "thanks for your support, we don't have anything to report yet but we are still on track," etc.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
We increased the size of the design to promote continued strength and durability of the individual dice.
Sustainable Distribution
Seeking out regional fulfillment centers to avoid individual parcels being sent en masse across the globe.

For instance, Mark at Word Forge Games in the UK has agreed to regionally ship our UK and EU packages to keep shipping and VAT taxes down all around.

Ruby-Faith Smith at Miniature Hub will be handling our Australia and New Zealand orders regionally as well.

Both Mark and Ruby performed exceptionally in assisting with regional distribution for Healer's Dice. They volunteered before, but performed well enough that we have come to a profitable agreement for fulfillment in those regions moving forward.

campaign.story:
The Gaia Complex is a cyberpunk RPG set on Earth in 2119. 
Towards the end of the 21st century, the third world war, which became known as the Resource War, pushed mankind to the brink of destruction and brought ruin to the earth’s atmosphere. Small pockets of humanity survived this horrific conflict, eventually forming the eleven metropolises. Initially, these incredible urban constructs were able to grow and prosper through advancements in atmospheric processing and technological innovation, but now cut off from each other, the eleven metropolises must each face their own difficulties and hardships. The Gaia Complex focuses on the largest of these locations; New Europe, a single sprawling city that covers much of what we currently know as mainland Europe. New Europe is a world of street violence, corporate espionage, vampiric uprisings and an overzealous A.I., known as Gaia, which functions as the city’s governor and the protector of its citizens.
This is a game of conspiracy and brutality, where players take on the roles of Mercs; former police officers, hackers and street-savvy dealers who are hired to fight back against the system and ultimately unravel the secrets of The Gaia Complex.
What makes The Gaia Complex different from other cyberpunk RPG's out there? Here are a few points to steer you in the right direction...
 Fiction - The Gaia Complex tells an episodic story. Each chapter of the book is fronted with a piece of short fiction, introducing important characters and plot details. We use short fiction to consistently flesh out the world through the eyes of people living in the metropolis, building up more detailed pictures of life as a Merc in 2119.
 Vampirism - Vampires feature heavily in The Gaia Complex. Since the bloody uprising of 2111, vampires have gone from being mankind's bitter enemy, to untrusted allies and pioneers of modern corporate life. Despite their attempts to 'fit in' with human life, a large number of 'Outsider' vampires still roam the subway tunnels, refusing to accept Gaia's rule and preying on New Europe's civilians. Though vampires are not playable characters, they feature heavily within the game setting as both NPCs and key figures within New Europe.
 Violent content - Unlike many cyberpunk games, The Gaia Complex does not sugar-coat the violence and hardship of the world. While combat-ready cybernetics and a large list of guns may be common-place within the genre, The Gaia Complex shows violence in all of its brutal nature and uses mature language and themes throughout. This is cyberpunk as it should be - brutal and unforgiving.
 Ferals - A true ally of man, the ferals unveiled themselves alongside the vampiric uprisings of 2111. These strange nomadic loners have become valued information-brokers and are able to enter the minds of the metropolis' animals, utilising rats and street mongrels as espionage agents. Feral characters can be created in place of human's and provide an interesting new dynamic to roleplaying - after all, a rat can be pretty sneaky, but is going to struggle to communicate its human comrades. 
 Artificial intelligence - While A.I. may not be rare within the genre, New Europe is exclusively governed by Gaia: a single sentient construct that controls air filtration, food production and the now-entirely robotic police force. Players must learn to operate in the shadow of this all-seeing A.I. and live in a word where the man at the top is not a man at all.
Of course we'd love you to back this campaign and be a part of making The Gaia Complex a reality, but before you do, maybe you want to give it a whirl for yourself? Good news - you can do this right now.
While this campaign and the updates throughout will talk about the game setting and rules, our free (well, 'pay what you want', but please, enter £0 and just grab a copy!) 48-page Quick Start for The Gaia Complex is out right now and will allow you to read and play for yourselves. This PDF contains a huge amount of lore surrounding the game, offering an in-depth insight to the world of The Gaia Complex and what it means to be a Merc in 2119. In addition, the booklet is jammed full of gorgeous artwork and gives you a good idea of what to expect from the full core book.
Go and grab your copy of the Quick Start by clicking this link (or the image below).
The cast of playable characters from The Gaia Complex Quick Start.
The Gaia Complex core book will be 'at least' 256 pages of full-colour hardback beauty, printed in US Letter size format - take a look at the Quick Start for a general idea about how it will look. We say 'at least' as we have a whole host of extra content that we might just squeeze in, either through stretch goals, or becuase we end up deciding certain things just need to be there.
Update: thanks to stretch goals, this book now stands at 288 pages!
Standard and Limited Edition Core Books
At the time of launch, the core book writing is roughly 95% complete and layout for final proof-reading has already been completed for most chapters - this is a significant strength for this project, having completed so much of the writing ahead of launch. Artwork at this point is around 45% complete and new art is in the pipeline to be finished (and shown off) during the campaign. The art direction for this book is very important and great care is being taken to ensure the visuals support the writing as closely as possible.
The structure of the book is split over 12 chapters, plus an NPC (non-player character) library at the end. We'll go into more detail about the chapters over the coming weeks via the campaign updates, sharing some key information as we go. Alongside the rules, background and resources for playing the game, the book also includes multiple pieces of short fiction that slowly unfold the real story behind The Gaia Complex. These stories, and the characters they describe, lay the foundation for the world in which the game is set and allow us to explore New Europe in 2119 in much more cinematic detail.
The Brandenburg Gate at the border to Old Berlin - the capital of New Europe
The engine behind The Gaia Complex is called 12.3 and can be taken for a test drive in our Quick Start by clicking HERE.
The basis of the system uses 2d12 (that's two twelve sided dice - but you're all roleplayers, so I'm sure you knew that!) to make the majority of tests on a 'roll under' basis. Whenever a test is required, the GM determines a potential difficulty for the test, ranging from 1 (easy for a child to accomplish) to 11 (impossibly hard). A character will compare the difficulty to their relevant statistic and if the stat is equal to or greater than the difficulty, the test is a success - There is an emphasis in the game on keeping the action flowing and not making tests unless they are really needed.
If the character's stat is less than the difficulty, a test is required: the player rolls 2d12, requiring a result that is equal to or less than their relevant stat. An 11 fails (without cybernetic enhancement or other bonuses) and a 12 is a Critical Failure. To pass, a character requires one or both d12s to succeed depending on whether they are skilled or unskilled - The Gaia Complex does not consider 'ranks' in various skills like the majority of RPGs, instead a character either possesses a skill or does not (though becoming a specialist in certain skills is possible).
During combat, d3s are also used to determine damage - you can use funky d3s like the ones available on this campaign, or simply use common d6. The engine for the game uses d3s to enable a more consistant result when rolling multiple dice together and to remove the chance of whiffing a result of a 1 in situations that should always achieve a minium degree of success (thus 3d3+3 damage represents a weapon with more consistent output than one that does 1d12 damage) .
Of course, the game includes many other rules - some core, some optional - covering a huge array of options, but at its root, the game falls back on 12.3 to keep it rolling (pun intended).
During the course of the campaign we'll dedicate a couple of updates to specific areas of the rules and give you a deep dive into them beyond what you can get your hands on in the Quick Start.
Characters in The Gaia Complex are known as Mercs. At their core, Mercs are citizens of New Europe who have chosen to rebel against the system and take up arms by making themselves available on the freelance market. The seedy clubs and bars of NeoMunich are the most common place to find Mercs and while their work is entirely illegal, there is enough anonymity that it isn't worth the expenditure of resources for Gaia or its police force to worry about shutting down the network.
Most Mercs are hired to run jobs against one of the many corporations in the metropolis. From hacking R&D servers to kidnapping, assassinating or Bio Hacking company execs; there are few limits when it comes to taking a job. Ironically, the primary employers are the corporations themselves, all looking to get a leg up over their rivals, employing Mercs to do the dirty work in order to maintain complete deniability. Of course, it's not just the heaving corporations that are the enemy; outsider vampires that lurk in the subway tunnels and outer fringes of the metropolis, the cybernetic police force controlled by the LE1 A.I. subsystem, or even Gaia itself - the all seeing ruler of the metropolis - everyone is a potential mark if the score looks big enough!
Police Officer - Bio Hacker - CyberDoc - The Legendary Eddy Tense
The core rulebook contains a detailed character creation process, allowing players to play either human or feral (a mysterious group of people who can enter the minds of the metropolis' animals) characters from one of ten varied roles, each with their own unique rules, benefits and style. Characters can choose from:
 Operator - Former law enforcement, corporate security and guns-for-hire that pack the hottest weapon tech that the black market has to offer.
 Core Hacker - Hackers and coders who live their lives in the digital pathways of The Core.
 Bio Hacker - A new wave of hacker, dedicated to hacking the cybernetic brains of their targets and inducing 'forced servitude'.
 ParaMed - Former TactaMed paramedics who have realised they can earn more money patching up Mercs by being one of them!
 CyberDoc - Back-alley hackjob specialists and cybernetic installers. An often riskier, but cheaper approach, to main stream cybernetics clinics.
 MilTech - Weapons techs, tinkerers and specialist drone pilots. MilTechs keep the team's gear working and provide invaluable technical support.
 Mech - Drivers, pilots and expert mechanics. Mechs keep the metropolis rolling and give Merc teams much needed access to reliable transportation.
 Tech Trader - Black market dealers, handling everything from illegal weapons and stolen cybernetics, to narcotics and false credentials.
 Data Dealer - Information traffickers and dealers of stolen secrets. If there is something worth knowing, you can probably buy it... for a price.
 Handler - Exclusive to ferals. Handlers have dedicated themselves to honing the feral's ability to step into the mind of an animal. This is the feral in their purest form.
We'll be taking a more in-depth look into each of these roles as the campaign unfolds.

Shipping... oh, my old nemesis! The state of global shipping at the time of this campaign going live is very much 'problematic'. While most national postal services are getting close to resuming 'normal' operation, international shipments to many places are currently attracting very high tariffs and long delays.
As we won't be shipping this book until later in the year, we are very hopeful that international shipping will have stabilised somewhat, both in terms of cost and reliability. In order to address this as best we can, we will not be charging shipping during the campaign and will not open the campaign's pledge manager to collect shipping until we are closing in on shipping your rewards.
By handling shipping in this manner it ensures you are not over charged backers by needing to pay the current high tariffs and allows us to better adjust our shipping strategy based on the state of the fulfilment industry at the time.

Though we are able to ship to most places (there are a few exceptions below), we are currently positioned to be able to ship UK, EU and US 'friendly' packages, meaning that backers in those territories will have their packages shipped from within those territories, in order to avoid incurring additional import fees beyond the shipping costs that we charge. campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Though all Kickstarters come with some element of unseen risk, the team behind this project are well positioned to deliver on-time and as promised. At the time of launch, the book is over 95% written, with a complete and heavily tested rules system, putting it well ahead of where one would consider a typical RPG book to be at the time of launching a kickstarter campaign. 

While there is a still a large amount of art to be completed, once again, the amount already finished is ahead of our initial expectations and puts us in a great place to complete on time. The funds raised will go towards completing the art in a timely manner to the expected quality, as well as the manufacturing of the physical rewards. 

Both manufacturing and fulfilment are already lined up and are being done with companies where we have an existing relationship, having printed and delivered books and games around the world previously. Given that The Gaia Complex is a new IP, we made the decision to run a 'simple' campaign, free from a long list of add-ons and physical rewards to allow us to move through the manufacturing and fulfilment process with relative ease and with minimal chance for complication.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
High quality printing with the best possible binding. Books printed in this manner can stand the test of time and the rigours of the gaming table.
Reusability and recyclability
Being a printed book, the product itself it entirely recyclable - though anyone doing so would make us very sad! Packaging will be done with cardboard book sleeves (or boxes for multiple purchases), using recyclable packing materials wherever possible.
Environmentally friendly factories
We are printing our books with a well respected and reputable print house who have established quality supervising control matching ISO 9001:2001 standard and environmental management system matching ISO 14001:2004 standard.

They also have a commitment to using as much of an ecological printing process as possible, promoting rational paper use and reducing paper waste to a minimum.

updates.update_content: Hi all,

It was blinking red. Illuminating the darkness one pulse at a time, casting its crimson veil over everything around them. He had become strangely aware that over the last eleven minutes and forty-three seconds he had somehow become concerningly in-tune with this single red beacon, his heart beat now pumping in time with every blink.
He tried to play a game with it, concentrating on his breathing, slowing his heartbeat, just like he’d been taught back when he was just a corporate grunt for Telwe Morton Peaks. They all got that kind of bullshit training; what to do if you got caught on a job, how to resist torture and the like. It seemed funny that the only time he managed to use that training was now, trying to outsmart a light bulb.

Hi all,
We're back again with our monthly progress update.
Firstly, how are you all? Leave us a comment and let us know if you've maanged to get any gaming in, now that large parts of the world are starting to meet face-to-face again. We hope you're all staying safe, but more importantly, we hope you're all staying happy!

Hi everyone!
Wow - where has the last month gone!?
I hope everyone is doing well, keeping busy and maybe even getting the chance to play a few games! As the UK comes close to lifting 'lockdown', the excitement of seeing other human beings again is almost too much to handle!
Hi all,

Hi all,
I hope everyone is doing well!
It's been a week since our campaign ended and things have been moving really well at our end. We're still a week or so away from Kickstarter releasing the funds to us, but that hasn't stopped some great progress. As such, we thought we'd put together this progress update, the likes of which I am to share at least once a month as move towards publication of the book.

The world is a mess, and shipping prices are greatly in flux to and from most parts of the world - to get our backers the best shipping rates we can, and avoid having to add hefty shipping fees on the campaign to ensure we budget for any eventualities, we'll be charging the shipping on your pledge through the PledgeManager (the survey we send out to get your details). Below are our best estimates on shipping rates based on the most recent information we have from our fulfillment partners.

Worldwide Shipping Estimates – See below for more info
Backer Priority Guarantee
No copies of the retail or Kickstarter edition of the game, its expansions or extras to be made available for sale by Inside the Box online or offline until all pledges are in transit from regional depot to backer, not including retailer backers.

Retailer Guarantee
No distribution sales or retail sales outside of the campaign until at least 1 month after all pledges are in transit from regional depot to backer. Preorders or presales will not be shipped until after the 1 month period is up.
  50% Deposit for verified Retailers, 50% due on fulfillment.

Refund Policy
No questions asked. If you want a refund, for whatever reason, just ask us via Kickstarter message. Unfortunately we can't recover Kickstarter fees, but we're happy to refund the whole amount up until we ship your pledge.

Friendly Shipping [UK, EU, US, Aus, Can]
All pledges will be shipped 'customs friendly' to at least the United Kingdom, Canada, the EU, the United States, Australia. This means no importation fees or additional taxes to pay. They're all handled by us!
We will work to include as many countries and territories as customs friendly as is possible with our fulfillment partners.

Project Timeline
We've planned ou the campaign as follows! January-February will be this campaign! In Late February, after the project has (hopefully!) funded, we will send out the PledgeManager survey to all backers. In March we will distribute the eBooks and the Digital Fan Packs. During April and May we will be finalising all of the additional files and any additional artwork as well as performing a final check on all assets. June we will work with the factory to complete all the file preparation for printing. July and August will be occupied by manufacturing the books, extras and recharge pack components. September and October will be when everything is packaged up by the factory, freighted to regional fulfillment centres around the world and organised at the warehouses for sending out. November, will be when we start fulfilling pledges, providing things go broadly to plan. We've factored in plenty of wiggle room at every stage of the process, and have planned it all out well in advance to get Alba to you as quickly as we can.
If you're a hobby store, toy store, book store or anyone else that would like to stock Alba, let us know! During the campaign we'll be offering additional discounts to our regular retailer rates. Retailer backers will receive their pledges at the same time as any other backer, meaning you'll get your copies at least 30 days before any other stores. Once we've got you a quote sorted, you'll back through this campaign like any other backer - we'll explain exactly what to do. We provide commercial invoices for all trade orders. Send us a message on Kickstarter!
About the team
Inside the Box and our plucky team of contributors have been working on Alba for a long while, and we're excited for this to be our first release in our Open World Adventure Book series. We've got exciting plans for more titles, exploring unusual and intricate worlds!

H.L. Truslove, who regularly refers to themself as a 'writing goblin' is a creative writer who has worked on a range of roleplaying game adventures for their local group, as well as contributing to the artfulscribes writing group at the Mayflower Theatre. This is H.L.'s first published full length novel and we're proud to be the ones to bring it to the world.

Marco Luna, human to a literal million dogs, is the talented and versatile illustrator behind a range of Inside the Box projects including Sub Terra II, Aquanauts and now Alba. Marco has worked on a staggering range of professional projects from corporate branding through to developing his own video games. 

H.L. and Marco were brought together in this exciting new project by the team at Inside the Box, I mean Book...

Inside the Box designs develops and publishes a wide range of tabletop games from survival horror coop games to deeply immersive puzzle experiences.
Watch our interview with writer H.L. Truslove discuss the process of creating Alba!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The Coronavirus pandemic has substantially affected the entire games industry throughout the whole pipeline from designer to manufacturer, and we're no exception. After nearly and entire year of lockdown and working from home, our team has adjusted to this new paradigm and has got a solid plan for how to deliver this project in that context.

Although we don't expect any delays, manufacturer errors, delays to freighting, at import or during the fulfillment process can throw off our expectations for getting you Alba. We've done our due diligence and planned out the who what where and how of the manufacturing process, the lead times, the freight and the fulfillment already, so that we're only accounting for unexpected delays. The layouts of the book, stickers, envelope, extras and all the other bits and bobs are complete. All ready to go.

Everything offered as an add-on is either ready to print, or is already in the process of proofing with the manufacturer.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
We've worked hard with our manufacturing partners to ensure that all our products live on your bookshelf as long as you want them to, a long time! We don't cut corners on quality, and always push for the best possible materials to make our games and books from so that even a well worn and loved copy of our game will be playable again and again. Additionally we push everything we make to be made to play again, whether that's a game that has lots of variations or something that has a narrative flair with ways of recharging or redoing a campaign. We don't want any of our games to become redundant once they've been played once.
Reusability and recyclability
Everything that looks like it can be recycled, can be. Everything else is either biodegradable, recycleable or marked clearly. Principally, our games are made to last, both in terms of wear as well as the motivation to keep them, being good!
Sustainable materials
We're leading the way in the games industry on attaining FSC certification on all our games where any paper products are used, as well as innovating with our manufacturers to eventually achieve 100% plant-based materials in our entire pipeline, including shrink wrap, plastic miniatures, pallet binding and more. We're also performing an entire pipeline audit of materials used in our products or materials used in their production to ensure the entire process from ink to bookstore is sustainable, environmentally and socially friendly.
Environmentally friendly factories
We only work with the best teams, and the teams willing to innovate hard. We continue to find new ways to improve how we make our stuff, and we'll only ever work with those with the same vision of a way to make games without harming people or planet.
Sustainable Distribution
Packaging is a necessary evil in getting you those things, but we now excusively use biodegradable or recycleable packaging and filler materials at the fulfilment stage for all our projects across the world, and have pushed hard to ensure our manufacturer does the same with freight packing.

We will use the freight method to get the bulk of the stuff to the local regions where they will be fulfilled directly to backers that minimises overal footprint. This is likely to be a choice between sea and rail freight. Given the impact sea freight has on ocean biomes, we will opt for railfreight where economically feasible.
Something else
We're in the process of working towards climate zero accreditation for the entire company, with the help of Climate Zero, another Kickstarter funded org!

updates.update_content:
Hello, Explorers!
Great news for you today - we won’t be talking about shipping! Instead, we’ll be talking about the project progress we’ve made in the last few months 🎉
Arguably even better news, everything’s clipping along as expected, meaning we haven’t hit any delays!

But Weight, there’s more!

Due to popular demand, we’re going to be sharing the actual weights for our main products, as well as the full list of shipping prices. For consistency, we’ve used kilograms (kg) or grams (g) throughout the update, but have provided weight bands for shipping in both kg and ounces.

First off, how do shipping weight bands work?

Hello, Adventurers!
Just a quick update today! We’ll be going over the updated files available in backerkit, a bit more information about the updated shipping prices, and how to grab add-ons with any overpayment you’ve made!

Updated files

Hello Adventurers!

Shipping rate changes have now gone live in BackerKit!

Shipping Revisions Info

Hey there Adventurers!
Thank you to all of you who helped us to recognise the issues with the shipping solutions, and provided us with constructive feedback. It's helpful to know when there's an issue, however tricky that is, or however difficult it might be for us to hear. We're committed, as ever, to working on making everything as great as we can for every backer - so thank you, we think that we've made some good improvements so far, and we hope to be able to find more!

Adventurers.

It's been a hardcore couple of days, but we've got a lot of information to share with you. We promised, after we launched the Backerkit and many of you were rightly dismayed at the cost of shipping to some regions rising by such a substantial amount, that we would roll up our sleeves and get to work, so that's exactly what we did.

It’s Kaysi, the Comms Assistant here! Just wanted to check in with you all to let you know I hear you and I completely understand your frustrations regarding Alba’s shipping costs. 

Why is it so expensive?
We did not expect such a leap between the estimated rates and final costs. Regarding our estimates, these figures were given to us by our Fulfillment Partners prior to the campaign. Usually, these figures are updated very infrequently (about once a year or so), but due to Brexit and overall global shipping chaos, this has changed rapidly (the UK post office has already upped prices three times recently).

Hello, Explorers!
The BackerKit has officially launched to ALL BACKERS! The smoke test went out last night, meaning some of you lucky humans have already been able to fill in your surveys. We’re really glad BackerKit has this feature, as it means we could sort out some technical issues - such as the digital rewards not actually being attached!

Hello, Explorers!
A quick update on the BackerKit! Everything is in and sorted on our end, and we’re expecting them to approve it by the end of their day today, given the maximum amount of time the approval process can take. Since BackerKit is based in the USA and we’re based in the UK, that means it should be approved in the next 8-10 hours.
As soon as the BackerKit has been approved, we’ll be sending out the smoke test, and shortly thereafter we’ll be pressing go on the entire project, meaning you’ll have access to your digital rewards and can confirm shipping!

Hello Explorers!
As we said last week, this past Friday we received the final artwork for the book, and also the final edit by our wonderful proofreader!
Our talented Art Director Liam has been hard at work making all the changes necessary to the digital files, which we’ll be putting in BackerKit. This means you’ll be able to download it directly, pretty much as soon as you get the email. Although there weren’t any major changes to the text, there were a lot of small ones (things like commas being inconsistently used over other punctuation, like my beloved semicolon).

LAND OF THE RISING SUN
"Engage in combat fully determined to die and you will be alive; wish to survive in the battle and you you will surely meet death."
Uesugi Kenshin
"In this world love has no colour - yet how deeply my body is stained by yours."
Izumi Shikibu (c.976 - 1040 CE)
"As a Samurai, I must strengthen my character; as a human being I must perfect my spirit."
Yamaoka Tesshu

Land of the Rising Sun , was first published in 1980, using the 1st Edition Chivalry & Sorcery game mechanics.  Described at the time as "an estimable addition to a FRP aficionado's library. Aside from being well-explained, it is necessary for those who want to fully understand C&S. The care with which Japanese myth has been reproduced is simply amazing."
With the new 5th edition of Chivalry & Sorcery being streamlined and more playable, it was only right that we worked with Lee Gold (winner of three Origins awards) once more to update Land of the Rising Sun to the new edition, brand-new edition is bigger and better than ever before, and for the first time ever is brought to you as a full colour hardcover book.  This is the first full blown setting expansion for Chivalry & Sorcery 5th edition and adds additional rules to the core rule book.
The books will be printed by the same source as the C&S Core Rule book with a full colour hardcover complete with reading ribbon and silk paper.  Comparable with many books from other major games companies.
Exclusive to this Kickstarter, we’re offering a special Collector’s Edition (see cover, below). The Collector’s Edition will not be available through normal retail channels outside of this Kickstarter.
                                              Kickstarter Exclusive Collectible Cover

Land of the Rising Sun is fully written, edited, and laid out. Backers will receive a PDF once funds clear at the closing of the Kickstarter. As it’s ready for printing, we are confident that we’ll have everything printed by April 2021, with shipping to commence immediately afterwards...backers at or above the £35 Samurai Pledge can expect to have their books in May of this year. Please, join us as we raise funds to complete the printing of this wonderful tome that’s over 300 pages of glorious colour—Land of the Rising Sun!
Land of the Rising Sun covers the late Classical period of Japan, through the middle of the Feudal period, circa 850–1500 CE. Character generation follows a similar path as in 5th Edition Chivalry & Sorcery, giving you and your players the tools to create characters from Samurai to Ninja.
The Magick rules draw on the Japanese elements of Air, Earth, Fire, Metal, Water and Wood, while the Religion rules allow people to play Buddhist or Shinto Priests, adding other branches of religion to those found in Chivalry & Sorcery.
With Land of the Rising Sun you will be able to create your very own version of Feudal Japan, whether you include the various elements of Folklore and Myth or go for a pure Historical campaign for the right to be Shogun.
Land of the Rising Sun is an expansion for Chivalry & Sorcery 5th Edition and will require the C&S 5th edition core rule book. You will be able to create your very own version of Feudal Japan; whether you include various elements of Folklore and Myth or go for a pure Historical campaign for the right to be Shogun, is completely up to you.

To enhance your experience of  playing in the Land of the Rising Sun setting we recommend the Test of Honour miniatures from Grey for Now Games  https://testofhonour.com/

Lee Gold - The Author
One of the first female contributors to the hobby, Lee Gold became prominent after 1975 as the editor of Alarums and Excursions, a monthly amateur press association to which RPG writers have contributed over the years. It won the Charles S. Roberts Award for Best Amateur Wargame Magazine in 1984, and the Origins Award for Best Amateur Game Periodical in 2000, 2001, and 2002.
Her professional credits in the RPG field include Land of the Rising Sun (1980) and Lands of Adventure, (1983) published by Fantasy Games Unlimited; GURPS Japan, published by Steve Jackson Games; and Vikings, published by Iron Crown Enterprises.  
Gold was listed in the 'Top 50 Most Influential People in the Adventure Game Market for Y2000'

So its Wednesday and we closing slowly towards the second stretch goal and we would like to take this opportunity to introduce our two Japanese Consultant Cultural Editors
 Yuki Ishida - Japanese Consultant Cultural Editor
Yuki Ishida is a Japanese-English translator from Saitama, Japan. He’s a global business and liberal arts student currently studying at an international university in Akita, Japan. Yuki has a long interest in Japanese history. This is his first game project.
 Kana Onishi - Japanese Consultant Cultural Editors
Kana Onishi is a freelance Japanese-English translator and editor currently living in Poland. She is a former assistant art gallery curator who specialises in translating and editing creative works, including literature, films and interviews. This is her first gaming project.

Andrew Hepworth - Cover Artist 
Since turning freelance in 2003 Andrew has a had a varied career, working in fantasy, educational, comic, partwork illustration, book adaptation, and concept design for game, film, and TV. Clients include Alderac Entertainment, Cubicle 7, DeAgostini, Osmo Productions, Games Workshop, White Wolf CCP, and Tern TV.

Lissanne Lake - Interior Artist
Lissanne is a New Jersey-based freelance illustrator with more than 25 years experience across a wide range of media, including book covers, magazines, tarot cards, gallery exhibitions, street murals, and yes, trading card games. Lissanne’s artwork has graced classic CCGs such as Age of Empires, Legend of the Five Rings, Mythos, and the Warhammer 40K CCG.

Graeme Davis - Stretch Goals Author
Graeme published his first paying article in 1982 and has worked as a staff and freelance writer since 1986. He helped develop Games Workshop’s blockbuster Warhammer fantasy game setting and White Wolf’s Gothic classic Vampire: the Masquerade.
Moving to video games in the early 90s, he has worked on over 40 shipped titles including two installments in the award-winning Total War historical strategy series and the chart-topping mobile strategy game Kingdoms of Camelot: Battle for the North. His employers and clients have included Microsoft, Microprose, America Online, Hasbro Interactive, SEGA, and Kabam.

The Stargate SG-1 Roleplaying Game is an officially licensed sci-fi tabletop game where you assume the role of a member of Stargate Command. As an SG team member, you and your teammates will go on missions, guided by a Gatemaster, in the fight against the Goa'uld and other threats. The game is based on the D&D 5th Edition Open Gaming License. Backing this project makes you among the first to join up with the Stargate program at the Phoenix Site!
The Core Rulebook will contain the options for creating and advancing your character, running a "season of episodes" as a Gatemaster for your friends, and new original content (planets, races, Goa’uld).
Standard Edition is a full-color, hard-bound book, which contains over 360 pages of core rules needed to create characters and everything you need to run a Stargate SG-1 campaign, plus a foreword by David Read.
Special Edition is a Kickstarter Exclusive, full-color, leather-bound book that contains over 360 pages of core rules needed to create characters and everything you need to run a Stargate SG-1 campaign, plus a foreword by David Read.
You might ask, why is it that we want a Kickstarter for a Stargate SG-1 Roleplaying Game? The answer is simple. We want you, the fans, to help us on this journey to create the best possible Stargate SG-1 game ever produced. This is about collaborating with you, the fans. It is a game for you, and it should have input from you!
By backing this project at level SG-2 and above, you will be part of our development team. Upon the completion of the campaign, we will open up our development forum to this group to give you direct access to the game designers. This will give you the ability to:
Provide feedback about the Core Rulebook story and mechanics prior to the final publication
Early Playtest and give feedback on all upcoming "episodes" of the Stargate SG-1 Living Roleplaying Game Series 
In-game reward in the Stargate SG-1 Living RPG Series of being awarded the title of "Founder" for the town of Haven. This gains you an advantage on social checks within the town of Haven.
Obtain the “Development Team” designation tag for your avatar in the StargateTheRPG.com forums
Be the first to know about and participate in very special online play sessions with Special Guest Stars!
  All that said, our open beta playtest is live! The open beta has been open since February and will remain open for at least one month after the end of the Kickstarter. Updates during the campaign will detail out how to provide feedback.
Gameplay with David Blue, David Hewlett, Simone Bailly, Alexis Cruz, Rainbow Sun Francks, and Julie McNiven.

You can also download our pre-generated characters on our website, here.
As more and more of these worlds began to rise up, the President authorized the creation of an off-world training base named the Phoenix Site. Headed up by General P.K. Loyer, this site would bring together and train freedom fighters from worlds oppressed by the Goa'uld System Lords. 
Once trained, these highly functional SG teams would be sent on missions to defend the galaxy and overthrow the Goa'uld System Lords. You are a member of one of these teams.
From the perspective of the Stargate SG-1 TV series, our story with the Phoenix Site picks-up after the episode titled "Allegiance" in season 6, episode 9. The rebel Jaffa and Tok'ra come together with the Tau'ri at the Alpha Site to discover the base has been compromised. This leads to the initial authorization for the use of the Phoenix Site to bring together the best of the best from around the galaxy.
The world of Stargate SG-1 is perfect for a tabletop roleplaying game. Every time you play, you can step through the gate and wind up in nearly any type of environment. Do you want to save Earth? The Galaxy? You can! The Goa’uld threat is looming! Band together to find new allies, explore old ruins, and find advanced technology. The options are endless.
The following are some of the unique features of the Stargate SG-1 RPG in comparison to other 5th edition games:
● A Stargate Program Brief which details all we know in the Stargate canon leading up to season 7. This includes new Goa'ulds, planets, allies, and life forms.
● Classless Leveling after 5th Level.
● New Encounter types beyond Combat, such as: convince, research & development, aerial combat, pursuit, firefight, and many others.
● New Campaign System that guides you on how to create a campaign like you would a TV Series of your very own.
● Facility Building Mechanics.
● Determination Points.
● Moxie for social turn order.
Because we are basing the game on the 5th edition open gaming license, you will find the layout of the book and the character creation process very familiar. However, we have been inspired by many other RPG systems beyond 5th edition, and we believe we have brought together the best of what is out there. You will also find some very innovative mechanics of our own.
We’d like to thank our playtesters and reviewers that have helped make the Stargate SG-1 Roleplaying Game a great game!

We strive to create games that are simple enough to dive in and start playing within 15 minutes, while staying complex enough to keep even the most crunchy board game strategist coming back.
This will be our sixth title for Wyvern Gaming. The previous five: Cthulhu: A Deck Building Game, Onami, Short Order Hero, Sojourn, and Cthulhu: The Horror in Dunwich — all have only become real games because of people like you who supported us on Kickstarter.
Shipping is an interesting monster, and we considered the best method, which is also the most accurate and fair. Due to the nature of Kickstarter, it is hard to know the final cost of shipping until all the stretch goals have been tallied and the final weight can be considered.
Rather than taking a guess, we plan to accurately charge for shipping after the campaign ends during the pledge manager. We will then charge you based on your location and the weight of the final order.
We have partnered with fulfillment centers in each global region to handle fulfillment for the Stargate SG-1 Roleplaying Game. Because of this, we are happy to offer Worldwide Customs Friendly Shipping.
If for any reason, you encounter any surprise customs charges during fulfillment, contact us at gamemaster@wyverngaming.com and we will take care of it. Simple.
For an extra bit of peace of mind: If you feel like your shipping cost is unreasonable once we get the final shipping rates, you can cancel your pledge and we will give you a full refund of what we collected from you, minus the 10% Kickstarter collects.
