campaign.story:
Kickstarted in 2018 and released globally in 2019, SINS is an award-winning, supernatural post-apocalyptic tabletop roleplaying game focused on telling the stories of powerful entities known as Nemissaries - reborn individuals back from the dead with a wealth of mysterious powers, who have risen once more to fight an eldritch hive-mind of the undying, known as the Brood, in the post-apocalyptic ruins of a 22nd Century Earth.
 SINS is a boldly unique indie TTRPG that crosses many genres and styles of play, and takes its core inspirations and cues from games and IPs such as Tribe 8, Exalted, and World of Darkness games. If you enjoy any of those games, or franchises such as The Last of Us, Horizon: Zero Dawn, The Walking Dead or Fallout, we think SINS might just be the roleplaying game for you.
 If you're relatively new to RPGs or haven't played many other systems beyond Dungeons and Dragons, SINS uses a quick and simple D6-based engine that's beginner-friendly and easy to learn, whilst retaining a mechanical depth that keeps your game active and engaging, moment to moment.
SINS: Manifest Destiny is the long-awaited follow-up to the first book; it is a huge expansion on the material, mechanics and lore of the corebook, and this Kickstarter intends to fulfil a physical print-run and distribution.
If you've missed out on SINS up to now but think it might be for you, don't worry! You can pick up a copy on our website here, add a copy to your pledge in the add-ons, or find us on DriveThruRPG.  If you backed the hugely popular Itch Bundle for Racial Justice, you'll also find a .PDF copy of the Core Rulebook included in there! 
To learn more about SINS, check out the original Kickstarter page, our website, follow us on Twitter, or check out our community discord!
SINS: Manifest Destiny is an expansion which sets out to expand upon SINS' Core Book in a number of ways. Taking place around twenty years after the general timeline of the Core Rulebook, this expansion focuses on the myriad factions and organisations that are beginning to establish themselves upon the Post-Fall East Coast of America. 
As each Faction turns their sights to the horizon, their interests and machinations begin to clash, and the human evils of  expansionism and the wrongs of Old America are beginning to resurface. As Eldritch powers expand their domains and long-forgotten horrors stir in the ashes of the Fall, it falls to the Nemissaries, and the new generations of the continent, to forge a better future.  A new era is beginning, and despite the struggles of the Fall, the sins of the past must not be allowed to repeat themselves again.  
The book's central focus is on the United States, though much of the content in this book can be adapted and used for other regions in the world. The core content covers;

The Great Wastes: You’ll find in this book an overview of the central regions of North America, along with extra information regarding areas of the East Coast. This information also includes a look at the history and the downfall of the American centre, lays out why the area has remained largely unexplored until now, and how you can utilise the area in your campaigns.

 Factions New and Old: Along with the expanded information on the central states, the biggest focus of this book is on providing a wealth of new mechanical options for players and Games Masters in regards to the original factions, along with the introduction of two new Major Factions; the Stormland Empire and the Park Rangers.
 This book also includes additional information on the existing Minor Factions, along with a new Minor Faction, the Bone Dragon’s Realm. Further, you will also find some extra useful information on independent settlements and how to integrate them into your games.

New Equipment and Vehicle Rules: A lot of fans have asked for vehicle rules for SINS since its release, and we’re glad to say we can finally deliver on that. As such, you’ll find a full system for using vehicles both in and out of combat, along with a variety of both universal and faction-specific vehicles.
Die Historic on the Post-Fall Roads.

The book also introduces a wealth of new equipment, with particular focus on Pre-Fall military hardware that allows human characters to give errant Nemissaries a run for their money, or stand side-by-side as powerful allies.

Secrets and Nightmares: SINS' Core Rulebook raised as many mysterious questions as it answered in regards to the setting’s lore, and this supplement – whilst not answering everything – pulls back the veil on a number of issues and gives a clearer insight into the Black Rain, the Reapers, and The Mother.
 In the same vein, Manifest Destiny expands upon the Harbingers and the Lost Children, providing new lore and mechanics for both antagonist factions, along with new rules for the Hivespawn and the nightmarish Reaper known as Blacklight.

Radiation and the Blightspawn: No exploration of the Post-Fall American Interior and its horrors would be complete without a proper look at radiation and its effects. This includes mechanics for dealing with the physical effects of radiation in general, and the more abstract consequences for those beings capable of wielding Anima.
Manifest Destiny also includes the introduction of a new form of Broodspawn known as the Blightspawn, which thrive in radioactive areas. These new enemies have new mechanics and have a distinctly different horror theme and narrative feel to standard Broodspawn, making for an exciting new addition to any campaign.

Never Underestimate Humanity: Nemissaries, in the Core Book of SINS, had things their own way. Human opponents were simply no match for them, but all that changes with Manifest Destiny's in-depth look at the Artificers and their arsenals of powered armour and advanced post-fall weaponry.

This Kickstarter aims to fulfil the printing and distribution of physical copies of SINS: Manifest Destiny. It's a book we've worked hard on over the past two years since SINS' launch, and the expansion has grown considerably in size and content since we initially spoke of its development as something we'd be able to realise as stretch-goal in our original campaign. Now, it's finished and ready for print. We want to get it in your hands in the best possible way; a high-quality hardback print to use beside your corebook. 
Rest assured, if you backed the Kickstarter for SINS: The Roleplaying Game at any level, you are already due to receive a PDF copy of SINS: Manifest Destiny. That's what we promised back in 2018, and it's what we'll deliver.

As this Kickstarter serves as a way to fulfil a project we announced some time ago, should we hit goal, we'll be keeping any stretch goals simple and maximising the immediate benefit to our fans and supporters. More money will equal more art and more content. The book currently stands at approximately 210 pages and we're looking to raise £5000 to fulfil a reasonable order of prints. That said, the more the merrier, so should we exceed our goal we've drawn up a list of some awesome additional features and accessories we'll be able to offer.



MORE ART/ART BOOSTER: Exactly what it sounds like! With each of these goals hit, we'll be able to bump up the already respectable amount of art in SINS: Manifest Destiny, with more stunning illustrations from Will, further bringing the world of SINS to life.

Additional Bestiary: SINS: Manifest Destiny is already packed-out with a collection of fearsome foes and cunning adversaries, but this is a collection of miscellaneous enemy & NPC profiles we couldn't fit into the book - a handy resource for any GM, available as a free .PDF to all backers! 

POST-FALL ROAD MAP:  A replica road map of the East Coast of America, as if it were printed in the post-fall world, complete with territory borders and significant settlement locations. An invaluable play-aid, prop and tool for any SINS GM, as well as a high-quality display piece.

DOMINION PIN: a stylishly subtle Black Metal & Crimson Enamel pin with a white spot finish, of the Hierarch Dominion flag, so you can represent everyone's favourite outcast peacekeepers.

SEW-ON PATCH:A fabric military-style patch, ready to be attached to your favourite jacket. We're still working on which Faction flag(s) will work best for the highest quality finish in the threadwork, so check back in if we hit this goal!

VOIDGLASS DICE:The Bone-white and Blood Red die from our last KS were a runaway success, and we'd love to look into more realisations of SINS' textures for your dice. We've plans for smoky black die with matt finishes, the production of which we can realise with higher funding.

More to Follow! - Kickstarters are always exciting times, with each day (hopefully) bringing new developments and opportunities to projects - should we hit goal, be sure to check back regularly for any updates and news on the potential stretch goal additions and opportunities we can undertake for the future of SINS, and what goalposts we'll need to hit to achieve them.

We understand the global situation of trade and shipping has been ever-changing recently, but we want to ensure we can get this physical book in as many hands as we can, as affordably as possible. Wherever you might be pledging and supporting from, be sure to check out this handy chart for approximate costs before pledging.
We know it's been a difficult year for small businesses, and we want to do what we can to support our local brick & mortar shops and FLGS' in a time of online shopping. As such, we've brought back the Retailer pledges we offered in our last Kickstarter, with these three Retail Pledge Tiers reserved for stores to order copies of SINS: Manifest Destiny, along with copies of SINS: The Core Rulebook. Please don't pledge for these tiers as an individual, as we do reach out to the pledgers of these tiers individually to validate their business and organise  wholesale transactions and store shipments, but be sure to recommend our Kickstarter to your FLGS if SINS is something you like the look of - having a local stockist of the core rulebook is a sure-fire way to get campaigns going in your area!
Our books are Nice. Like, AAA Nice. Being the same development team and using the same printers, we can assure you the physical print, layout and presentations of Manifest Destiny will be equally high quality.
SINS: The Corebook, and the special edition of DEAD CITY, the prequel adventure.
SINS: Manifest Destiny retains the same polished interior layout of the Core Rulebook.

Black & White Special Editions: As some long-time followers may be aware, SINS: The Corebook launched with some Kickstarter-exclusive and later Convention-exclusive covers. Some of you may even be lucky enough to possess the all-black Voidglass or all-white Arietta gloss finish covers for the corebook. For those avid collectors or people who want to add that extra flourish to their collection, we've instituted higher pledges for Manifest Destiny with covers in the all-black and all-white varieties to match their corebook counterparts. The contents of these special edition books are exactly the same, with only different covers and reverses. As before, the white covers will be finished with a gloss spot varnish, and the black covers with a muted silver varnish.


  In addition to the black and white gloss covers for Manifest Destiny, we are also proud to offer a new, boutique rendition of SINS for collectors, exclusively available through this Kickstarter. 

Made possible through a collaboration with Chris Jones, an independent bookbinder and artist, the Shard Keeper's Collection is a hand-bound SINS compendium set, including copies of both SINS: Manifest Destiny, and SINS: The Core Rulebook. 
With distressed leather coverings, stitched case bindings and ribbon markers, these books are adorned with trinkets and minutiae befitting a citizen of the esoteric 22nd Century. SINS: The Core Rulebook is fashioned as an mysterious tome, marked with the SINS' mythos symbols and distressed to your liking, whilst SINS: Manifest Destiny is fashioned after a turn-of-the-century outdoor survival guide. 
The two books will be packaged together in a high-quality, waxed leather backpack, branded with a subtle symbol of the Hierarch Dominion - so they're all ready to be taken on the road (or to your bookshelf, for safe-keeping!)  
The interiors of these books will be hand-bound, though their contents will be the same as retail copies of the respective books.
a sneak preview of a prototype we're working on...

Each Handbook bundle will be hand-made, and due to their artisan craftsmanship, this pledge is strictly limited to 7 Copies - each one is a unique creation, made with skill, craftsmanship and care. 


SINS is a labour of love, made by a small independent team based in Sheffield. We are;

Sam Sleney: Creative Director, editor, and captain of our apocalyptic ship. Once this campaign launches, Sam will be living in the comments section like a SINS sage, answering any questions on what this book does and what you can do with it. You can find him on twitter as @samsleney.

Miquel Tankard & Russell Meader: Wordsmith power-couple and cat-keepers.  Miquel and Rusti have a hand in every part of SINS' production, from the writing to the graphic design. SINS is Miquel's brainchild, and though we all foster it with care in the hopes it will not grow up and consume us, we fear it may now be too late. 

Ben Warren: our London-based contributor, Ben was the creative force behind the new Park Rangers and the Stormland Empire. When he isn't writing or self-publishing his own games, Ben obsesses over dinosaurs, drinks too much coffee and tinkers with innumerable RPG campaign ideas. He can be found on twitter as @BenMaxWarren.

Gavin Jones: Layout extraordinaire, Gavin turns our words into your pages. A champion for readability and accessibility, Gavin ensures our madness can be read on as many devices as possible, in as comfortable way as possible.

Will Kirkby: Our illustrator, Will brings the world of SINS to life with his unique, signature style of bold artwork. Will is an artist who has worked for Dark Horse, Image, Oni Press and other companies in comics, as well as illustrating the SINS core book. He also works as a self published comics-creator and sometimes artist for Critical Role. You can see more of his work on Twitter, as @chamonkee.

Paul Moore: Business and Distributions, Paul manages our shipping, deliveries and print production, and it's in his name we run our Kickstarters. He didn't write anything here though, nor does he handle anything creatively. Please do not @ him about Nemissaries, ghouls, souls or other such fluff, but do @ him about deliveries, shipping and fulfilment. 
For those of you looking to add more to your pledge, we have a few options available at a lower price than their usual RRP - at the moment, these are, but not limited to;

 SINS: The Core Rulebook:  For anyone who missed out, the 360-page, full-colour standalone rulebook can be added to a Manifest Destiny Pledge to complete your collection. Add-on Price: £35/$45 

 SINS GM Screen: A Four-Panel, high-quality GM Screen, illustrated with the SINS Creed symbol, a Destroyer-form Nemissary, and a hiding assailant. The reverse includes everything you could possibly need whilst running SINS, from weapons tables and basic rule recaps, to random encounter inspirations and prompt tables. Add-on Price: £12/$15 

 SINS: Dead City: A 36-page, softback prequel adventure that acts as a Quickstart guide to SINS as players play through the beginning of The Fall. A physical copy is the perfect way to kick off any SINS campaign. Add-on Price: £6/$8 

 Bone White D6: These beautiful D6 dice, cast in bone-white with Crimson Inlays have proven insanely popular since we unveiled them as part of the original launch Kickstarter - the Creed symbol upon the 6 clearly holds power. Add some to your pledge to get rolling in style. Add-on Price: £2/$2.50 or £15/$20 for 10. 

 Dice Tray: Ensure your dice don't tumble away with this crimson, skull-print neoprene All-Rolled Up™ Dice Tray. Add-on Price: £8/$10 

 Dice Bag: A perfect accompaniment to our dice, this white pouch is marked with a single, stark red skull. Add-on Price: £5/$6.50 

 Messenger Bag: A black shoulder-strap messenger bag, marked with the SINS skull. This is not the Park Rangers messenger bag that comes included with the Voidglass Tier pledge.  Add-On Price: £25/$33 

 Face Mask: Keep stragglers away with this face mask, printed with the snarling maw of a Broodspawn. Add-on Price: £15/$20 

 All Rolled-Up: Keep your stuff together in the Post-Apocalypse, with this pocketed, crimson red All-Rolled Up carrying sleeve. Holds dice, pencils and notebook in one easily folded sheet. Add-on Price: £20/$26
campaign.risks:

We recognise that the world is a very uncertain place right now, and especially for small businesses. Whatever happens, we'll fulfil this Kickstarter should it fund, even if it results in additional costs to us - this book has been a long time coming and we intend to see it through as a promise to our supporters. 

We have printing and distribution links and assurances already in place, and the PDF of this book was finished before the Kickstarter went live. Any possible delays in the fulfilment of the physical copies lie entirely in shipping delays - these may be a result of COVID-19, or the ongoing situation with the United States Postal Service. We are monitoring both situations closely and will make any necessary adjustments to ensure this book reaches you as quickly and efficiently as possible upon funding.

campaign.story:
The Gaia Complex is a cyberpunk RPG set on earth in 2119. Towards the end of the 21st century, the third world war, which became known as the Resource War, pushed mankind to the brink of destruction and brought ruin to the Earth’s atmosphere. Small pockets of humanity survived this horrific conflict, eventually forming the eleven metropolises. These incredible mega-cities have since grown and prospered, largely due to developments in atmospheric processing and significant technological advancements. Now cut off from each other, these heaving urban landscapes must each face their own difficulties and hardships. The Gaia Complex focuses on the largest of these metropolises; New Europe, a single sprawling city that covers much of what we currently know as mainland Europe. New Europe is a world of street violence, corporate espionage, vampiric uprisings and an overzealous A.I., known as Gaia, which functions as the city’s governor and the protector of its citizens.
The Gaia Complex is a dystopian world of urban violence, exploring the age of cybernetic enhancement through a vision of Earth that is somehow ‘changed’. This vision of the future injects both vampires and a strange species of people known as ferals, who are able to enter the minds of animals. This is a game of conspiracy and brutality, where players take on the roles of Mercs; former police officers, hackers and street-savvy dealers who are hired to fight back against the system and ultimately unravel the secrets of The Gaia Complex.
Of course we'd love you to back this campaign and be a part of making The Gaia Complex a reality, but before you do, maybe you want to give it a whirl for yourself? Good news - you can do this right now.
While this campaign and the updates throughout will talk about the game setting and rules, our free (well, 'pay what you want', but please, enter £0 and just grab a copy!) 48-page Quick Start for The Gaia Complex is out right now and will allow you to read and play for yourselves. This PDF contains a huge amount of lore surrounding the game, offering an in-depth insight to the world of The Gaia Complex and what it means to be a Merc in 2119. In addition, the booklet is jammed full of gorgeous artwork and gives you a good idea of what to expect from the full core book.
Go and grab your copy of the Quick Start by clicking this link (or the image below). 
The cast of playable characters from the Quick Start
The Gaia Complex core book will be 'at least' 256 pages of full-colour hardback beauty - take a look at the Quick Start for a general idea about how it will look. We say 'at least' as we have a whole host of extra content that we might just squeeze in, either through stretch goals, or becuase we end up deciding certain things just need to be there. 
At the time of launch, the core book writing is roughly 90% complete and layout for final proof-reading has already been completed for some chapters - this is a significant strength for this project, having completed so much of the writing ahead of launch. Artwork at this point is around 40% complete and new art is in the pipeline to be finished (and shown off) during the campaign. The art direction for this book is very important and great care is being taken to ensure the visuals support the writing as closely as possible.
The structure of the book is split over 12 chapters, plus an NPC (non-player character) library at the end. We'll go into more detail about the chapters over the coming weeks via the campaign updates, sharing some key information as we go. Alongside the rules, background and resources for playing the game, the book also includes multiple pieces of short fiction that slowly unfold the real story behind The Gaia Complex. These stories, and the characters they describe, lay the foundation for the world in which the game is set and allow us to explore New Europe in 2119 in much more cinematic detail. 
The engine behind The Gaia Complex is called 12.3 and can be taken for a test drive in our Quick Start by clicking HERE.
The basis of the system uses 2d12 (that's two twelve sided dice - but you're all roleplayers, so I'm sure you knew that!) to make the majority of tests on a 'roll under' basis. Whenever a test is required, the GM determines a potential difficulty for the test, ranging from 1 (easy for a child to accomplish) to 11 (impossibly hard). A character will compare the difficulty to their relevant statistic and if the stat is equal to or greater than the difficulty, the test is a success - There is an emphasis in the game on keeping the action flowing and not making tests unless they are really needed. 
If the character's stat is less than the difficulty, a test is required: the player rolls 2d12, requiring a result that is equal to or less than their relevant stat. An 11 fails (without cybernetic enhancement) and a 12 is a Critical Failure. To pass, a character requires one or both d12s to succeed depending on whether they are skilled or unskilled - The Gaia Complex does not consider 'ranks' in various skills like the majority of RPGs, instead a character either possesses a skill or does not (though becoming a specialist in certain skills is possible).
During combat, d3s are also used to determine damage - you can use funky d3s like the ones available on this campaign, or simply use common d6. The engine for the game uses d3s to enable a more consistant result when rolling multiple dice together and to remove the chance of whiffing a result of a 1 in situations that should always achieve a minium degree of success (thus 3d3+3 damage represents a weapon with more consistent output than one that does 1d12 damage) .
Of course, the game includes many other rules - some core, some optional - covering a huge array of options, but at its root, the game falls back on 12.3 to keep it rolling (pun intended).
During the course of the campaign we'll dedicate a couple of updates to specific areas of the rules and give you a deep dive into them beyond what you can get your hands on in the Quick Start.  
Characters in The Gaia Complex are known as Mercs. At their core, Mercs are citizens of New Europe who have chosen to rebel against the system and take up arms by making themselves available on the freelance market. The seedy clubs and bars of NeoMunich are the most common place to find Mercs and while their work is entirely illegal, there is enough anonymity that it isn't worth the expenditure of resources for Gaia or its police force to worry about shutting down the network.
Most Mercs are hired to run jobs against one of the many corporations in the metropolis. From hacking R&D servers to kidnapping, assassinating or Bio Hacking company execs; there are few limits when it comes to taking a job. Ironically, the primary employers are the corporations themselves, all looking to get a leg up over their rivals, employing Mercs to do the dirty work in order to maintain complete deniability. Of course, it's not just the heaving corporations that are the enemy; outsider vampires that lurk in the subway tunnels and outer fringes of the metropolis, the cybernetic police force controlled by the LE1 A.I. subsystem, or even Gaia itself - the all seeing ruler of the metropolis - everyone is a potential mark if the score looks big enough!
The core rules contains a detailed character creation process, allowing players to play either human or feral (a mysterious group of people who can enter the minds of the metropolis' animals) characters from one of ten varied roles, each with their own unique rules, benefits and style. Characters can choose from:
 Operator - Former law enforcement, corporate security and guns-for-hire that pack the hottest weapon tech that the black market has to offer.
 Core Hacker - Hackers and coders who live their lives in the digital pathways of The Core. 
 Bio Hacker - A new wave of hacker, dedicated to hacking the cybernetic brains of their targets and inducing 'forced servitude'.
 ParaMed - Former TactaMed paramedics who have realised they can earn more money patching up Mercs by being one of them!
 CyberDoc - Back-alley hackjob specialists and cybernetic installers. An often riskier, but cheaper approach, to main stream cybernetics clinics.
 MilTech - Weapons techs, tinkerers and specialist drone pilots. MilTechs keep the team's gear working and provide invaluable technical support.
 Mech - Drivers, pilots and expert mechanics. Mechs keep the metropolis rolling and give Merc teams much needed access to reliable transportation.
 Tech Trader - Black market dealers, handling everything from illegal weapons and stolen cybernetics, to narcotics and false credentials.
 Data Dealer - Information traffickers and dealers of stolen secrets. If there is something worth knowing, you can probably buy it... for a price.
 Handler - Exclusive to ferals. Handlers have dedicated themselves to honing the feral's ability to step into the mind of an animal. This is the feral in their purest form.
We'll be taking a more in-depth look into each of these roles as the campaign unfolds.
Data Dealer - Mech - Tech Trader - Core Hacker

Shipping... oh, my old nemesis! The state of global shipping at the time of this campaign going live is very much 'up in the air'. While most national postal services are getting close to resuming 'normal' operation following the initial COVID crisis, international shipments to many places are currently attracting very high tarrifs and long delays.
As we won't be shipping this book until next year, we are very hopeful that international shipping will have stabilised somewhat, both in terms of cost and reliability. In order to address this as best we can, we will not be charging shipping during the campaign and will not open the campaign's pledge manager to collect shipping until we are closing in on shipping your rewards.
DO NOT ADD MONEY FOR SHIPPING NOW. SHIPPING WILL BE CALCULATED AFTER THE CAMPAIGN BY THE PLEDGE MANAGER AND WILL BE CHARGED WHEN WE ARE CLOSE TO SHIPPING.
By handling shipping in this manner it ensures you are not over charged by needing to pay the current high tarrifs and allows us to better adjust our shipping strategy based on the state of the fulfilment industry at the time.
Due to this fact, it is very hard to provide accurate postage costs for your pledges, but the following values should serve as a benchmark, based on our fulfilment partner's (GMS) projections for the months ahead. Some areas, such as the US, are currently enforcing very large tariffs on shipping which is effecting the prices to ship parcels there. We hope that by the time we come to ship your rewards, tariffs such as these may have been reduced.
Though we are able to ship to most places (there are a few exceptions below), we are currently positioned to be able to ship UK, EU and US 'friendly' packages, meaning that backers in those territories will have thier packages shipped from within those territories, in order to avoid incurring additional fees beyond the shipping we charge. While we are investigating offering this service for other territories, we are unable to make any promises at the moment. All other destinations will have their packages shipped from the UK.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Though all Kickstarters come with some element of unseen risk, the team behind this project are well positioned to deliver on-time and as promised.

At the time of launch, the book is roughly 90% written, with a complete and heavily tested rules system, putting it well ahead of where one would consider a typical RPG book to be at the time of launching a kickstarter campaign. While there is a still a large amount of art to be completed, once again, the amount already finished is ahead of our initial expectations and puts us in a great place to complete on time. The funds raised will go towards completing the art in a timely manner to the expected quality, as well as the manufacturing of the physical rewards.

Both manufacturing and fulfilment are lined up and are being done with companies where we have an existing relationship, having printed and delivered books and games around the world previously. Given that The Gaia Complex is a new IP, we made the decision to run a 'simple' campaign, free from a long list of add-ons and physical rewards to allow us to move through the manufacturing and fulfilment process with relative ease and with minimal chance for complication.

Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
High quality printing with the best possible binding. Books printed in this manner can stand the test of time and the rigours of the gaming table.
Reusability and recyclability
Being a printed book, the product itself it entirely recyclable - though anyone doing so would make us very sad! Packaging will be done with cardboard book sleeves (or boxes for multiple purchases), using recyclable packing materials wherever possible.
Environmentally friendly factories
We are printing our books with a well respected and reputable print house who have established quality supervising control matching ISO 9001:2001 standard and environmental management system matching ISO 14001:2004 standard. 

They also have a commitment to using as much of an ecological printing process as possible, promoting rational paper use and reducing paper waste to a minimum.

updates.update_content:
Hi all,
Thank you so much for supporting us the first time around. We've invested time and energy into refining our offering, the art and the way that we present the game... finally, we're back on Kickstarter and we're live NOW!
You can find the new campaign here!
We would love for you to pop over and back us again, or at least take a peek at the new art etc.

Dear backers,
It is with great regret that we have decided to postpone the funding of this campaign until 2021. This decision doesn't come lightly, as after nearly 18 months of hard work, finally bringing this game to Kickstarter has been a true honour. We'd like to take a minute to explain the reasons behind our decision:
The campaign is heading towards the end of day two, still pushing through what should be considered prime funding time, where the majority of backers come onboard. Since switching the Mac on Today, we have had a total of only 10 new backers. Despite oodles of pre-promo and networking, advertising banners on major forums and sharing in all the usual places, the reach (or at least the conversion from casual visitor to backer) has been exceptionally low. On the current trajectory, we 'might' just squeeze over the line in 21 days, but it'll be a long road when we ultimately know it has not performed in a way that we'd have liked it to.

100 backers!!!
OK, so it's actually 106 at the time of writing, who's counting, right? :)
Over night, we moved from the 'almost there' count of 99 backers to the 'woop woop' count of 106. Thank you all SO MUCH for being a part of this project and helping to bring this game to life.

Thank you so much for backing The Gaia Complex!
Though it has been a slow start, we have just passed the 50% funded mark and we're still in the first 24 hours. This is awesome news! Thank you to everyone who has also shared the campaign with friends and on Facebook, Twitter and all manner of other social platforms that I try to avoid :)
Passing the 50% marker means that we're closing in on being funded, making this glorious book a reality and revealing a few of those stretch goals, which will allow us to add even more content to this already heaving tome.

Update number 1!
Hi all and thank you so much for being here. The Gaia Complex has been a labour of love that I've been writing for well over a year (and that's following countless years of concept work!). What you see presented here is the final result of that work and a game which I am not only proud of, but that I am also incredibly excited to get into your hands. The Gaia Complex combines a huge amount of world building with a series of short fiction and a bespoke rules system.

campaign.story:
The quickstart gives a taste of Hellboy: The Roleplaying Game. It includes pre-generated characters, a unique story and the rules required to start your adventure. Download by clicking the image below...
 Optional Extras are additional purchases that you can add to your pledge. If you would like an Optional Extra, simply increase your pledge amount by the cost of the chosen Optional Extra. After the Kickstarter has finished, the extra funds will be added to the pledge manager where you can select your chosen items.
Created by Mantic Games, the board game publisher behind Hellboy: The Board Game, and the team at Red Scar Publishing, Hellboy: The Roleplaying Game is a totally new way to experience the inspirational work of Mike Mignola.
In this standalone game, you become a member of the B.P.R.D. and build your character from the ground up. Will you be a researcher skilled in the study of the occult, a hard-nosed B.P.R.D. security agent, a rookie with hidden supernatural powers and more… the choice is yours.
Based on the hugely popular 5th Edition, we’ve made sure that Hellboy: The Roleplaying Game truly captures the experience of the graphic novels. We’ve added new mechanics – such as Doom and Ingenuity – along with unique classes and feats that drive the agents of the B.P.R.D. in their mission to wipe out supernatural threats.
When creating your agent, you’ll have a range of skills to choose from. Will you specialise in science, technology, investigations, or become an expert in the study of the occult? Making the most of your special skills will be key in piecing together the clues and completing the case.
As you create your unique agent, you must first choose their origin, including:
 Remarkable human – The Bureau attracts skilled people from around the world with a range of training that will be vital in the field.
 Psychic – Some individuals have supernatural powers that defy explanation.
 Ghosts – Bound to the mortal realm, these agents can interact with the physical world and use their ectoplasmic powers to turn the tide.
 The Cursed - From the undying, to the demonic (horns are optional), the vampiric, and the favoured servants of supernatural entities, the cursed have unique boons…but also banes.
 The Fae - Ranging from those who have gained the unseen kingdom’s favour, such as Alice Monaghan, or the replaced individuals who remain supplanted by the shapeshifters and servants of the Fae, they have insight to illusions and old magics and tales.
With your origin and role chosen, you will also be able to fully customise your agent using a selection of unique feats. Ranging from combat to supernatural and even B.P.R.D. specific, the variety of feats on offer will allow you to add truly distinct characteristics and flavour.
Of course, you’ll be heading into the field, so make you sure you prepare adequately. The equipment chapter offers a wide range of tools to aid an agent’s investigation. There is also a unique requisition and inventory system to make your gear selection run smooth and simply.
Can't make it to your RPG session? Don't worry, with the Backup Agents system you can still be involved with the game. Just like the board game, Backup Agents can be called in when things are getting tough to help the team. 
As well as a new agent, fresh to the B.P.R.D. there is also the option to play as legendary characters, like Abe Sapien, Liz Sherman, Johann Kraus and, of course, Hellboy himself! These are all pre-generated characters and are a great place for newcomers to start, especially if they’ve never experienced an RPG but want the thrill of punching a frog monster with the Right Hand of Doom.
As the GM, you’ll be able to create smaller case files or an entire chronicle, packed with twists and turns. Tell your own adventures set within the inspirational Mignola-verse and use your favourite Hellboy: The Boardgame miniatures of iconic villains to represent the monstrous challenges you must face, like the insidious frog monsters or Rasputin himself. 
During play, the GM and players will be able to add to the narrative through the innovative Doom and Ingenuity system. Doom is generated when players fail certain tests and gives the GM a pool of resources they can spend to advance the Grand Conspiracy or provide a narrative twist. Meanwhile, Ingenuity shines when agents pass a test with a stroke of brilliance. Ingenuity has a range of uses to help players solve the mission.
Just like the boardgame, you’ll have all you need to begin your adventures in the world of Hellboy and the B.P.R.D. campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
There are a number of risks with any Kickstarter project, especially getting accurate timings for such complex products with so many components. With this project, the writing is almost finished but will need final sign off from Dark Horse Comics and Mike Mignola. Once signed off, it will them be laid out and that will also need to be signed off. We have worked with Dark Horse and Mike Mignola on Hellboy: The Board Game, so don't anticipate this being an issue. The dice need to be tooled and then manufactured, the miniatures are already tooled and will just need to be manufactured. 

We predict that we will begin shipping in May 2021 - however, the exact timing is impossible to predict and there is always the potential for delay with products produced in China. We will of course keep our backers up to date as best we can once the project closes. 

To date, we’ve successfully fulfilled 18 Kickstarter campaigns: Kings of War, DreadBall, LOKA, Mars Attacks: The Miniatures Game, Deadzone, DreadBall Xtreme, Dungeon Saga, Kings of War 2nd Edition, Deadzone: Infestation, The Walking Dead: All Out War, DreadBall Second Edition, Star Saga: The Eiras Contract, Warpath, TerrainCrate, Kings of War: Vanguard, Hellboy: The Board Game and TerrainCrate 2. We currently have just one outstanding Kickstarter: League of Infamy (due to ship in November and currently in production). 

REFUNDS
Upon request full refunds may be given within 14 days of the campaign ending, including fees. Following that time, refunds may be given minus Kickstarter and payment fees. In order to request a refund you must contact support@manticgames.com

TERMS AND CONDITIONS
By backing this campaign you acknowledge that the components, artwork and game elements may change in the final edition. This means some elements may differ from those shown here following the Kickstarter campaign. Some elements are also subject to change due to licensor approval.

If you do not complete the pledge manager within the time specified when the pledge manager is sent, you agree that your contribution to the campaign was a donation and your pledge is fulfilled. Of course, we will use our discretion on a case by case basis. Completing the pledge manager is the ONLY way for us to confirm your shipping address and pledge details, as well as making sure we hit the production timelines.

By pledging on this Kickstarter you agree that you will pay for any shipping and any import or other duties required in your country. If you refuse to pay customs or duties and do not accept the package, it will be destroyed and you will not be eligible for a refund. You also accept that you are liable for providing us with the correct shipping details upon request and we are not responsible for items lost in transit if sending to an incorrectly provided address. We also cannot ship to PO boxes and you must provide an alternative shipping in this circumstance. There is a risk that shipping may increase if any new tariffs or taxes are imposed for certain countries.

Although we are aiming to deliver Hellboy: The Roleplaying Game to Kickstarter backers before the game is available at retail, production and shipping delays can lead to delivery at the same time or following the retail release. If you do not agree to these terms, then please purchase the product once it's available at your friendly local gaming store in 2021.

Hi everyone,
Today we've got an update about production and the expected shipping date. Last month we let you know that - following feedback from backers that had read the digital edition of the core book - we were working on some clarifications and improvements to the core book, as well as picking up some of those pesky spelling mistakes.
Since that update we've been working hard with Red Scar, the writers of the RPG, and have also drafted in the assistance of the award-winning River Horse Games. Alessio Cavatore and the team at River Horse have spent the past few weeks reading through the book and will shortly be coming back with their suggested edits, which will then be passed on to Red Scar.

Calling all Agents,
Today we wanted to give you all a quick update about production and what the next steps are for delivering the RPG.
Last month we sent out the digital version of the rules early so that backers could have a read through and potentially get playing as well. Delivering the digital version early meant that any spelling or rules errors picked up could be fixed before we started printing the physical version of the rulebook.
We were contacted by some backers with elements they had spotted and some queries about aspects of the rules - thanks very much to all those backers that got in touch! In light of your feedback, the team at Red Scar has been busy working on some edits, plus we've been reviewing the rules internally and we're also working with to provide any additional comments/edits too.

campaign.story:
Rallyman: Dirt is a 1-6 player, roll and move rally game by Jean-Christophe Bouvier. Tackle the twists and turns of a rally course, racing against the clock to get the best time and take the trophy!
Roll your dice to navigate the track as fast as you can, but beware of getting too many warnings or you’ll spin out!
Rallyman: Dirt is an addictively simple rally game with a lot of strategic depth. Drift around sharp turns, take jumps, cross water hazards and cut corners to shave as many seconds from your time as you can, but don’t push your luck too far...
 Here is a rundown of the different pledge levels available in the campaign. 
The DRIVER PLEDGE includes a copy of the base game of Rallyman: DIRT, along with a free expansion: 110% ! The "Co-Pilot Pack" refers to all of the extra Kickstarter content that will be made available through the Daily Unlocks, and is automatically included in the pledge. 
 The SPONSOR PLEDGE includes a copy of the base game of Rallyman: DIRT, along with all of the expansions! The "Co-Pilot Pack" refers to all of the extra Kickstarter content that will be made available through the Daily Unlocks, and is automoatically included in the pledge. 
The GEARHEAD PLEDGE is our all in mega pledge for serious drivers! It includes a copy of the base game of Rallyman: DIRT, along with all of the games expansions. It also includes the base game of Rallyman: GT and all of its expansions ! The "Co-Pilot Pack" refers to all of the extra Kickstarter content that will be made available through the Daily Unlocks, and is automoatically included in the pledge. 
The "Adrenaline Pack" included in the Rallyman: GT content refers to all of the Kickstarter content from the Rallyman: GT campaign.  

You'll find more information on the Rallyman: GT content at the bottom of the page.
For more information in how to include add-ons in your pledge, see the Add-ons section at the bottom of the page.
 A long-awaited new edition of the classic 2009 game combining the original Rallyman with its Dirt expansion into one action-packed game!
A fast, exciting racing game with simple mechanics and rules.
Stunning design and high quality components.
Hexagonal tiles allow players to create their own rally courses.
A 1-6 player game lasting around 45 minutes.
  Rallyman: Dirt tracks are made of hexagonal tiles that you may set up however you wish! You can either use one of the tracks included in the rulebook or invent your own in a flash. With 31 double-sided tiles to choose from, the possibilities are endless!
 Once track setup is complete, the rally begins on the starting line. Players will set off one by one, staggering their departures.
 Rallyman: Dirt is a roll and move rally game. So, to move, you’ll be rolling dice!
The base mechanic of the game is very simple: 1 die = 1 space of movement.
Each of the 6-sided dice you’ll be using to move has one or more Warning signs /!\. Rolling a Warning sign still allows you to move, but if you accumulate too many in one turn you’ll spin out, losing precious time and potentially taking damage to your car…
At the start of their turn, the active player plans out their trajectory by placing their dice on the track, following the route they plan to take.
There are three types of dice to choose from.
The Black Gear dice represent your car’s gears, and are numbered from 1 to 6. Each one lets you move one space along the track. These dice must be rolled in ascending and/or descending order, and each die can only be rolled once per turn.
The White Coast dice allow you to maintain the same speed for one extra space per die. There are only two, so use them wisely…
The Red Brake die drastically reduces your speed in one move when used along with a Gear die. Instead of dropping gears one space at a time you can use the Break die to "skip" a gear, for example taking you down from gear 5 to gear 3 in one space. As it must be rolled at the same time as the speed you wish to brake down to though, it does increase your risk of spinning out…
There’s also a fourth type: the Leader dice. You can’t choose to use these, rather they replace the Coast dice of the first player each round. They function identically to Coast dice but include an additional Warning sign /!\. This represents the difficulty of being the first driver to hit a rally stage! The leader will be clearing loose dirt and debris that make the course trickier to navigate, therefore making it easier for the drivers that come after.
However, the first player gets to impose other penalties onto the drivers following them during the Stage... 
Once you’ve chosen your trajectory by laying your dice out on the track, you’ll have a choice to make. You can choose to either roll your dice one by one, which allows you to end your turn whenever you choose if you’re getting too many Warning signs /!\ .
Or, if you’re feeling lucky, you can choose to go Flat Out, and roll all of your dice at once! Flat Out manoeuvres allow you to gain the same number of Second tokens as the number of Gear and Coast/Leader dice you rolled.
Second tokens are a precious resource and can be used in two ways. You can spend Second tokens during the game to secure your dice rolls - automatically passing them without the risk of getting a Warning sign /!\. However, any Second tokens you don’t use can be spent at the end of the Stage to reduce your overall time, which can make a big difference!
 If you get three or more Warning signs /!\ in your roll, then you spin out! The consequences of a Loss of Control are determined by the gear you were in at the time, and the Danger level of the tile you were driving on.
 These Damage tokens are drawn at random from a bag and have different effects, from changing the weather conditions to giving you less dice to roll. Damage tokens are cumulative, and while some stages of a rally allow you to repair your car before moving on, others don’t, so don’t let them add up too much!
 The base mechanics of Rallyman: Dirt are simple, but the game has a lot of strategic depth to it that will make you want to get it to the table again and again.
The tracks contain some interesting challenges, from sharp turns to full-blown obstacles like bumps and even water! These tricky elements are represented by special spaces, which have speed limitations and specific conditions that drivers must adhere to in order to cross them safely.
For example, corners may only be taken at a certain speed. Considering that you may only roll each available die once per turn, these speed limitations mean you have to plan your moves around them.
 Corners in DIRT can either be taken sharply or by drifting around them. You can even start and end your corners early or late by sliding into them, giving you more options to control your speed and distance.
Some corners can be cut through completely but you run the risk of blowing a tire or messing up the track for the drivers that follow (wouldn’t that be a shame?). 
 Jumps can potentially gain you some extra distance by allowing you to jump over one or more spaces if you take them at the right speed! Don’t go too fast though!
 Water hazards must be crossed while maintaining the same speed: if you attempt to change speed while crossing, your car might stall.
 In Rallyman: Dirt, the aim is to tackle the track as quickly as possible! The Gear in which you end your turn is very important, as it determines how many seconds you add to your time.
At the end of your turn, you will take a Time card of the number that corresponds to the Gear you ended your movement in. Each of these cards sports a value in seconds that will be added together to calculate your track time at the end of the Stage.
 Ending your turn in 5th Gear will add fewer seconds to your time than ending your turn in 2nd Gear, but of course, hitting high speeds on tricky parts of the course may not always be possible... or a good idea...
 At the end of the game, each player adds up the combined value of their Time cards to get their overall time. They can then subtract the value of any Second tokens they have left to reduce their time.
The player with the fastest time wins!
But, it doesn't end there...
A game of Rallyman: DIRT doesn’t have to stop after a single track however. You can count it as just one of the Stages in your own rally event!
A rally is normally composed of multiple stages. Playing out not just a single stage but a full competition will push your Rallyman: DIRT experience to the limit as, over the course of multiple stages, every choice and move you make can have a big effect on your drive for the podium!
A bad score on one Stage can be compensated for with a particularly good time on the next one. Risks that you would normally take without hesitation in the context of a one-off race become much more debatable when you know you won’t be able to repair after the stage so any damage to your car will be sticking around for a while!
The number of stages and the tracks you use is completely up to you and your imagination! But, of course, the rulebook will provide you with more than enough to get you started!
Also you don’t have to play your rally in one sitting! DIRT is perfectly structured so that you can play it over multiple sessions and even have more than one on the go at once!
If you’re ready to roll, then strap in because there’s more than a few Drivers ready to meet you on the track!
Rallyman has had an active and passionate community since its original release in 2009, something we’ve been very careful to respect and foster since we took the game on.
With the release of GT, you’ll find a bustling community online, whether it’s on the BoardGameGeek Forums or different social media groups, Gearheads have been coming together from all around the world to talk all things Rallyman!
The community has produced some superb content, from custom rules modules to 3D printed scenery, car paint jobs and more! Not to mention that if you’re looking for people to play with, look no further than one of the many online races and time trial events being hosted in multiple languages all year round!
Part of Rallyman’s success stems from the passion of it fans and we can’t thank them enough for the support they’ve shown us. If the idea of taking an exciting board game and sharing you experiences with players around the world intrigues you, you’ll find yourself right at home with the Rallyman community.
We intend to keep increasing our publisher support, growing it along with the community!
Flat Out! is a monthly newsletter that we created in order to give a voice to the community and communicate directly with Rallyman fans everywhere.
In it we feature everything from Player created content, insights and articles from the author, track design competitions and more! We also use it to inform people of any FAQ and Errata changes which we’re sure to keep up to date with.
Flat Out! is currently on its 3rd issue and if you’d like to check them out, they’re accessible here!
 Some of you may not be coming to this campaign as fresh faced as others. Some of you may already know the joys of passing a big flat out roll and the sorrow of wiping out just before the finish line!
For those of you coming from the original Rallyman
 Two in one: This new edition combines the original Rallyman from 2009 with its Dirt expansion into one lean, mean rally game.
   The same...but not entirely: The rules feature some “quality of life” improvements that stem from both the author and feedback from Rallyman:GT. That aside though, most of you won’t even need to read half the rulebook.
   New horizons: Whilst a lot of you will be familiar with the experience this new edition provides, what will catch you off guard is its scope. Its tile system, car categories and other expansion content give you access to a game whose possibilities extend FAR beyond that of the original.
   The scale: Everything in this new version is 1:144 scale so, for those of you that purchased the original metal cars, they won’t be wasted here!
  For those of you coming from Rallyman: GT
While its core mechanics remain the same, Dirt offers a very different gaming experience!
 You VS The Road : In Rallyman: Dirt players are up against the clock, not one another. The game features less interaction as your focus should be on the track, not the other cars... until one of them catches up to you.
   The way of the rally: Dirt Stages simulate the unique challenges of rally driving, with water hazards, bumpy roads and muddy corners that are sure to keep you on your toes! You’ll soon find that the difficulty of these elements doesn’t come from their individual rules but from how they influence the possibilities of the tiles around them.
   A whole new driving style : Rallyman: Dirt gives you a wide array of new manoeuvres to use from skidding to jumping and cutting corners. You’ll need to use every single one of them as with access to less brake dice and the emphasis on maintaining a high speed, you’ll find DIRT to be a very strategic experience that you won’t master overnight!
   Compatibility: More will be revealed as the project goes on but DIRT was designed to be fully compatible with GT. So, if you own both, you’ll be able to experience some new and unique race types!
You can find the BETA version of the rulebook here! Even though we've had a lot of feedback already, we welcome any constructive suggestions that can help us make it even better!
Currently only the Engish version of the rules is available. We are working on getting other languages translated.
You can also try out the game on Tabletopia!
 Want a closer look under the hood of Rallyman: Dirt? We'll be posting plenty of video content over the course of the campaign from both ourselves and reviewers around the world!
Here's a link to our first live chat about Rallyman: DIRT, which includes a full playthrough of the game :
If you speak Spanish, you can also check out this brilliant preview by Juegos de Mesa 221b :
You can also check out this playlist of playthroughs and reviews of DIRT's predecessor: GT!
Up until now, our campaigns have followed the standard practice of including Stretch Goals (finance based unlocks) and Kickstarter Exclusives (content not available outside of the campaign). This will be our first campaign where neither of these are present.
Instead, we'll be revealing free content every day (don't want to spoil the surprise all at once!) which will be part of either the 110% Expansion or the Co-Pilot pack. 110% is an expansion that will be available in stores and the Co-Pilot pack will be avilable directly from HGG's webstore after the campaign has been fulfilled. However, backers of this campaign will be recieving both of these for FREE (Savings of around €35 compared to MSRP).
All other content available during this campaign will also be released into retail after the campaign has been fulfilled but at a normal retail price (20-30% more expensive).
We've done this as we have always wanted our games to have a life after their KS campaigns and, after feedback from players who purchased the retail version, we found that our prior practices were effectively "locking out" a significant part of our player base from the full experience.
With this new system we've tried to make sure that no player is left out whilst still providing a strong incentive for those of you that want to support that campaign and help us make this game!
We have a variety of additional content for DIRT that we'll be revealing over the course of the campaign! New content will be released on Wednesdays and Fridays (see the daily unlocks schedule) so keep an eye on the updates then! 

You can also purchase content for Rallyman: GT during this campaign! We'll be applying the same new concept for exclusive content (as explained above) to everything from the Rallyman:GT campaign. You can get everything from the previous campaign, including all of the Kickstarter exclusive content. 
The "Adrenaline Pack" featured below refers to all of the Kickstarter exclusive content from the Rallyman: GT campaign. If you have already purchased Rallyman: GT in retail or were planning on doing so, this pack can be purchased separately during the Pledge Manager of this campaign. 
Please note that Rallyman: GT is already available in stores in most English and French speaking countries. Please consider supporting your FLGS by purchasing the game from them. The price is comparable and you'll be getting it a lot quicker!


We're also making a small Errata pack for Rallyman: GT avilable for this campaign. It contains:
The tiles that were missing their Danger levels.
The corrected GT6 (Team Challenge) and GT5 BOP soft tire Dashboards
The corrected blue Soft tire token.
The 3 GT5 models with the correct colours
We wanted to make this available to previous backers in as fair a manner as possible so please note that this Errata pack is sold at cost. HGG makes no money from it.
This corrected content ONLY concerns Kickstarter content from the previous campaign. You do not need to purchase this if you are buying the "Adrenaline pack" during this campaign. If you are buying this errata pack along with other content then it should not cost any extra in shipping. Purchasing it on it's own will incur a small shipping cost depending on your region.
How do I include Add-ons in my pledge?
1. Click on the “Manage your pledge” green button at the top of the page.
2. On the next screen, click on the blue “Change your pledge” button.
3. Then, in the current reward box you’ve chosen, increase the  pledge amount by the value of the add-on and then click on the “Continue” button.
4. A new window will appear, click on the “Confirm” button.
5. It’s done!
6. After the Kickstarter campaign ends, we will open the “Pledge Manager” (PM) and invite you to complete it. Here you'll be able to tell us exactly what you’d like to purchase.
You can also get EVERYTHING for both GT and DIRT in the GEARHEAD pledge 
 The rules for Rallyman: Dirt are those of the original Rallyman with some small tweaks and “quality of life” improvements from GT . So, between both of these past games we had a very good base on which to build the rules for DIRT. The rules document (that you can see above) is basically complete with only minor corrections and graphical elements needed to complete it.
We’re still working on a few elements in terms of illustration but You can get a complete idea of the game’s style and the look of each of its component here on this page.
DIRT, as a product, will be very comparable to GT. Therefore, we'll be going through a familiar process when it comes to pre-production and manufacturing so we don't expect any issues whatsoever. 
 Jean-Christophe Bouvier is an iconic figure in the French boardgaming scene. As a Rally driver himself, he wanted to make a game that represented his passion for motorsports.
Joëlle Drans is a budding artist who hasn't been working in the board game industry for long, but she's already leaving her mark! An extremely talented illustrator and graphic designer, she has already worked on a number of Holy Grail Games creations, including her beautiful Art Deco work on Museum: Pictura. She also fully illustrated the Polish edition of Roads to Rome. 
Loïc Muzy is an Illustrator and character-design specialist who has worked on multiple HGG games (including Rallyman: GT) as well as projects within the Videogame, Wargame and Role Playing game industry. He's especially known for his work on the Call of Cthulhu series.
Mindwork Games is a small Italian company born in 2015 by the creative brain of Matteo Di Diomede. Combining a taste for the bizarre with an unquestionable love for art, Mindwork Games started off creating unique series of modeling kits in high quality resin. Its "Signature Series", launched in 2020, features collaborations with some of the finest fantasy artists in the world - to give a three-dimensional shape to their artworks. Today, Mindwork Games has become a creative team that cooperates with other companies to create exclusive concepts, drawings and sculptures.
 Here at Holy Grail Games, our motto  is to always offer something you haven’t seen before! Whether it’s  Museum’s incredible quantity of beautiful artwork, Titan’s 3D design or  Dominations’ unique take on Civ games, we aim to bring something fresh  and exciting to everything we make.
Holy Grail Games is a small team, and we’re lucky to be able to work  on projects we’re passionate about in a professional environment that’s  relaxed and friendly. As well as collaborating with incredibly talented  game designers and illustrators from all over the world for our  projects, we also work closely with local playtesters and fans to make  our games the best they can be.
Holy Grail Games is based in the small city of Nancy, France. Our  team is a mixture of people from different backgrounds and professions,  but one thing we all have in common is a passion for what we do!

Risks and challenges
EXPERIENCE

This is not our first Kickstarter. This is HGG's 9th project so we are very familiar with the running and fulfilment of a KS project as well as where to look for any potential pitfalls. We currently have three other ongoing Kickstarter projects: Titan, Museum Deluxe Version and Museum: Pictura. Each one is currently in pre-production. We are active on each page, providing regular updates, answering questions and generally keeping our backers informed at each stage of the project.

DELIVERY DATE

We're estimating a July 2021 delivery date. This corresponds to the time we believe will be necessary to prepare the game for manufacturing, produce it and ship it to you. It also includes a safety margin too in case we come across any unforeseen circumstances.
It is in our best interests to get the game to our backers as soon as possible and we will do our utmost to deliver before this date and/or ensure that there are no delays. However, it may be that a situation arises that is out of our control, such as issues with shipping, customs or problems at the factory. Should anything cause this date to change we will of course keep you updated.

REFUND POLICY

All pledges can be refunded -minus KS and Stripe fees (10%)- up until the closing date of the Pledge Manager, no questions asked. After that date we will not be able to process refunds.
If, for any reason, we are unable to produce the game we will provide a full refund to all our backers.

BEHAVIOUR

We always welcome feedback and constructive criticism of our projects and games and strive to run a fun and welcoming campaign. However, we will not tolerate the abuse or harassment of backers, HGG or it's staff. HGG reserves the right to refund and remove any person found in violation of these standards.

TERMS AND CONDITIONS

Any costs shown in $ are based on the exchange rate in effect during the first day of the campaign.
By pledging to this Kickstarter, you acknowledge that the final appearance, materials and content of the rewards are subject to change and may differ from what is presented whilst the Kickstarter project is active.

You agree that our responsibility to you is to ship your order as entered into our pledge manager system, that title and risk passes to you upon delivery to a common carrier for such shipment, and you are responsible for import duties or any other costs that may be payable to the relevant tax authorities, providing correct address information and ensuring this address is deliverable by normal methods.

Hi Drivers!

We don’t have the Rx rulebook for you today, as we’re still working on getting it translated into all languages before releasing it to avoid anybody feeling left out. We should have everything completed and available within the next week.

Greetings Drivers,

I’m afraid we’re going to have to start today’s update with a bit of a dour tone and talk about delivery dates. Things have become increasingly complicated on the manufacturing and logistics side of things to the point that, whilst we would normally prefer to only give you precise information as we received it, we do need to go over some certain things so as not to create frustration in the future.
