updates.update_userinfo: The Pledge Manager is closing soon!
updates.update_content:
Hi there Drivers!

Just a quick reminder: the Rallyman: DIRT Pledge Manager will close soon. We originally announced this Friday (April 9th) as the closing date, but to give you a little more time, we’ve decided to leave it open over this weekend.
Therefore, the Pledge Manager will close on Monday April 12th. Once it closes, you will not be able to add anything new to your pledge. However, you will still be able to change your delivery address right up until shipping starts. Of course, we will give you warning for that too.

Hi there Drivers! 
We hope you’ve all had a good week. We have some more rulebooks for you! The 1.1 version of the Rallyman: GT rulebook, as well as rulebooks for all DIRT expansions apart from Rx are now available here.
As before, these are only in English for now, but translation is well underway, we hope to have all language versions soon.

Greetings Drivers!

After some careful refining, may I present to you all the final beta version of the Rallyman:DIRT rulebook!

A lot of you know the drill by now: feel free to give it a good read through and let us know in the comments below if you find and mistakes and/or if there are parts that need to be improved!

Greetings Drivers!

First of all, a happy new year to all of you!

We have some pretty cool stuff for you today: The revised Rallyman: GT rulebook!

We touched on it previously, but with the success of GT since its release and Dirt on the horizon, Rallyman is much more than just one game now. We want each new addition to stand on its own, but be compatible with one another so as to give you guys as many different racing experiences as we can!

With this in mind, we went back to the original GT rulebook, not just to integrate the feedback we’ve received since the game’s release last year, but also to create a good foundation for what would be following in its wake. This includes making sure that the structure, terminology and general spirit of the rulebook could be used in any racing setting. The goal of this is that whatever Rallyman you pick up in the future feels and plays like a Rallyman game should.

Before we get into what has changed, rest assured that a lot of these changes have already been integrated into the RM:DIRT rulebook you folks currently have access to and we hope to present you with a more advanced version very soon.


One of the core mechanics of Rallyman is how the turn order is decided each round. For GT that’s Speed > Distance > Position. Distance refers to how far along the track a player is, and to the existing text we’ve added the following line:



This is a very minor change in terms of determining the turn order and in that respect isn’t even needed. However, by referring to the front edge of the car’s space we can easily clarify some other situations, such as Fast Lanes.


Whilst the original rule did have the advantage of being simple, there are some rare situations where it becomes too much of a hindrance for those in no way involved or near to the Loss of Control that caused it.

So, at the cost of slightly complicating the rule, we’ve made it much more thematic and less impactful on players not in the vicinity of the crash.








We’re big believers in gaming aids as tools to help speed up gameplay. However, the ones in Rallyman didn’t really have enough space to contain a pertinent amount of information on each element. It was still passable in English but in other language versions the font had to be reduced a lot in order to make things fit.

Therefore, we’re removing the gaming aid cards from future print runs and replacing the illustration on the back of the rulebook with a full page gaming aid that players can pass between them. It includes much more information as well as page numbers for quick-referencing more detailed rules.

These are the three biggest changes present in this new version but you’ll find all the corrections and clarifications from the FAQ/errata document in the rulebook as well as other things such as the Redline rule.

Also, this document is not final. We’d love to hear what you have to say about these changes and if you think there’s anything we could make better!


The DIRT campaign included a €2 errata pack that replaces the handful of errors in the original campaign. Please note that we will not be able to include a printed version of the new booklet in this pack. As you may know, we priced the errata pack at cost. The downside to that is there’s no wiggle room to add anything else to it. We will of course make both a low res and print quality version available for you to download. If we have the possibility of making this updated rule available in a future campaign, we will endeavor to do so.

That’s all for now folks, see you soon for the DIRT rulebook!

Greetings drivers,

 This month’s update comes in the form of the Flat Out! Newsletter. The publication has been on a bit of a hiatus since the Dirt campaign as, with all the work we’ve been doing to catch up on 2020 projects, we haven’t had time to take care of it properly.

  But, with things coming along rather well that’s no longer the case! So on top of a rundown of where we are with DIRT and where we’re going, you can also find a new article from JC about how he used his real driving experience to design corners for the game, a new monthly track design for you to tear up, and more!

  Here is a quick summary of the newsletter for those of you who don’t have time to read it:

   - We’re now working on DIRT, having caught up with our other projects.

   - We’re starting with reviewing the GT rulebook to integrate the FAQ and errata changes into it so that we have a good base to build off for DIRT.

  I’m hoping that we’ll be able to drop the GT updates into your lap before the holidays!

Greetings Drivers,

It’s time for the Pledge Manager!

Now, we’ve got a lot to cover here so please make sure you read everything attentively. It is VERY important that you complete the pledge manager properly.

Greetings Drivers!

We hope you’ve all had a great week.

We have some good news for you concerning our previous update about including foam inserts from Folded Space as an add-on. We put it to a vote, and enough of you were in favour of the insert that we will now be making it available to add to your pledge during the Pledge Manager!

Greetings Drivers !
Things continue to move forward with DIRT and we have a lot to talk to you about today!
Core Box tiles
All of the Core box tiles are now finished! Well, almost: we may go back to them before printing to polish bits up or add some extra details, but what you’re seeing here is them basically 99% complete!

campaign.story:
One of the oldest recorded stories in Western Europe, Beowulf is an epic tale of hero against monster. And the monster’s mother. And then a dragon.

BEOWULF: Age of Heroes is a setting and rules set for 5th Edition, designed primarily for duet play – one GM and one player.
BEOWULF presents a host of new and specially adapted rules to create epic and thematic adventures for your lone hero and his or her companions. Explore a mythic migration-era Europe and beyond, solve mysteries, and do battle with dreadful monsters!

      With writing and rules design from hand-picked 5e and folklore geniuses, and with art from Jon Hodgson and friends, BEOWULF will be a thing of epic wonder. 

The Hermit’s Sanctuary is a free, full-length, introductory adventure for Beowulf: Age of Heroes. We highly recommend you grab a copy and check it out. It's a really good introduction to what we're doing, and you'll get to see a whole bunch of our new rules, our art, maps and graphics.
 Update! We were delighted to learn that The Hermit's Sanctuary is nominated for two ENnies in this year's awards!  

Complete with pre-generated characters, maps, printable accessories, and more, The Hermit’s Sanctuary is entirely free, and shows you the kind of thing we're producing. Download the adventure for free at DrivethruRPG.
BEOWULF will be hardcover, in full colour. It will be chock full of great art from Jon Hodgson, Scott Purdy and a handpicked team of artists. Graphic design and layout is by Paul Bourne (The One Ring, Adventures in Middle-earth).

We will have Anglo-Saxon style poetry from our friendly poets John Freeman and Dave Oliver, and excerpts from the Beowulf poem throughout.

It will detail the setting of Beowulf, and a host of new rules to facilitate duet play in 5th Edition by the Beowulf development team - Jon Hodgson, Jacob Rodgers and David Rea.
Now that we've funded, we’re hoping to make a longer, even more beautiful book through the magic of stretch goals. We began at a minimum of 192 pages, but we've added chapter spreads and two book expanding stretch goals. The book will now be 240 pages long!
The PDF version will be fully bookmarked, hyperlinked, and delivered via DrivethruRPG coupon code, so that it will be available in your library.
Every pledge level that comes with a reward contains the Digital Pack. This is a reward for being part of our kickstarter, and it will be a selection of useful and beautiful digital content that will expand should we unlock some stretch goals. It'll include things like content generators like "Hall for a Hero", battle maps, VTT tokens, pre-generated characters. We've grown it several times through stretch goals, and this will now be delivered in monthly chunks as we finish off the book!
BEOWULF:Age of Heroes is slightly unusual when it comes to add-ons and accessories. As well as designing, writing, making art, and testing the material for the rulebook, we’ve spent a year working on some beautiful accessories that make play even more enjoyable.     
We didn’t want our Kickstarter campaign get caught up in all the fiddly bits that can cause delays. So all of our accessories are ready to go! The pre-production is all done, we just need to know how many we’re making. We’ve taken on that risk so you don’t have to.
Lots of stuff is available right away as an add-on. And we’re aiming to ship all of them at the same time as the core rulebook. For your convenience, we've prepared a PDF catalogue that details the accessories. Download it here.    
NB: Nothing we’ve made as an accessory is necessary to enjoy BEOWULF: Age of Heroes. The game can be played with the rulebook, pencil, paper, a handful of dice, and some tokens like buttons or coins.
Miniatures Add-on £30/$37/€34
We’re delighted to be working with Richard Dickens of Cold War Miniatures to bring you a range of really gorgeous miniatures for BEOWULF: Age of Heroes.
Our Kickstarter pack of miniatures features 6 Heroes, and one monster, all of whom you might recognise from The Hermit’s Sanctuary and Pregenerated Characters 2.

Our miniatures are 28mm scale, will be cast in white metal, and are designed to work well with historical miniatures lines already available.  To keep things nice and simple, they are not available separately. They are of course supplied unpainted.
Sculpting is all done, and the masters are ready for moulding. We just need to know how many we’re making, should we fund.
If you’d like a set of miniatures, then simply add the price of one to your pledge, or choose a pledge level that includes one. You can add as many as you like.   
Miniatures STL files Add-on £4/$5/€4.50 each
We'll send you the STL files of the miniatures so you can print them on your own 3d printer. You'll be able to choose which figure files you'd like from the selection in the pledge manager. If you’d like a set of miniature STLs, then simply add the price of however many you'd like to your pledge, or choose a pledge level that includes one. To get all 7 figures add on £28/$35/€31.50
 BEOWULF: Age of Heroes Compass Rose Add-on £8/$10/€9
Ok, let me break character a little bit here. When I first saw the very first metal one of these, I cried a little bit. It’s absolutely beautiful. The team who made it, and the motto on it mean a great deal. Sorry, back in character. Ahem
So every journey needs a way-finder. Keep your battle maps pinned down, and North at the top with this absolutely STUNNING, unique Compass Rose.  
Designed by Paul Bourne, and made by the geniuses at Campaign Coins, this is something to truly treasure, and is a worthy souvenir of the campaign. Measuring 50mm in diameter, and weighing in at 40g, this is a beautiful chunk of metal. I can safely guarantee this will be the one reward that we will hear about for years to come, especially from people who didn’t get one.
The design and tooling work is all done for this amazing piece of treasure. We just need to know how many we’re making.
If you’d like a BEOWULF compass rose, then simply add the price of one to your pledge, or choose a pledge level that includes one. You can add as many as you like.
 BEOWULF: Age of Heroes 5x Inspiration Tokens Add-on £12/$15/€13.5
These are GORGEOUS. We went to town on these, with our friends at Campaign Coins. A set of 5 weighty metal coins, in an antique gold finish featuring beautiful BEOWULF designs by Paul Bourne inset with gems. Ok the gems aren’t real gems. But they look amazing!
These tokens can of course be used for any 5e game, or indeed any game at all that requires meaty, gorgeous, knot-whorled coins worthy of HEROES!
You can play BEOWULF: Age of Heroes without any kind of special token. Just use coins, beads, or paper chits. But for the special BEOWULF game nights we’ve played? It was worth going the extra mile.   
The tokens are 39mm across, and 4mm deep. They each weigh 25 grams. They come in a set of 5. Which gives you 4 for the Inspiration Pool and 1 spare, in case your character wins inspiration separately.

 The work on these is complete, we have the first coins on hand. All that remains is to find out how many we’re making.
If you’d like a set of 5 BEOWULF inspiration tokens, then simply add the price of the pack to your pledge, or choose a pledge level that includes the pack. You can add as many as you like.
 BEOWULF: Age of Heroes Inspiration Pool Mat Add-on £10/$12.50/€11
As part of the BEOWULF: Age of Heroes ruleset, each Hero has access to a pool of Inspiration. These are divided into tokens they can use for their Followers, Tokens they can use anyway they like, and there is also a deadly pool of dread Monster tokens. How the pool is divided up is determined by the Portent at the outset of the adventure.
To track the Pool you can use chits of any kind - coins, beads, ancient Dirrams from old Baghdad you found buried in an Anglo-Saxon pot in your garden… and three bowls, or three spaces drawn on a piece of paper.

  OR, since you’ll be able to run the same scenario for everyone you know, one on one, and since you can club together with your players, you can indulge yourselves and get this Inspiration Pool Mat. With graphics by Paul Bourne, expertly printed by Patriot Games in the UK on 3mm neoprene, with whip stitched edges, this is the perfect setting for your Inspiration Tokens. It's 21cm/8.25 inches square. Trust us, it’s worth it!

        The work on the Inspiration Pool Mat is all done. We just need to know how many we’re making! If you’d like an Inspiration Mat, then simply add the price of one to your pledge, or choose a pledge level that includes one. You can add as many as you like, but you only need one for a game of BEOWULF: Age of Heroes.
 BEOWULF: Age of Heroes Dice Tray Add-on £12/$15/€13.5
One of the very first products we made at Handiwork Games was dice trays! Partnering with our friends at All Rolled Up, we’ve brought a wide range of different dice trays to market.

All Rolled Up make fantastic trays that simply clip together at the corners. When unclipped you can fold or roll them very easily for transportation.

For this Kickstarter we’re offering an exclusive new design! If you’d like a dice tray, simple add the amount shown to your pledge, or choose a pledge that includes one. You can add as many as you would like.
BEOWULF All Rolled Up Add-on £30/$37/€34
To keep your game-gear safe you need an All Rolled Up! These unique and wonderful dice bag/card holder/pen holder, dice tray holders were designed by Fil of All Rolled Up, and once you’ve used one it’s hard to imagine not owning one. When Fil saw our BEOWULF art, she immediately suggested making All Rolled Ups with some really attractive matching fabric.
We're making a special design for the campaign, and the image above is an example of one of our existing ARUs, available on our web store, but it should give you an idea of what to expect.
The BEOWULF All Rolled Up is ready to… roll. All the work is done, we just need to know how many to make. If you’d like one, simply add the price to your pledge, or pick a pledge level that includes one. We'll collect your choice after the campaign in the pledge manager.
BEOWULF Art Cards Add-on £3/$3.75/€3.5
A set of 5 beautiful, heavyweight, glossy art cards, featuring the Beowulf graphics of Paul Bourne. 
The BEOWULF Art Cards are already printed. If you’d like a set, simply add the price to your pledge, or pick a pledge level that includes one. We'll collect your choice after the campaign in the pledge manager.
Extra Book - Add-on £36/ $45/ €40
This one is self-explanatory! To get a another copy of the rulebook add on £36/ $45/ €40.
 HOW DO ADD ONS WORK? 
To pledge for any of the accessories, pick your pledge, and then check the price of any accessory you'd like to add-on, and simply up your pledge accordingly. Shipping will be calculated in the pledge manager, but will be charged at cost. There's a visual guide here.
Example:
Wiglaf is browsing the Kickstarter. She definitely wants the rulebook, so she pledges for that, plus the PDF.

But she also wants a few accessories too. She likes miniatures, so she definitely wants those. She also wants a set of inspiration tokens and mat to use them on.
So having pledged for the rulebook, she hits “manage your pledge”. Wiglaf adds up the total for the extra things she wants, and adds that to her pledge total.
Miniatures: +£30
Inspiration tokens: + £12
Inspiration pool mat: +£10
That’s another £52, which she adds to her pledge amount.
She’ll be able to “spend” this extra credit in the pledge manager once the campaign is over, and the additional funds she’s pledged will go towards unlocking cool stuff in stretch goals.
While the campaign is running, if she wants to add some more things she can do this again, helping to unlock even more cool stuff.
After the campaign, she’ll also be able to pledge for more stuff in the pledge manager, if her funds don’t quite stretch right now. But she keeps in mind that later pledges made after the campaign won’t add to unlocking stretch goals. She wants those digital adventures, so she makes her choices wisely! Good ole Wiglaf. 
At the heart of the game is duet play. One GM, one player. A lone hero exploring the world, uncovering mysteries and battling monsters.
Duet play means a few things for your game, as our playtesters have discovered to their delight:
1: It's really easy to set up a game. You only need to sync schedules with one person!
2: It's really easy to play with two online.
3: You can focus on the motivations of just one character, and that central character drives the story, and sets the tone. It's easy to make it very much about them, and to explore that one character. 
4: It's very easy to choose how your Hero approaches the world, and create a consistent feel. We're writing our scenarios so that they can be explored without combat, as investigations, and riddles to explore, or as straight-up "whack the monster" combat fests.
5: Given the breadth of playable characters, as the GM you can re-run a scenario many times - even once for each of a larger group. Each time you get better at it, and each time you can explore more of the scenario's possibilities.
6: BEOWULF provides between-session activity not just for the GM with their prep work, but for the player - their group of followers is developed by the player's downtime creativity!
BEOWULF: Age of Heroes is certainly not meant as a replacement for group play. We love our group games! But duet games done right are a surprisingly easy way to get an engaging, in-depth, single-character-driven game going. And keep it going. Whether you find it easier to get two people together once a week, you want to introduce a younger friend or family member to rpgs, or if you just use it as a fill-in for when you can't get the whole gang together, there's a lot of advantages to duet play!
And, if everyone ends up loving BEOWULF as much as we do, there are some suggestions in the rules for how to add additional players to the game.  
The world of BEOWULF and the Whale Road is a mythic one. It's "history-adjacent" but it's not meant to be an accurate reflection of historical Europe. Your adventures take place in a half-remembered land of Anglo-Saxon ancestral stories, just like Beowulf the poem. Many of the place names are familiar, which gives it a certain magic. But the Northern Seas are filled with many, many small kingdoms in need of a hero's help, where almost anything can happen! 
You'll be able to discover and create it as your story unfolds, with a host of tools to help the GM get the right feel, without being constrained by a need for a degree in Early Medieval studies, and allowing each campaign to be very different.
In the original Beowulf poem, Beowulf, a hero of the Geats, travels to Denmark and fights the terrible monster Grendel in King Hrothgar’s hall, tearing off its arm. He must then hunt its mother after she attacks the hall in retribution for Beowulf’s mortal wounding of her son. The poem then tells of Beowulf’s successful turn as a king before he is forced to fight a dragon at the end of his life.
The poem is one of the finest epic poems of its kind, the northern equivalent to the Iliad or The Odyssey, and a tale told around fire-sides for centuries.
Beowulf himself is an epic hero, larger than life, with the strength of thirty men and the ability to fight monsters on land and sea with scant weapons or even his bare hands. He sails his ship to wherever there is trouble, leads his band of followers in pursuit of what is right, and busies himself fighting monsters.
Through the poem, we learn of the customs of the Anglo-Saxons, of hospitality and honour, of wide-gabled mead halls and heirloom swords, pattern-welded, bearing ancient names. We learn of the wisdom of kings as gift-givers, and queens as peace-weavers, and how loyalty and bravery are highly prized. It's amazingly atmospheric stuff, and a genuine glimpse into another world.
This is the perfect material for a highly evocative, one-GM, one-Player RPG, exploring the myths of migration-era Europe, and beyond!
We've adapted the 5th edition of the world's most popular roleplaying game to promote exciting choices and a strongly thematic feel. Created by a big chunk of the team who created the award-winning adaptation of The One Ring Roleplaying Game to 5e, you know you're in safe hands. We've taken everything we learned there, and built on it for BEOWULF. 
We've published a series of articles about BEOWULF: Age of Heroes on the Handiwork Games website. If you head here, and click on the tabs you can get a more in-depth run down of how it all works.
We've added a layer of new material onto the basic 5e rules to enable duet play, and to make the game feel like you're the hero in a "dark ages" epic.
First and foremost there's the new Hero class, and six unique subclasses based around attribute scores.
We also have a bunch of setting-specific backgrounds. We've rolled the options that usually come with so-called "race" into backgrounds - all Heroes are humans, and their characteristics don't vary by where they're born.
We have migration era equipment, weapons and armour, which draws on the nature of duet play to introduce some awesome rules features that would be less cool in a multiplayer game. No one wants to spend three quarters of their game watching other players decide whether to break a shield with their beaked axe, or hook a shield with their winged spear. But with one player? Those kinds of extra tactical choices make for exciting and thematic play!
Another huge innovation we've spent a long time developing (a really long time. It was really hard!) is Followers. Each hero has a band of companions. Each has a selection of gifts and burdens, which they can use before becoming spent. Like Beowulf's band in the poem, they only come into the spotlight when they have something to do, and then retreat again into the background when they've done their part. Followers are a little bit like spells, and you have to choose carefully when to deploy them, and when to hold them back.  
 We've expanded on inspiration, providing a pool of tokens, tied to a portent created at the outset of any adventure. This system allots tokens to different pools, making them available to the Hero, their followers, or even to the GM to use. Just like basic 5e, you can still only have inspiration or not - you can't stack the tokens. But there's a reserve there to draw from in times of need! It's this fickle hand of fate that marks out a hero!
Another key element of the BEOWULF is the "defeated" condition. This allows scenarios to set the parameters on when a monster or adversary will no longer fight. Being immune to the condition is what powers most large adversaries, and the hero must find out how to remove that immunity in order to defeat the monster.
This also means not every foe needs to be robbed of all their hit points - some lesser foes will be defeated if their shields are smashed, or their leader is wounded. And inflicting the defeated condition on a giant monster might not involve killing it - a wily Hero might be able to inflict the defeated condition with a riddle, or by using the scenery in a location. Although there's always room for just whacking the heck out of the baddies like Beowulf himself does.
There's also the concept of player journaling. While the DM is busy creating the next adventure, the player can optionally journal the adventures of their followers, and thereby develop their abilities for good and ill! 
BEOWULF: Age of Heroes is both a setting for adventures and a set of additional rules for 5th Edition. It has been created using the Open Game License. To play, you’ll need at minimum the basic rules, which are available free here. We highly recommend ownership of the core rule books for 5th Edition.
BEOWULF is firmly embedded in 5th Edition, and so we can't claim compatibility with "Old School Roleplaying" (OSR) systems. You will of course find a ton of ideas and insights in BEOWULF, but conversion to OSR will take work. 
 The Deluxe version of the rulebook has a faux-leather effect cover, embossed with a beautiful piece of iconography. The image above is one of several designs we're working on. It's going to be absolutely gorgeous, and something utterly envy-inducing! We'll only make enough to fulfill the kickstarter, plus a handful of copies for ourselves. We won't make any more after that, so it's guaranteed to be limited in number. 
We’ve kept our pledge levels as simple as possible. And they have very straight forward names to help you identify what you’d like.

• Follow along: for a minimal pledge you get to join in, get backer-only updates, and pledge for add-ons. You also get special access to a BEOWULF Kickstarter channel on our Discord server so you can ask us questions and make suggestions directly.
• BEOWULF PDF Rulebook: You’ll get the PDF rulebook of BEOWULF: Age of Heroes when it is ready. You can also up your pledge to include any add ons you fancy! The PDF will be delivered via DrivethruRPG.com You also get special access to a BEOWULF Kickstarter channel on our Discord server so you can ask us questions and make suggestions directly.

• BEOWULF Rulebook +PDF: You’ll get the printed rulebook and the PDF! You can also add additional funds for any add ons you’d like. You also get special access to a BEOWULF Kickstarter channel on our Discord server so you can ask us questions and make suggestions directly.
• Deluxe rulebook +PDF: you’ll get the amazing deluxe, limited edition rulebook, and a free PDF. You can also add additional funds for any add ons you’d like. You also get special access to a BEOWULF Kickstarter channel on our Discord server so you can ask us questions and make suggestions directly.
• BEOWULF Retailer: just for store owners! Your pledge counts as a deposit on an order of merchandise that you'll receive at a friendly discount and be able to sell at retail prices. You also get special access to a BEOWULF Kickstarter channel on our Discord server so you can ask us questions and make suggestions directly.
• Everything: You’ll get the rulebook, the PDF and all of the add ons featured at launch: Miniatures Set, STL files, Compass Rose, Inspiration Tokens, Inspiration Pool Mat, Dice Tray, All Rolled Up, and Art Cards. You can also add additional funds for any add ons you’d like. You also get special access to a BEOWULF Kickstarter channel on our Discord server so you can ask us questions and make suggestions directly.

  • Deluxe Everything: you’ll get the deluxe rulebook, the PDF, and all of the add ons featured at launch: Miniatures Set, STL files, Compass Rose, Inspiration Tokens, Inspiration Pool Mat, Dice Tray, All Rolled Up, and Art Cards. You also get special access to a BEOWULF Kickstarter channel on our Discord server so you can ask us questions and make suggestions directly.
• Become the Hero: you'll become our personal Hero when you select this reward. Jon will digitally paint your character for you and Jacob will run you through a four-game online game session of BEOWULF. (We'll work with you on specific timing for rewards delivery.) PLUS, you'll get a copy of the Deluxe Everything, as above. 
Handiwork Games was founded in 2019. Owned by Jon Hodgson, former creative director at Cubicle 7. He's joined on the team by Paul Bourne, the super-talented  layout and graphics genius behind The One Ring Roleplaying Game 1st edition. Also on the Handiwork games team is Scott Purdy, who is our in-house artist. Scott has worked for almost every company in the industry!
On the writing and rules development side we have Jacob Rodgers, a veteran of 5e design. David Rea, another 5e expert, has helped out tremendously with the conception of the game and a number of rules sections. 
We are hoping to be joined by further friends should we unlock some stretch goals - we have a selection of diverse names you will doubtless recognise, and some new names we're wanting to help to bring to a wider audience.
All the various rules additions are designed and well tested, which we regard as the majority of the work. The draft of the rulebook itself is currently at 75% written. We have a lot of art already made, and the graphic design/layout template is done.
At this point we're looking for your support to help us concentrate on the final round of writing and art creation.
Our art team and layout team are in-house and full time, and our writers are closely-connected freelancers, with whom we have long-established relationships.
Hopefully the Hermit's Sanctuary adventure (available free here) gives you a good idea of how far progressed we are with BEOWULF: Age of Heroes. 
We will be using a pledge manager after the campaign ends, and we'll collect your funds for shipping there. We undertake to provide shipping at cost, but want to be sure we're not stung by any sudden fluctuations in shipping costs. That protects us, but more importantly you.
We've given ourselves plenty of time to finish the project, and as my other kickstarters hopefully demonstrate, I'm committed to transparent communication, on a regular basis.
Shipping will be EU and US friendly. Most rewards will be shipped in bulk to our partners in the EU (if necessary) and the US, to be sent on to you from there. Some rewards, like the art cards are easier for us to deliver via international mail, and some items will be fulfilled by our suppliers. So we'll do that - but all of that is for us to worry about - we aim to keep it as simple as possible for you.
The era on which this setting focuses is sadly one that has been sporadically co-opted by some deeply unpleasant and unimaginative extremist groups.
And so we have taken some pains to avoid certain symbols that we do feel are now lost to reasonable people.
For example, we have reworked fonts to remove the lightning S. It is simply too distasteful to us. And while migration-era peoples made use of the swastika as a decorative symbol, we certainly will not.
However, we are not content to let this fascinating and engaging period of history and myth be entirely taken over by, and abandoned to, racists.
Where we use the term “Anglo-Saxon” it refers to the varied, historical group of migrants who came to the British Isles in the migration era. It is not intended to refer to, nor is relevant to, any later, outmoded notion of “race”.
(Isn’t it curious how a group of economic/climate migrants, establishing a middle-eastern religion in the British Isles are so beloved by racists?)
We’re also keenly aware that the more we read of history, the more we learn that modern concepts of “race” are heavily informed by historical financial interests that relied on transatlantic slavery.
It is wrong to assume that these views were shared by people in the distant past, and we resoundingly encourage others to read and learn as much as possible about these issues.  Recent works like “Origins of the Anglo-Saxons” by Jean Manco, shine a light on the sheer ridiculousness of modern-day racism.
We intend that a portion of each sale of BEOWULF:Age of Heroes once launched, will be donated to anti-racist causes. That way should a racist buy our work, they aid their own undoing.
(We have to be clear that we are not raising funds for charities or causes with this Kickstarter - simply because that is against Kickstarter’s rules. Once the game is launched, a portion of profits will be shared with anti-racism causes.)

campaign.story:
Dragon Dice is a collectable dice game for 2 or more players. Originally made famous in 1995 by TSR, Dragon Dice has continued to expand and evolve under the reign of SFR inc. and currently offers a large range of truly exceptional dice to be used with its innovative tactical game system.
The Amazons are one of Dragon Dice's most unique races. While other races consist of two of the five elemental essences, Amazons lack these components, but instead harbor empathy for the elements around them.  Out of print for several years, the player community chanted for their return and the gods of Esfah have answered. Pledge your allegiance to the creators and help the Amazons race across the face of the lands once more!
 Dragon Dice has a huge range of available dice, each offering different rules and tactics, allowing you to compose your perfect army. Due to the large number of options, new players should always start with our 'Starter Rules', which give players an insight to the core mechanics of the game focused on the 2-player experience.
The following video is designed to make learning Dragon Dice a breeze:
 Our 2-player starter set contains everything you could need to get started on your Dragon Dice adventure: A total of 40 stunning quality dice, 2 playmats and a copy of the 2-player starter rules (also downloadable below).  
Our current Starter set, all you need to start playing...
Starter sets are currently available for those of you who want to get rolling right away on the SFR website, but are also available as an add-on during this campaign.
V4.0 RULES DOWNLOADS
(click to view and download):
 Treefolk vs Firewalkers V4.0 Starter Rules(current retail starter set)
For those of you already experienced with Dragon Dice, the full rules have undergone an update focusing on streamlining the gaming experience and are now presented in full graphical format along with a range of racial reference sheets. The new Dragon Dice V4.0 full rules set can be downloaded here:
V4.0 Full Rules
 V4.0 Summary Document(to explain the changes between V3.0.4 and V4.0)
High res versions of these files (for printing) as well as additional documents in support of our rules, including an FAQ and our awesome new online rules wiki can be found on the SFR website by clicking here!
Want to know a little more about each of the races in Dragon Dice? You can check them all out by clicking here!
What is a 'kicker'?
The Amazon's make a triumphant return...
You will notice that the pledge tiers (as well as the campaign add-ons) include large numbers of 'kickers'. A kicker is the standard pack size for Dragon Dice. Kickers for the various races all contain the following: 4 small random one-health units, 2 medium random two-health units, 1 large random three-health unit and 1 random four-health monster unit.
The tiers:
 Any of the following items may be added to your pledge. Simply increase your pledge amount by the value shown below. All add-ons will be confirmed post-campaign in the pledge manager, where you will also be able to add extra items.
 https://www.facebook.com/DragonDice/
Also on Facebook, you can find the community-led, 'Dragon Dice Players' Community' by clicking HERE.
Shipping will be charged after the campaign, via the pledge manager. We have decided to do this so we can ensure the most accurate and cost effective shipping for each order, based on the package weight, size and destination. Shipping will be calculated via the pledge manager to offer each backer the cheapest possible option for their pledge.
As shipping costs can vary greatly it is impossible to state all the possible shipping costs here, however the following prices are an approximate representation of our fulfillment partners current rates:
US: $10-20
UK: $10-20 (approx £7-15)
Mainland Europe $15-30 (approx €10-25)
Australia: $15-20 (approx AU$20-25)
Canada: $25-50 (approx CA$35-65)
All prices are charged in US Dollars. Please remember that shipping prices can fluctuate based on the quantity of dice you order.
US, EU and AU-friendly shipping!
We will be shipping all rewards from one of 3 hubs around the world - US, UK and Australia. As such, if you reside in the US, EU or AU areas your rewards will be shipped locally and there will be no customs duties or fees applicable. Please note that for EU backers, shipments will come from within the UK, which could be affected by the developments of 'Brexit'.
Please note that pledges delivered to other areas of the world may attract customs charges. SFR is not responsible for any fees incurred in this way.

Amazon's have arrived down under!
We've received word from our Australian distributor,  that all product has been received, and will be repacked for posting within the next week.   Once this has been accomplished, individual tracking numbers will be provided to you.
We know the wait has been excruciating, but it's all coming to an end!
Once again we thank you for your patience, and your continued support of Dragon Dice!
P.S.  our Frostwings Reprint campaign is currently underway.  The page can be viewed

1.  All of the initial packages have been posted and should be received by domestic backers, either already or in short order, and the missing Minor Terrains should all be out soon.
2. Overseas orders are also either arriving at their final destinations or on their way to our distribution points (UK & Australia), and should reach customs within the next week.  Then its on to repacking and posting to their intended recipients.

Once again, we're upholding our promise to all of you regarding transparency throughout this campaign. 
In our haste to get all of your product out to you as soon as possible, we neglected to include one of the items we had planned to include, the Minor Terrains.

Over the next two weeks, all of our orders will be heading out the door to their final destinations!!!  We will be sending packages out in batches all of this week and next, and hope to have the last on the truck by Friday March 19th.
While some of you may have received a tracking number for your package already, there have been some technical issues with our 3rd party postage website, so please don't be alarmed if you do not receive one, (or you receive multiple numbers)

campaign.story:
A game of skill, tactics and luck set in the Arthurian world designed by Marcin Malinowski with art by Jakub Głąb. Vortex Chess sees Merlin Ambrosius defend Camelot and King Arthur against the forces of Medraut ap Lot. Take control of the Stone Circles and use the cards to move your minions to vanquish enemies. Before they vanquish you! 
Vortex Chess is language independent; chess look-alike game. Quick to learn (about 10 mins), but just like chess, will take a life time to master. It is a 2 players competitive game with 1-4 players expansion. With time of play about 25 miniutes




 We can offer 50% off from RRP with minimum buy of 5 copies of a game.
 EMAIL US: office@elfenixgames.com




 Vortex Chess is a game you can learn in as few as 10 minutes, but like its namesake, will take a lifetime to master.
GAMING RULES! LIVE STREAM 5th of FEB 5pm UTC

 How to play Vortex Chess with English lector (Demonstration using old prototype)
 Polish version with subtitles (Demonstration using old prototype)
 The Objective of the game is to defeat your opponent's mage.
Power Hexes
                                        Every hex on a board has a set element to it. An Element Card that lies on a Stone Cirlce or on Camelot (That hexes we called: Power Hexes) gives their element to all surrounding hexes as shown in the picture. There are only two hexes on a board can have two different elements at the same time (Middle row - sides of Camelot - check picture below). Camelot (Two hexes) has only one Element Card on it. When Element on a Card is changing then all surrounding hexes change element as well. 
Game Setup
 Players set up their minions on the board, with the Wizards going into Stone Circles. On the left of the mage go the following: Dragon, Cavalry, and Catapult. On the right side go the following: Stolem, Archer, and Castle. In the front line, you will set up Pawn Minions (Knights or Barbarians). Every player draws 3 Action Cards. You are now ready to play. Player with Initiative may choose with which Element the game starts. For example he takes cards with Fire element and put them into all Stone Cirlcles and Camelot.
Minion Card
Each Minion Card is represented by a few characteristics needed for the game. 
Action Card
You must choose how to use an Action Card. It can be used in 4 different ways:  1) as a Movement Card 2) as an Attack Boost 3) as a Defence Boost  4) as an Element Boost
TURN
Each player’s turn is divided into 3 phases. When 1 player finishes all 3 phases, the next player’s turn begins, and so on until the objective of the game has been met.
Phase 1 - Draw Cards
Phase 2 - Roll the Die
Phase 3 - Action Phase
DRAW CARDS
Player drawing 2 Action Cards for a Mage plus a Card for controlling Power Hex (Stone Circle or Camelot). To control a Power on a hex you need to have your minion on the appropriate hex on the board. 
Maximum hand size is 10 Cards. You cannot have more than 10. If you need to draw to have more - simply stop when your hand size reach 10. 
ROLL THE DIE
Roll the die. If the result is 1 of 4 elements, you must pick a card with that element and change 1 on the board. (You cannot change the card to the same element. For example, you can not change Water to Water.) If the result will be an image of a mage, the player controlling that mage can choose 1 element and put that card wherever he or she wants to.
ACTION PHASE
In phase 3, you are spending Action Cards. The only limit on the actions you can take with your minions will depend on the number of cards you have. (Remember: It is always good to keep a few cards for defence.) One minion cannot move more than 4 hexes in phase 3. After an attack, the minion is treated as though it has moved 4 hexes. In other words, it can do nothing more. You can move any number of minions in phase 3. The only limit is the cards in your hand. 
MOVEMENT
There are a few rules for moving your minions. There can be only one minion on each hex. A minion can enter a hex occupied by an opponent minion - that causes a fight.  A minion cannot move through other minions - except for Dragon, which has the ability to fly.  One minion cannot move more than 4 hexes in phase 3. When a minion fights, it is treated as though it has moved 4 hexes. - It cannot do anything else in that phase.
Cavalry cannot make this move because it would cause a move through its own minion. Dragon spent 2 Action Cards. Its Movement Value is 6 but the maximum it can travel is 4 hexes. Knight spent 2 Action Cards and moved to the Outer Stone Circle.
FIGHT
When the minion of one player enters the hex with the minion of another player, there is a fight. To determine the winner, the Attacker must calculate the Total Attack Score and the Defender must calculate the Total Defence Score. Whoever has the higher score is the winner and stays on the hex. If there is a tie, both minions go off the board.
Total Attack Score - Is equal to Minion Attack Skill + Element Modifier (if applicable) + Support (from a maximum of 3 friendly minions) + Action Card Attack Boost (if played).
When calculated: the Defender may or may not play the Action Card with Defence Boost and then calculate:
Total Defence Score - is equal to Minion Defence Skill + Element Modifier (if applicable) + Support (from a maximum of 3 friendly minions) + Action Card Defence Boost (if played).
Example: Merlin Ambrosius attacked Medraut ap Lot. Total Attack Score of Merlin is: 6 [2 from Minion Card plus 4 from Action Card Attack Boost). Medraut Total Defence Score is 6 ( 7 from Minion Card and minus 1 from Element). The reasult is a Tie. Both mages dies and the game is Tied.
SUPPORT
Each fighting minion can take advantage of support given from friendly minions. The maximum support is from 3 minions being no further than 1 hex away. The hexes must touch each other. If there are more friendly minions, the Player can choose which minions he takes Support from. 
Support can be given to friendly Attacking minion or Friendly Defending minion. Simply add the value in brackets to Attack Skill of minion or Defence Skill. 
ADVANCED RULES
In the Advanced Game, all the basic rules stay the same. There are a few more rules in the phases, which you can find in a rulebook, as well as extra rules for Spells and each minion, making the game more complex. Before you start using these rules, we recommend that you play 1 or 2 games using the basic rules. Below we show you an advanced minion rules:
 It is not a final version of a rulebook. We will be asking Paul Grogan from Gaming Rules! to help edit it and make them more clearer.

campaign.story:
I’m back with MORE TILES! The sets are designed, painted, proofed and ready to print. All that’s needed is your pledge! Let’s do this!
Battle maps are awesome!
Everyone knows that having a wonderful resin scenery set-up, or a fancy neoprene battle map for those set-piece battles is great.
But what about random encounters or locations you haven’t planned for? Or what if (like me) you simply don’t have the budget for loads of scenery? And how do you even transport all that stuff to the game anyway? And even then, how do you keep things sufficiently varied?
When I started using maps and miniatures for my own RPG games these were questions I had to find answers to. And that’s where my map tiles come in. 

            Supplied in sets of 30, my double-sided, card-stock map tile sets will fit in a coat pocket and won’t break the bank.
Designed to be extremely flexible in usage they cover a series of locations. There are nine new sets for this Kickstarter:
Backstreets
Evil Forest
Scifi Utopian
Scifi Dystopian 
Water
Moorland Ruin
Desert
Hillfort
Linking Tiles 2
Each is detailed below. All are now unlocked!
The Map Tiles from Wave 1 are also available! Here's a list of those:
Dungeon
Cavern
Mountain Pass
Forest
Heathland
Linking Tiles
Extra Detail Tiles
Most of the art is all hand-made. I use digital painting programs rather than 3d renders, so everything has a nice handmade feel that blends right in with painted miniatures. This time around I’m joined by guest artist Paul Bourne who does use computer renders, which are perfectly suited to Sci fi! He's guesting with two sets.
The tiles are six inches square - a size I have come to really love in my home games. It’s a great balance of flexibility, allowing you to build very different encounter maps from a few tiles, with extreme portability. 120 tiles will fit in your bag with ease and allow endless set-ups on the fly.
Here are the bullet points:
30 tiles per set
9 Different Sets available, having broken through all stretch goals (on day one?!)
Full colour
Double-sided
Printed on 270gsm card-stock
Highly connectable within each set
6 inches square
Gridded and Grid-free options available
Digital versions available for virtual table tops
Shipping is included in your pledge, with a small supplement for the places a bit further away from the UK/US.
Each set has at least twenty-two unique faces out of 60 - I've added more of any given tile where it seemed useful to have spares.
The tiles are full colour, 6 inches square and printed on card-stock, in the USA. It’s important to note that it’s a key feature of the design that these tiles are NOT board - they're not made from the stuff boardgame tokens are made from.
They're printed on 270gsm card-stock, and with good reason: 30 board tiles just wouldn’t fit in your jacket pocket, and would cost a lot more!
This is an important point. With many years in games production under my belt I could have these made on board, or indeed other, fancier materials. And maybe another time I'll make something more demanding and expensive. But for this nice straightforward Kickstarter I want the tiles to be both affordable and transportable.
Please note that my tiles are not designed to be suitable for dry erase pens. Users have had some success with dry erase, but some brands stain the tiles, so I don't offer this as a feature, and don't recommend that you mark your tiles with pens. 
They are professionally printed, in the USA, with a nice satin finish. Let's take a look at some of my samples. These are the real thing:
Backstreets 
Whether it’s a fantasy city, or a victorian city, this tile set gives you loads of options to create seedy backstreets for adventurers and investigators to explore. With plenty of twists, turns, dog-legs, and alcoves, and strewn with rubbish, crates and barrels this set is great for a whole range of settings! Available with or without a one inch grid. You'll be able to choose at the end of the campaign. 
Evil Forest 
 In Wave One we did the bright shades of the greenwood. With this set we venture into the heart of the darkwood! Twisted branches, thickets of thorns and tangles of brambles; this is the perfect counterpoint to the fairer set. With a wide variety of paths and junctions, as well as tiles to create larger clearings. Available with or without a one inch grid. You'll be able to choose at the end of the campaign.
Scifi Utopian 
Featuring the amazing art of Paul Bourne, this scifi set is suitable for high adventure beyond the stars. Whether it’s a scientific exploration ship, an alien base or the corridors of a rebel base, these tiles are perfect for your science fantasy adventures! These tiles have a grid built in as part of the art.
Scifi Dystopian
  Again featuring the incredible work of Paul Bourne, this scifi set is suitable for the grotty underbelly of scifi dystopia! The worn belly of a freighter, a reclaimed imperial base that’s seen better days, or an automated factory in the dead zone, these tiles are perfect for your grimy scifi adventures! These tiles have a grid built in as part of the art.
Water UNLOCKED!!!
Expanding on a feature from the Wave One Extra Detail tiles, this set gives you loads of options for lakes, rivers and streams, or even the sea. You can build islands, and shore lines, and includes a bunch of water tiles to create open water. This set is perfect to mix up your wilderness adventures. The Water Set connects to the Heathland Tiles from the first campaign. Available with or without a one inch grid. You'll be able to choose at the end of the campaign.
Moorland Ruin UNLOCKED!!!
This set gives you an alternative wild lands to the Heathland of Wave One. As well as a whole range of attractive moorland tiles with plenty of natural features, this set gives you a bunch of ruined walls that you can piece together into an exciting adventure locale! Available with or without a one inch grid. You'll be able to choose at the end of the campaign.
Desert UNLOCKED!!!
Rocky outcrops, boulder-strewn chasms, and dusty gulches, this set is perfect for post apocalypse and desert adventures. Available with or without a one inch grid. You'll be able to choose at the end of the campaign. 
Hillfort UNLOCKED!!!
With this set you can build a series of palisades and roundhouses to explore. Perfect for the hill folk, or orcs, or bandits! This set links up to the Moorland Ruin set. Available with or without a one inch grid. You'll be able to choose at the end of the campaign.
Linking Tiles 2 UNLOCKED!!!
These tiles link up almost all the sets in this wave with each other and those from wave one. Please note that we didn’t feel linking between the painted sets and the Paul Bourne sets worked. It seems like a lovely idea, but it just looked horrible! So there are links between all the painted sets, including the wave one sets. And links between sci fi sets. But not between painted and scifi.  Available with or without a one inch grid. You'll be able to choose at the end of the campaign.
Did you miss Wave One? Or do you need more? You can get a great deal on those tiles right now!
Dungeon
The Dungeon Tile Set was a favourite of wave one. Full of corridors, rooms, junctions and steps this is the perfect set for your subterranean adventures! There are tiles to make larger chambers, as well as a load of choices for your dungeon layout. The Dungeon Tiles have a one inch grid built in, so there's no need to choose gridded or ungridded.
Cavern
Classic dungeon stuff, this set features narrow passages (two squares wide on the inch grid versions, sometimes narrowing down to one), cramped chambers, and various intersections. There are also lots of tiles for making larger chambers from more than one tile.
There are tiles for 2 tile rooms, 3 and 4 tiles rooms, and even larger caves using the cave floor spacer tiles. It's a really versatile set for making that spontaneous troll hole along the road, or a small series of caves to explore.
Available with or without a one inch grid. You'll be able to choose at the end of the campaign.
Forest
A series of narrow paths through the green, this set is great for rolling travel on woodland paths. There are a variety of tiles for constructing various size of clearing. There's a tomb entrance, a pool, a woodland stream-crossing and more.
The Forest Set is available with or without a one inch grid. You'll be able to choose at the end of the campaign. 
Mountain Pass
The Mountain Pass set works as a variant dungeon too, but is intended for crossing mountain terrain. It has cliff edges both up and down for walls. There are loads of stepped levels in this set, and tiles to make large arenas in the rock.
Here's the real thing in action:
The Mountain Pass set, like all the sets, is available with or without a one inch grid. You'll be able to choose at the end of the campaign.
Heathland
The Heathland Set one doesn't have the obvious paths or passage ways of the other sets - well not quite. It features rolling open wilderness, scattered with depressions, gullies and rocks. And there's a selection of road tiles that run through the open country. Here's half the set of 30 tiles in action:
The Heathland Set is available with or without a one inch grid. You'll be able to choose at the end of the campaign.
Linking Tiles
This set provides links between: Forest, Mountain Pass, Heathland, Dungeon and Mountain Pass tile sets. There are multiple linking tiles to link each set, and between 3 sets. Available with and without one inch grid. You'll be able to choose at the end of the campaign. 
Extra Detail Tiles 
These tiles provide objectives and additional locations for the Wave One Map Tiles sets, featuring flooded chambers, standing stones, a riverbank and islands, cavern entrances, a dungeon... restroom (!) and much much more! They work with the following sets: Cavern, Dungeon, Heathland, Forest, and Mountain Pass. The Extra Detail Set is available with or without one inch grid. You'll be able to choose at the end of the campaign.
All stretch goals are now unlocked!
£500 - FUNDED! IT'S ON!!!
£1000 Water UNLOCKED!!!! SPLOSH GET IN THE SEA!
£2000 Moorland Ruin UNLOCKED!!!! RUINOUS!
£3000 Desert UNLOCKED!!! SCORCHIO!!!
£4000 Hillfort UNLOCKED!!! 
£5000 Linking Tiles 2 UNLOCKED!!!
There are no more stretch goals beyond these. This is it! Any more would delay delivery, and we don't want that! And we want to do all the sets, rather than hold anything back. I think we can do it with your help.
Pledging is very easy - just select the amount of tile sets you’d like. If we meet our funding goal with your pledges, your card will be charged at the end of the campaign.
You’ll be able to choose which sets of tiles you’d like once the campaign finishes as part of a survey that will be emailed to you. I WILL be using a pledge manager for this campaign, so you’ll be able to pledge for more tiles once the main campaign has finished. Anything pledged after the campaign won’t count to unlocking stretch goals though!
Please note that you can adjust your pledge up and down during the campaign - so if a set you want becomes unlocked, you can add it in by upping your pledge. Which in turn will help unlock more sets.
Of course you might just want to go all in and get all the sets from day one. And that will certainly speed us towards that goal! There are no specific sets you have to get - the choice is entirely yours from whatever we unlock.
Digital Map Tiles Pack: £12 - you’ll get all the digital files for all unlocked sets. 
These will be supplied initially via emailed dropbox link, and then later via DrivethruCards. The digital files are supplied as both jpegs for Virtual Table Tops and fuzzy edged png files, so that you can piece together your own maps. IMPORTANT: the digital files are intended for on-screen usage. They are not intended to be used for printing, and we don't recommend you use them for printing, and we can't help you print them. They do not come with any publication rights.
  The remaining pledge levels simply allow you to select how many sets you would like for your pledge. You'll select which ones later, in the pledge manager after the campaign closes.

You'll see your regionalised currency when you pledge.
Shipping to most places is included in your pledge. This is true for the US, UK, and European destinations. 
If you live in places a long way from the UK you might pay a modest supplement, just to keep things fair - you can check that out in each pledge level, but I've kept it as low as possible, and largely it will be used to pay for superior packaging for those longer journeys.
Parcels will be dispatched from the UK and the US.
Here’s what I’ve learned and built upon since my first Map Tiles campaign in 2019. We sent out over 40,000 individual tiles. It’d be weird if we didn’t learn something!

 Readiness: I really didn’t expect the success of the last campaign, and so I didn’t have all the tiles painted or proofed. This time all the print files have already been made and proofing is done. As soon as the funds clear we’re ready to go. There’s is literally no work to do beyond ordering a print run, picking and packing. That’s plenty of work in itself, but there’s no danger of any creative issues! The print files are already with the printer.
 Friendliness: I really enjoyed the last campaign, and I hope we can continue the idea of Friendly Kickstarting. I’m simply a human being, working with a couple of friends to deliver this campaign. You’re helping a real person make something cool. As a thank you for your support, I’ll always do my best for you, and communicate as fully and directly as possible. I hope we can all chat like regular people, despite using a computer to do it. The offering, or "what you can get" is laid out here. If you'd like something I'm not offering here, then I'm afraid it's not available through this campaign. You can drop me a line via PM if you'd like to discuss something, but I'm not taking requests for maps sets, nor changing what I'm doing here, on this occasion. I am certainly taking notes of suggestions for future campaigns!

Packaging: In the first campaign a small percentage of our packaging failed. Sometimes in extreme situations, but it failed nonetheless. About 2% of parcels had problems with being mishandled, and the packaging split. I’ve changed how we pack the tiles to ensure they arrive in better shape. And changed our supplier for padded envelopes.
Shipping: I’ve tried to keep things as simple as possible. On the last campaign a lot of you from Australia, New Zealand and Japan ordered tiles, and boy those costs add up! To keep things fair to everyone I’ve added a small supplement to shipping to those locations. I wish I could keep shipping flat and the same for everyone but it doesn’t quite work this time, due to changes in shipping charges since the last campaign.
Shipping to most locations is included in the price of the sets. If you’re a long way from me, I have to charge a little bit more. This also allows me to provide much more solid packaging for those distant locales, to ensure your tiles arrive in a good state. We like to imagine our delivery people respect our efforts and move parcels with all due care. But some of them are evil, and use your rewards as a football. And in one notable case from the previous campaign as a... bar of soap for a giant? I don't even
Timelines: I have significantly padded the timeline for dispatching UK/Europe and Rest of World pledges so that we don’t slip behind our estimate if we unlock our stretch goals. Last time I really didn't plan for the sheer volume of backers - I really thought we'd maybe get 100? This time I have planned for greater numbers, so if I got that wrong, then you get your stuff sooner than expected, not later. I’m also going to assume everything is unlocked, and work on that basis.

Dice are from Triple Ace Games/The Dice Dudes, used here with permission
The Compass Rose is from Handiwork Games from their forthcoming Beowulf Kickstarter. It's made by Campaign Coins and it's GORGEOUS CHECK IT OUT:
The dice trays shown are from Handiwork Games and you can get them here
You can order Wave One Tiles from Handiwork Games here (UK, EU, Everywhere else) and here (for the US), but the deals are not quite as good as via this KS because here on Kickstarter we have PEOPLE POWER. But you'll get them right away. So that's nice.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is the second time we're kickstarting tiles, and I've learned A LOT from that first time. You can read about that above.

This is my fourth Kickstarter, and I am very familiar with all the processes involved. I'm playing it very safe, and not doing anything I haven't done before. I take kickstarter very very seriously, and your support means a lot to me personally. It concerns me, taking money in advance, and I hope that this makes me a responsible creator.

Here's where I think we could face challenges:

Shipping. This is always a roll of the dice (argh!). We might face delays caused by UK customs, or damage caused in transit. I've tried to account for those in my estimate.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

A sample of the components in the game. See below for the full box contents.
Deep Space D-6: Armada is a stand-alone multi-player sequel to the original solitaire game Deep Space D-6.
In Deep Space D-6: Armada, you and up to 3 friends will work together to complete missions, fight enemy fleets in ship to ship combat, and ultimately defeat an evil federation. 
You'll get stronger as the game progresses, building the perfect starship from over 50 station modules, hiring heroes from a pool of more than 30 unique units, and finding resources to help you dismantle your opposition. 
Armada is a complex and deep game made simple and intuitive through visual and user experience design. If you've played Deep Space D-6 before, you'll be immediately familiar with the mechanics of Armada. If you're new to the series- I hope you're ready for tough decisions and tactical planning! 
Deep Space D-6: Armada is played over a series of game rounds. Each round consists of three phases:

1) Planning: Players perform actions to travel between planets and prepare for upcoming tasks such as upgrading their ships or hiring Heroic crew.
2) Encounter: Players complete Away Missions or combat enemy fleets at their current location (together or alone).
3) Resolution: Event and Threat Detected cards are drawn and hazard effects are resolved. 
 Learn more about the game in upcoming updates:
The Starships (Update #2)
Stations Modules and Weapons (Update #4)
Crew and Special Abilities (Update #6)
Team-Up encounters (Update #8)
Rule Book
Want to know more? Check out the prototype rulebook. This is a work-in-progress rulebook and is subject to change. 
 PHASE 1: Planning
Travel, repair, upgrade ship, hire crew.
PLAY

PHASE 2: Encounter
Ship-to-ship combat and Away Missions.
PLAY

PHASE 3: Resolution 
Draw new event cards, spawn enemies, resolve hazard effects.
PLAY

Creating a science fiction world where the primary color wasn't black proved to be a large challenge. As a lover of classic science fiction, I was drawn to the bright colors and "loudness" of pulp era sci-fi. A true test of Armada's visual direction came from designing the board- or lack thereof. 
A space themed game without the empty blackness of space almost felt wrong, and for some people they probably won't be able to get over it! So Armada uses free floating planet tiles making whatever surface you play on the core color of the "board". Still want that dark sci-fi feel? Play on a neoprene star field map. Want to feel like you're floating in space? Try a glass table! 
For the art, I've enlisted in the help of Gareth Davies. Gareth's unique art style creates a vibrant science fiction world while keeping things minimal and clean. 
For the components themselves, I aimed for a classic board game look with a slight vintage feel. There are over 50 custom dice in this game!  We're taking advantage of new manufacturing technologies, but don't want to go overboard with component gimmicks. 
Get the full game as a $2 add-on!
JUMPSHIP is a hidden identity party game for 5-10 players. You can get a copy of the mini-version for $2 with your Armada pledge. Just add $2 to you pledge. See the update for more info (Not available by itself. Limit 1 copy per copy of Armada).
No stretch goals. Tau Leader Games does not do Kickstarter exclusives. We fully develop our games and don't piece parts out to be added as stretch goals later.
But with your help and community feedback, I've been able to redesign and upgrade the shield and hull trackers! They look like this now:
Other upgrades:
A dedicated solo scenario meant for quicker play.
Custom plastic insert for the hero dice.
Black Core cardstock on all cards.
Drawstring bag for beacon tokens.
Printed player pawns (instead of stickers)
Shipping will be charged after the campaign in the pledge manager. Thanks to the funding progress of this campaign, I've been able to lower shipping rates.
Games will be shipped though fulfillment partners primarily in Canada, China, the EU, the US, and Australia. This should reduce custom fees and VAT. Shipping rates are partially subsidized. 
Backers are limited to 3 total games per pledge. You may add up to 2 additional copies by adding $48 for each additional game to your pledge. There will be no extra shipping charge for extra copies. 
For larger orders (cases of 6+) or retailer pledges, please inquire by sending a message to the creator.
Tabletop games are becoming more and more popular every year. We as consumers (and designers too!) employ platitudes and conjecture comparing the increased complexity and immersion of board games to the capabilities of video games. If we are to make these comparisons, we must also recognize the dangers of any consumer-focused game mediums. Publishers have a responsibility to be morally accountable for any practices that manipulate fans, deceive consumers, or incite misbehavior among those that partake in our hobby. Deceptive pricing schemes, endless boxes of collectible miniatures, nickel & dime expansion structures, undisclosed kickbacks, even player toxicity- these are just a few areas of growing concern within the emerging tabletop industry. Please take a moment to consider how your purchasing habits and use of games reflect on the industry, whether it is my games or someone else's. 
Never forget that tabletop games are a place for communion, self-expression, can have positive effects on our health and mind, and can lead to wonderful careers and societal impact. As an independent publisher I'm committed to creating games that respect players, and delivering them with practices that are healthy for the community. 
Have fun and play nice. 
Join the Armada today!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Deep Space D-6: Armada is my most ambitious and largest game to date. Though the game is already designed, we continue to balance and add new features. There is also a non-trivial amount of art assets to be completed. These things will take time. 

This will be my 6th Kickstarter game project. I've been all over the place- let me tell you. From last-second funding escapades to projects far exceeding my own projections and everything in between. This means I've also seen failures and made mistakes. I've been late to hit deadlines. I've been unresponsive when I needed communication the most. I take full responsibility for my actions and hope people will be fair in judgement and understanding. I am fully aware that being an individual does not necessitate leniency in a market full of large companies and publishers with impressive capabilities. Let's just do our best to be reasonable and keep the spirit of independent self-publishing alive!

TauLeaderGames has a 100% delivery rate but every project still has inherent risks. October 2020 is my best estimate for a project of this scope based on my past experience. While this timeframe includes room for errors and overages, it doesn't encapsulate every possible obstacle. It is important to note that I would rather delay a game to make it better, than to ship a low-quality product.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Twenty-six years on, under the oppressive rain-filled skies of Mort City, the downtrodden masses have spoken as one and with a single resounding message: It's time for SLA Industries 2nd Edition. 
SLA Industries (pronounced "Slay Industries") is an award-winning pen-and-paper role-playing game that was first published in Scotland in 1993. The game is a horror noir science-fiction setting set in a dystopian reality in which the majority of the known universe is either owned or indirectly controlled by the eponymous corporation SLA Industries. The game incorporates themes from the cyberpunk, gothic horror and conspiracy genres, and has always been praised on the quality of writing and art. SLA Industries is considered one of the first and best examples of the Splatterpunk genre in RPGs.
The World of Progress, the universe in which SLA Industries operates, is a science-fiction image of the 1980s, where the fax machine spews out information alongside green-screen computers and vat-grown biogenetic monsters, who compete with humans and exotic alien races for work in an overgrown city that plunges deep underground.
We are very lucky to still have the original creative team at the core of this RPG. Dave Allsop and Jared Earle have been here from the beginning and have a clear vision for the future of SLA Industries. As with all of the SLA Industries publications, there will be high-quality art, brief stories, character quotes and other in-game content to bring The World of Progress to life. SLA Industries 2nd Edition will be crammed full of full-colour art, presenting one of the best visualised worlds in the RPG arena and the the most stunningly visual representation of The World of Progress to date.
Some of the threats you will come up against in SLA industries.
Players in SLA Industries take on the role of an Operative, the highly-trained and well-equipped freelancers that serve as the company's agents, investigators and enforcers. Operatives perform tasks for both a pay packet and the promise of an increase in their security clearance, as both provide them access to an increased standard of living, better equipment, progression up the corporate ladder and sponsorship opportunities. Most of all though, they strive for the one thing that everyone in the media-driven World of Progress wants: Notoriety.
Characters progress along with the campaign, gaining credits, security clearance and notoriety, and can spend their hard-earned rewards on better equipment, stronger armour, more deadly weapons, powerful combat drugs or something a little bit different, like a down-payment on a Life After Death account, ensuring that even death can't stop them. Each of the nine different races offers its own play style, each armed with unique racial abilities, from the studious Neophron to the drug-addled Frother, from the brutish Stormer to the quick-witted Wraithen, from the versatile Human to the honour-bound Shaktar, pick the race that suits you best and bring them to life.
SLA Industries Operatives: Shaktar, Malice Stormer, Human and Advanced Carrien
SLA Industries 2nd Edition features an entirely new d10-based rules system, built from the ground up and designed to offer a more streamlined and cinematic gaming experience than the old system, while remaining true to the setting. Ratings Points are a new mechanic for 2nd Ed, earned from face time in front of the camera, or through bravery, extreme success and spectacular failure. These points enable players to perform cinematic feats that defy the norm and impress audiences, and when things don't quite work out, there's the new Luck mechanism that allows players to alter or re-roll dice results. Both Ratings Points and Luck are a finite resource, however, and should not be used frivolously.   
In the following video Shep talks about a few of the changes between 1st and 2nd Edition, as well as some of the new additions to the system...
Operatives enter the sewer in a typical "Blue BPN" mission.
Examples of how the pages will look.
SLA Industries 2nd Edition will be a 192-page hardcover book with lavish full-colour illustrations throughout. Most of the pages have been written and the roadmap for the book is complete. In the book, there will be a comprehensive look at the structure of the company and a deep dive into Threat Analysis, which will cover all the major rivals, cults, critters and dangers that SLA and its Operatives face on a day to day basis.
You can read more about the contents here.
The back cover art featuring Shaktar, Human and Stormer Operatives
 This Quickstart PDF offers a 'rules lite' look at the new system and provides five pre-generated characters and an introductory scenario for up to five players. Go give it a whirl!
Click on this image to download the free 52 page Quick Start PDF for SLA Industires 2nd Edition
To make things easy, we have organised the campaign into a number of simple tiers. Pick the tier you want from the menu on the right of the page. The following graphic explains the content related to each of those tiers (note, many of the images are mock-ups, the campaign is to make them happen):

Two supporting source books are available: Hunter Sheets Issue Two, an eighty-page book which includes targets that SLA Industries wants you to take care of, and SLA Industries: Cannibal Sector 1, a massive 352-page tome for those that wish to take their adventure out of the city and into the infamous sectors surrounding it. Conversion documents for both of these books to bring them in line with the new 2nd Edition rules system are included as a part of this campaign.
 We have planned out the stretch goals that are realistic both financially and timewise. If we get through them all we will not be adding any extra. 
We will reveal stretch goals, a few at a time, as the campaign progresses. 
Scroll down to the bottom of this section to see the social stretch goals and how to help complete them

Additionally, go on to the discussion page here on Kickstarter and comment, discuss and have fun. Kicktraq define Hot projects by the amount of people that visit their (Kicktraq) page for the given project and how much discussion is going on on the projects comment section on Kickstarter.

2nd Edition First Impressions from Geek Native
