An indepth article about the history of SLA industries can be found in this month's issue of Tabletop Gaming magazine (also available at all good FLGS & Newsagents)
Dave Allsop was the originator of SLA Industries and is the art director and main artist for Nightfall Games. He is an in-demand artist in the gaming industry having worked on the likes of Magic: the Gathering, Dungeons and Dragons, Pathfinder, World of Warcraft and Hearthstone, to name but a few. 
Many of the regular SLA artists are still part of the team, including Jon Hodgson and Clint Langley, and we have also been joined by many newer artists at the top of their game. 
Jared Earle is one of the original members of Nightfall Games and was responsible for a large portion of the original release in 1993. A vital part of the company, and lead on this Kickstarter, Jared continues to write, edit and layout SLA Industries publications around his life as a sysadmin.
Mark Rapson is the owner of Word Forge Games and has had significant creative and operational input in recent Nightfall Games releases. He was the driving force behind the completion of the SLA Industries: Cannibal Sector 1 kickstarter and is lead writer for Thresher, flora, fauna, diseases and the 9th Division.
Chris ‘Shep’ Shepperson is a writer and games designer responsible for the 2nd Edition rule system and is a prolific content writer, contributing significantly to SLA Industries: Cannibal Sector 1 book and the majority of the writing already done for 2nd Edition. He also led the development of the Cannibal Sector 1 miniature game ruleset and has also contributed heavily to the works of other publishers, including Modiphius and Red Scar publishing.  
Based on past experience of our team, we will be charging shipping after the Kickstarter concludes based on the actual costs incurred to ship. We will collect this via our pledge manager after the campaign ends. 
DO NOT ADD MONEY FOR SHIPPING NOW - IT WILL NEED REFUNDING AND MAY BE LIABLE TO KS CHARGES THAT CANNOT BE REFUNDED.
Shipping is charged after the campaign, separate to your pledge so we can be fair to all our backers (shipping is rarely one size fits all). We will ship your rewards at our cost to our international hubs and charge shipping from your nearest hub to you. Depending on where in the world you are, we will either ship to you from our hub in the USA (US, CA and some ROW backers), Australia (APAC), or the UK (EU & other ROW backers). As a rough estimate, for the 'HALLOWEEN JACK' level pledge, we expect shipping to look something like this:
 UK: £6 (Royal Mail 2nd class 'signed for') 
 EU/US/CA: £12
 Rest of the world: £20. 
Please note that while we do our best to get you your rewards in a timely manner and at the best delivery cost we can, you may not necessarily receive your rewards before the product makes it into distribution in your own country or before it's made available at conventions or through special promotion opportunities. We hope that the special price and exclusive items you will get during the Kickstarter will make up for any such possible lag. However, if this is something that is not acceptable to you, please do not back this project, and instead wait for the retail release. Thank you for your understanding.
All PDFs will be fulfilled via Drivethrurpg.com
 Why Kickstarter?
A really good question! Nightfall Games is a small and growing company and although we have produced a lot already we want to commission artists that complement the art already created for this book. When the initial goal is met, this kickstarter funds will be used to pay external artists for their artwork (approx 1/3 of the total art we want to include: approx 50 of 150 pieces) and the production of the hardback rulebook, 'Jack' dice and GM Screen pack. Any additional funds will pay for the stretch goals and newer add-ons to be completed by manufacturers, contractors and commissioned artists and writers. The commissioned individuals will work co-currently with our core team, therefore timescales should not be affected significantly.
Note, unlike some Kickstarters, we are not running this campaign as a preorder. The money you pledge will be spent on making this game happen, including paying external artists, writers and printing companies. Check our refund policy in the FAQ section.

campaign.story:
We’re bringing the best adversaries from the history of the Creature Collection to 5th Edition! We're going to make a full colour, one creature per page, hardcover bestiary for the world’s favourite roleplaying game. 


It’s going to be expertly converted, beautifully illustrated, wonderfully laid out, and full to the brim with useful content.
If we’re extra successful we’ll also include random encounter tables, drop-in encounters with battle maps, and lots of additional digital content. 
Way back at the beginning of the d20 times, when 3rd Edition was the big noise, gamers had two core manuals with which to play. The Player’s Handbook and Dungeon Master’s Guide were available, but there was a pause before we got the official Monster Manual. Into that gap burst The Creature Collection - the very first bestiary of Third Edition monsters! 
Now we’re bringing the Creature Collection to 5th Edition!
Our aims and campaign are simple: To see how large a 5th Edition bestiary we can create with your help! 
At the heart of our campaign is The Scarred Lands Creature Collection for 5th Edition. We want to run a very focused, easy-to-understand campaign, and it’s all about the book.
The Creature Collection begins at 160 pages, and will feature roughly 140 monsters. Most occupy a full page, some occupy two, occasionally they’re longer. None are split up across pages - they always occupy at least one full page. We think this is vital feature for ease of usage: We want to give you a good-sized illustration for every adversary, along with a good depth of info and tips on using the creature. We also want the book to be a joy to read and use at the table.
If the campaign is successful, the book will grow, with additional monsters added as stretch goals are met. You will still pay the same price you pledged at, so it’s worth getting in early and bringing in as many friends as you can! Together we can get MORE MONSTERS!
With this campaign our job is to make a single volume, so we're maxing it out at 256 pages. That way we don't break the bank shipping it to you, nor get delayed in delivery. But fear not, there are plenty of additional rewards we'll unlock should we grow beyond that point!
Every creature in the Collection is illustrated in full colour and, of course, is fully statted and described, as you would expect.
The book will be ordered alphabetically so that if you know what you’re looking for you’ll be able to quickly find it with maximum simplicity. When we reached out to DMs the thing we heard most was the need to be able to look things up easily. We all agree that we’re frustrated by having monsters grouped by type, so we’re using an A-Z navigation option for those times you know the name of the creature you’re looking up.
In addition to this, we’ve designed in a bunch of additional navigation aids to make this book super-useful:
Every monster has a tab at the side of the page that shows its CR, and they’re colour-coded into groups. That allows you to very quickly gauge what kind of challenge each monster presents to your party.
There’s also a series of tabs lower down the page edge that show in which habitat the creature can be found. 
These tabs each sit in a fixed, exclusive position on the page edge, so when you flick through, you can easily spot what you're looking for. 
The book will be fully indexed by monster name, and also by CR.
The Creature Collection is also available in PDF format. 
The PDF will be fully bookmarked and hyperlinked. It will be delivered via DriveThruRPG so you’ll have it in your library.
 Accompanying many of the reward tiers is The Digital Pack.
This is a set of digital accessories that complement the Creature Collection. Much of the content will be unlocked via stretch goals, so the more pledges we get, the better the Digital Pack becomes, at no extra cost! 
It will contain digital poster-sized files of any unlocked battle maps from Encounter Pack stretch goals, along with additional battle maps suited to VTT formats and a VTT-friendly version of the Creature Collection if we do well.
We’ll include digital files of art of the creatures to show your players, and we may unlock further accessories like VTT tokens and digital “paper” miniatures. The Digital Pack will be delivered via DriveThruRPG so you’ll have it in your library.
For the true Scarred Lands fan, the limited edition hardcover is a wonderful collector's item. Strictly limited to 100 copies, this tome comes in a leather-effect cover (vegan, not dead animal), embossed with the skull of a Spider Goblin. We'll be giving you more details on this exclusive volume during the campaign.  
The original Creature Collection was the genesis of the Scarred Lands setting. Scarn and the Divine War grew out of the Creature Collections to become its own vibrant, unique setting.
“A world known to its inhabitants as Scarn, the Scarred Lands is a place of dynamic heroism, supreme villainy, and incalculable magic. Torn and twisted by battles between the titans and their children, the young gods —fought largely by monstrous titanspawn pitted against humans, elves, dwarves, and other “divine races” — Scarn is a world still wounded deeply by the Divine War that took place less than two centuries ago.
The Scarred Lands has been a favored fantasy setting since the release of the Creature Collection in 2000. Over the next several years, over 40 titles were published for the Scarred Lands, making it one of the most fully supported fantasy RPG settings ever and the premiere product line of the former Sword & Sorcery Studios”
The great news is that while the Creature Collection is a must-have for 5th edition Scarred Lands players, it works just as well for all 5th Edition games! 
We want your help to decide which creatures to include. We’ve already gathered choices from the Scarred Lands Corebook Kickstarter, from members of the Scarred Lands team, from our writers and artists, and now we want you to help select the next bunch of adversaries. We’ll be running backer-only polls throughout the campaign where you’ll get to choose which monsters are included in this Creature Collection.
Creatures will be grouped into teams, and they'll battle, the winner being decided by your votes. Don't worry if your favourite Scarred Lands beast gets knocked out! Each creature gets more than one chance of being included in our tournament system! (and it's intended as a bit of fun. We won't wreck the collection so it includes 100 versions of Creature McCreatureface)
 Throughout the campaign we’ll be sharing previews of our monsters! You can get two free chunks here and here, and then throughout the campaign further weekly previews will be backer-only. So if you’d like to get a bunch of monsters for 5e over the next 4 weeks, jump on board!
 We've moved the stretch goal graphic to the top of the campaign to make it nice and easy to find!
Our stretch goals add pages to the Collection, handy stuff to the Digital Pack, and Encounter Packs.
Here's an example of an Encounter Pack: The Temple of the Stars. With some details redacted in case you end up playing it! 
We’ll also expand the Digital Pack that’s available with selected reward tiers with things like VTT tokens, battle maps and more!

This is a world shaped by gods and monsters, and only the greatest of heroes can expect to be counted among them. The most populous continent of Scarn, Ghelspad, plays host to vast unexplored regions, hides unsolved riddles from ancient cultures, and taunts adventures with the promise of undiscovered riches hidden among the ruins of older civilizations.

Here you’ll find a fascinating compendium of characters from the Scarred Lands, but easily transported into campaigns set elsewhere. In addition, find multiple appendices full of new magic items and artifacts, class archetypes and prestige classes, new feats, new creatures and races, and more.

campaign.story:
Welcome to the Kings of War the Roleplaying Game Kickstarter! Pledge now to help us fund an RPG set within the epic fantasy world behind the extremely popular Kings of War miniatures game.
Mantic's Kings of War is a popular global brand that has led to equally venerated games such as Vanguard and Dungeon Saga. For the first time ever, you can now explore Pannithor through the medium of a roleplaying game tailor made for this epic fantasy setting.
Red Scar are collaborating with Mantic Games and Winged Hussar Publishing to tie together lore that stretches across aeons, all with the purpose of creating a roleplaying game that lives, breathes, and enables your character to take control of their own legendary destiny. 
In addition to a Quickstart using our very own TriCore ruleset, we've provided a conversion of the introductory adventure for folks who prefer their RPGs with a 5E flavour. Feel free to download either or both!
NOTE: both the TriCore and 5E Quickstarts can also be downloaded from drivethrurpg.com (simply click on the relevant text for your preferred ruleset).
The pregenerated characters offer a wide variety of choice.
Kings of War is a fantasy setting of epic scope. Originally envisioned through the medium of a tabletop wargame, Pannithor has since been expanded with the Dungeon Saga board game and the Kings of War: Vanguard skirmish game. With Kings of War the Roleplaying Game, GMs and players will be able to explore this grandiose fantasy setting like never before!
The balance and stability of the world of Pannithor was cataclysmically destroyed in a long-ago age. The surviving Celestians — the gods worshipped by many races — were torn in two, each split into a ‘good’ and ‘evil’ aspect as their energies sundered with the breaking of the enchanted Fenulian Mirror. The surviving deities that now presided over the world, the Shining Ones and the Wicked Ones, plunged Pannithor into an age of warfare as they led man, elf, dwarf, and other species into the countless bloody battles of the God War.
The seemingly endless war waged for centuries, claiming the lives of countless thousands of all races. Civilizations rose and fell, entire kingdoms and empires were ruined, and alliances and rivalries were forged that endure to this day. The Wicked Ones created ranks of monstrous beasts charged with annihilating the humans, elves, and dwarfs who fought for the Shining Ones. Colossal battles raged across the world as armies on a scale previously unknown tore each other asunder. Domivar, son of Mescator, God of Justice, took to the skies to fight against Oskan, Father of Lies, and chief power amongst the Wicked Ones.
In a climactic duel that raged across the heavens, Domivar defeated Oskan and took from him the Black Axe, symbol of his dark powers. Domivar plummeted from the heavens, smashing the axe into the world and tearing a great wound across Pannithor’s surface. The cursed axe shattered and the dark gods pulled inexorably into the gaping tear, but spent too was the noble Domivar, having sacrificed himself to put an end to the God War. The great scar gouged out of the world’s surface by his heroic sacrifice became known as the Abyss, and its physical and spiritual gateway to the underworld became home to the dark creatures created by the Wicked Ones.
But this is merely a brief glance at the world, a few verses in a chapter of the great book of Pannithor. This is now your world to explore, to choose your path for good, for balance, or for darkness. This is your world to create your own stories and your own adventures. In a world of heroes, it is time to forge your own legend.
This kickstarter will fund the production of a printed edition of Kings of War the Roleplaying Game. This full-colour hardcover rulebook of approximately 320 pages will not only provide  new content for Pannithor, but will also feature the TriCore ruleset; a lightweight ruleset designed to empower both GMs and players alike with the ability to use the system to keep the game focused on both characters and the narrative.
The core book will not only greatly expand upon the factions that have already been introduced by the board games, but will also introduce several new ones. It will also delve further into the history of Pannithor, from the very Day of the Apocalypse to its current timeline,  some twenty years later. Global affairs will also be explored, including a closer look at the new super powers that contend on the world stage.
Rather than act as separate entities that share the same setting, part of our aim is to provide as much cross-platform support as possible for the Kings of War franchise. We will be including crossover rules for Dungeon Saga, Vanguard, and Kings of War. Bust into a dungeon and claim a relic that will help with future adventures or engage in a skirmish that will make exploration easier in later scenarios. The possibilities are endless!
Please note, however, that there is absolutely no need to pick up any of the other Kings of War systems. First and foremost, Kings of War the Roleplaying Game has been designed as an RPG ruleset that allows each group to tell their own epic stories. As each crossover component of the game also has a narrative counterpart, the system will run brilliantly on its own as a traditional pen-and-paper RPG. Mantic produce some truly amazing miniatures and scenery, though, so we wanted to enable as much compatibility as possible.
You can read all about the dynamic TriCore ruleset in a series of blogs taking place over at the Red Scar website, including in-depth breakdowns of the core Keyword mechanic, crossover elements for the Kings of War range, and Payback. That's not all. however, as we'll be adapting the exciting elements of TriCore into a PDF for the popular 5E mechanics.
If you're new to Kickstarter, please follow these simple steps below to help support Kings of War the Roleplaying Game. 
Choosing a pledge level will not only help us reach our funding goal, but will also provide you with amazing content once the Kickstarter is complete and we have finished production. The handy graphics below summarise the content you will receive with your pledge.
Once we reach our funding goal, stretch goals will help us unlock even more potential!
Plus additional content can be unlocked by simply sharing the news of this Kickstarter!
Add-ons allow you to include additional items with your pledge, such as extra dice or miniatures. As stretch goals are unlocked, more add-ons will become available.
We've participated in a lot of interviews and playtesting sessions since the announcement of Kings of War the Roleplaying Game, plus involved groups from around the globe. Here are a few words from Ronnie Renton at Mantic, plus some of the highlights of our journey to date.
PLAY

A playtest video from a mid-iteratioon of TriCore:
 Plus a recent playthrough of the quickstart adventure, Ashen Gold, at Mantic HQ:
Podcast interviews listed in chronological order:
December 2019 - The Xboxcast

An excellent review from Paco at G.M.S. Magazine:
We also have regular development posts appearing on our blog, giving you an insight into the system and the mind of our developers.
Feel free to hop on to our Discord server and talk about your current exploits on Pannithor, plus stay tuned for some Twitch related news very soon!
Shipping and logistics are key elements for delivery of a project. This is especially the case with Brexit highly imminent. Thanks to our logistics guru, Garry Harper, all of these concerns are being prioritised, investigated and leveraged to provide our backers with the best shipping rates possible. With logistics and distribution connections throughout the industry, plus years of experience in delivering the best packages for Modiphius Entertainment, Garry can deliver shipping rates that are Kickstarter friendly and minimally affected by Brexit, if at all.
Shipping will be collected after the Kickstarter campaign concludes as part of the pledge manager process. We will keep you fully apprised of shipping charges as the date approaches, but expect the following example prices to remain close to the final cost:

The PDFs for this campaign will be delivered by drivethrurpg.com.
Post Kickstarter fulfillment, we are partnering up with Word Forge Games to ensure that Kings of War the Roleplaying Game successfully launches into retail and distribution.
We have a diverse and dynamic team working to make sure the project is delivered to the highest of standards and in a timely manner. Although we also have active playtesters and many other people assisting, the table below introduces you to our core team.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As with any Kickstarter project, there are certain risks and challenges that can present themselves. Both our own team and Mantic have plenty of experience in handling this type of project, and we've been working closely to ensure that it runs as smoothly as possible.

The core Red Scar team have a good level of experience in managing projects of this scope. They also have an extensive and supportive network to draw upon should any goblins try to loose mawpups amongst the manuscripts. Regular updates will be provided to not only showcase new artwork or content as it arrives, but to also inform of unforeseen delays.

Playtesting has been ongoing for a long time now, but will continue apace with expanded input from you, the backers, as the Corebook heads into layout in preparation for print. The majority of the fine details and background are in place, but there are other areas, such as crossover rule, that will benefit from deeper feedback.

We're also not afraid to make the big decisions that mean you'll be getting a top-quality product. With our other Kickstarter project, the Devil's Run RPG, we took the decision to delay production of the Corebook as the unpredictable launch of a new edition of Savage Worlds meant that the rules would essentially be immediately out of date. Delaying production was definitely the right thing to do and has made for a well-rounded project overall. We are in the process of delivering the Devil's Run project now, which means there will be zero impact on this one.

With Mantic's support, Red Scar's team of artists, writers, editors and graphic designers are passionate about delivering the best possible product that they can for you, in a timely manner. All we need is your support to make this epic fantasy RPG a reality!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
The Flowering of Chivalry and Sorcery!  
For those who fight, and those who pray. For those who toil - and those who enchant...  
Chivalry & Sorcery, the legendary game of medieval fantasy roleplaying, is back! Standing on the shoulders of giants, with refined mechanics and a deep, rich atmosphere, this brand-new edition is bigger and better than ever before, and for the first time ever is brought to you as a full colour hardback book! 
Please join us as we raise funds to complete the layout and fund the printing of this hefty tome, an estimated 500 pages of glorious colour - the Chivalry & Sorcery Roleplaying Game!
The text of the Chivalry & Sorcery core book is already complete, and layout is underway, and we're confident of fulfilling the Kickstarter objective of publishing the game by February 2020.

ADD-ONS
The Add-ons will be as follows:
Treason -  GBP 11.95 
Creag Hill  - GBP 9.95 
Nightwalkers - GBP 19.95 
Goblinoids - GBP 19.95
Ars Bellica - GBP 24.95
Additional Core Rule Books - GBP 40.00 (Backers price only - MSRP will be GBP 59.95)
Weekend Pass for February 20202 Dudley Bug Ball Games Convention - GBP 10.00 (Normally GBP 15.00 does not include accomodation)
Since its first edition back in 1977, Chivalry & Sorcery's guiding principle has always been that no one is an island. Every character you play will have been shaped by the society around them - even your landless adventurer or free-booting wanderer had a home and family once!
Chivalry & Sorcery character generation therefore gives you the tools to create well-rounded characters who really feel like they belong to their world. Knights wield secular power and command the battlefield, while other warriors strive to win their spurs in combat and rise to join their ranks. Magick is deep and mysterious, drawing on real-world historical detail, and encompasses many forms, from divination magic to illusions, from harnessing the elemental powers of Air, Earth, Fire and Water, to enchanting wondrous items and artifacts of great power. Priests utter prayers and call upon the very miracles of their gods!
Previous editions of Chivalry & Sorcery focused on Christianity as the core religion of the medieval setting. In this new edition, we're expanding the rules to incorporate Judaism and Islam as possible faiths for your characters. At the same time, the rules for priests and miracles are structured for you to tailor them to any religion, whether real-world or fictional, to best fit your campaign. 
In Chivalry & Sorcery, you decide the level of magic and fantasy for your game. Run a medieval high fantasy game filled with magic, miracles and myth, archmages, elementalists, and dragonfire - or one of gritty, low fantasy, or even pure historical simulation. The choice is yours!   
From fairy-tale romance to courtly love, from religious intrigue to brutal, bloody battle, Chivalry & Sorcery lets you play in just the Middle Ages you want. It caters for the full gamut of your medieval fantasy needs, from knightly vigils and holy quests, dynasties and domain management, right through to gaggles of bad-ass goblins and terrifying dragons.  
The Rules
Back in the day, Chivalry & Sorcery often had a reputation as a complex game. A lot of that was down to the presentation of the core book with pages of dense, tiny print. Today, we'd say that C&S is a detailed game, but not a complicated one. It provides you with all the rules you could want (or need) for running a deep game of medieval adventure with a strongly realistic feel. But the rules themselves, centred on the Skillscape system, are clean and consistent, and adaptable to all the situations you'll experience in play.  
Quickstart rules can be found here
 https://www.drivethrurpg.com/product/281664/Chivalry--Sorcery-5-Quickstart-Rules

Shipping costs will be calculated using a pledge manager after the close of the Kickstarter campaign, and will be based on the exact products contained in your final pledge, and are therefore additional to your Kickstarter pledge. Unfortunately, due to excessive import duties, we're unable to ship to Brazil for this project. 
PEOPLE 
With over 200 years of role-playing and publishing experience combined (!), we are:
Stephen Turner 
A role-player for four decades, Steve served his scribe's apprenticeship writing scenarios for RPGA tournaments in the 1990's, including the Ravenloft Open two years running at UK Gencon. Forming Brittannia Game Designs Ltd in 1997, he has gone on to create the "Dragon Reaches of Marakush" campaign setting for Chivalry & Sorcery, and has made contributions to all BGD products, including the adventures "Where Heroes Fear to Tread" and "Treachery".
Francis Tiffany 
is a professional portrait painter based in Vancouver, Canada. He has been a player of Chivalry & Sorcery since 1979, having been introduced to the game at school. He has always been interested in medieval history, writing his art college dissertation on medieval miniature painting. He has previously undertaken work for Games Workshop, Chaosium Inc, and Brittannia Game Designs. 
Andy Staples 
is a communications consultant and former journalist based in the Middle East. He's a founder member of the Gulf Role-Playing Community, and has been a fan of Chivalry & Sorcery since discovering the 2nd edition around 1984. Ed Simbalist's article on manorial economics led him to run research projects on medieval villages, agriculture and landscapes. He has previously done design work for Columbia Games Inc and Brittannia Game Designs. 
Colin Speirs 
...has no idea why he is in this book. This is just one of the many topics that baffle him, despite the many contributions he has made: the creative force behind the Chivalry & Sorcery Essence RPG, Rocket Jocks, and the scenario "Under the Castle Gates", and his lengthy experience of gaming and play-testing. 
Dave Blewitt 
...comes from an area rich with history, whose language is closest to that of Chaucer. He combines a love of role-playing and history with testing systems to destruction! 
Paul "Wiggy" Wade-Williams
An RPG writer for over 20 years, Wiggy has freelanced for several RPG companies, including Brittannia Game Designs Ltd. He co-created Triple Ace Games in 2008 and he is TAG's Director of RPGs. Chivalry & Sorcery fans will know him from the popular Dwarf and Elf Sourcebooks.
Andrew Cowley
Andy has always had a passion for history and the chivalric period, where fantasy, faith and warfare come together. Stories of King Arthur and his Knights of the Round Table sparked his imagination, and he began writing for D&D, before finding himself collaborating on the Chivalry & Sorcery game with Britannia Games Design. After thousands of hours of work designing tabletop RPGs, he's now director of Anderian Designs Ltd and the main force behind the products of Reedwater and the supporting FATE adventures.

campaign.story:
Sadly this is not a sword. It is, however, a healing potion, which is almost as good. Here's your chance to get a set of 10 dice designed specifically to use for healing potions in the 5E system! Each dice is labeled 2-5, negating the need to add anything to the dice when rolling for anything except a supreme healing potion.  
  The response I received when I unveiled my prototype of these dice on Reddit was overwhelming, showing me a demand far beyond my own meager production capabilities! As such, I've reached out to get these dice injection-molded so that I can make them available to everyone at a quality level I'm happy with. 
One major change these have over my initial product release is the corrected healer's symbol: These dice will bear the Rod of Asclepius instead of the Caduceus. 
My objective with this Kickstarter is to raise enough money to pay for a production run of these dice. They will be finished and packaged in house, as I want to verify the quality myself before I send them to anyone. Here’s what you’ll get: 
The beauty of this Kickstarter is that you’re backing a fully developed product, fully engineered and ready for production! I developed these dice a while ago and have been producing them in prototype-level quantities in my workshop - mainly for friends and family, as a result I know these dice throw well, and the designs you’re buying are complete and beautiful. Effectively, you know exactly what you’re getting.
Each set contains ten (10) healing d4's - the exact amount you'll need if you ever get lucky enough to find a supreme healing potion. 
*NOTE: The boxes come without dice by default, which is why they're an add-on item. If you want to include extra dice with them, the prices are as follows:
Small cherry or walnut case & bottle: $28 for the bottle, box, and two dice.
Large cherry or walnut case & 5 bottles: $110 for the bottles, box, and ten dice. 
To add an add-on, simply add that amount to your pledge. When you receive your backer survey you'll be able to list exactly which items you added. 
I’m a total geek who has way too many hobbies. I’ve played D&D since 3rd Edition, and have loved seeing the community grow into mainstream. I’ve watched Critical Role ever since discovering it a few years back, and am currently involved in at least four active RPG campaigns. 
Looking at the giant chessboard around him, Caolan realized that there was no escape. Two of his friends had already fallen and the enemy queen glared down at him, raising her sword. Resigning himself to his fate, he fruitlessly tried to ward her off. “If only we’d brought more healing potions…” he thought as everything faded into blackness.
The idea for this project ties back to a particularly costly engagement in which three members of my D&D party fell in battle, failing all our death saves and effectively wiping out half the group. My replacement character is a pure healing cleric/warlock who I made to be the ultimate combat medic. Me, being the ridiculous human being that I am, decided she should have her own unique dice. After a completely frenetic week involving significant amounts of caffeine, a decided lack of sleep, and way too much metal music and Critical Role podcasts, the healer’s dice were born.
When I shared my initial prototypes for these dice on Reddit, the response I received was overwhelming. By popular demand I opened the Etsy shop I’d been toying with for a while, and sold out of the original Caduceus dice within a few minutes. I realized there was no way to keep up with demand if I was doing everything in-house, so I put together this Kickstarter to raise the money to get someone to help me produce them (and maybe bring some of my other ideas to light as well - at the time of this writing I have 67 more product ideas in my development list).
 The majority of these funds will go toward getting a mold and producing dice. I have some stretch goals planned (all the way to $100,000 if this entirely blows me away) to get you guys even cooler things if this goes well. 
Some of the money will go toward moving my tools out of my house and into a shop (currently about half of my home is configured as a workshop, and though that’s what I always thought I wanted growing up, it turns out it is not at all what I want. Careful what you wish for, kids. It’s almost impossible to stop working if you’re living in your workspace.) 
Extra funds will go toward getting more of these ideas on my list developed, and bringing you a huge array of completely unique RPG products!
The Infinity-Edge is patent-pending by Dice Envy and is being used with express permission.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The biggest risks I foresee with this project come with outsourced production. I've been making these in house for a while, but I can't make enough to meet demand without outside assistance. I'm doing my best to ensure I'll hit my production deadlines, and have been working with a number of manufacturers to ensure this will be produced well and in a timely fashion. Once we hit our funding goal, I intend to reach out and use some of my own money to have the molds made and proofed, which should ensure production can begin as soon as the Kickstarter funds are delivered.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hi everyone.
First, thank you for being patient. Effectively, my life fell to pieces right after I posted the last update, and I've kind of dropped off the face of the map while I've tried to pick up the pieces and put things back together. It seems every time I've felt like I was almost there, my feet have been swept out from under me again. At the moment my full attention is on trying not to lose my apartment, finalize taxes, and get my personal financial situation under control (the COVID situation coupled with some life events I can share and some I can't has bankrupted me personally). I was finally able to find a new full-time job (I think I posted back early this year I was looking for one for insurance purposes before the floor fell out from under the job market. It turns out I needed one for more than insurance purposes).

Hi Everyone,
I've been seeing the requests for an update, so I figured I'd get this out while I'm working on the big one. I have the dice, and the tokens are mostly done. I don't have the prescription bottles (that's been a bit of a fiasco, especially with the COVID situation), but I'll be starting to ship the glass bottles very soon. 
Sorry about the delays - I've had what feels like an unending stream of family and personal crises that have required way more attention than I could afford to give them. Between that and COVID it put me into a state that required hospitalization for a bit. My head is back together now, and I'm up and operational, producing dice as quickly as possible for my shop and prepping the Kickstarter to ship.

Good news! I finally got the shipment of dice in! I'll post pictures shortly - I've been going through and QCing the shipment (which takes a significant amount of time when you're inspecting 40,000 individual dice). The resulting dice are a slightly lighter red than I originally expected, but they look very nice, and I'm excited to get them out to you!
Sorry about the delays. This COVID-19 shutdown has been massively affecting me - I went from living alone to having a toddler and an elementary school student in the house, who all of the sudden are not able to go to school. It's been an incredible blessing having them here, but I've found it difficult to be anywhere near as productive as I used to be. I'm working on things and figuring out how to make everything work.

updates.update_userinfo: UPDATE! (Finally) - Dice Are Enroute to Me Now.
updates.update_content:
Hi everyone! Sorry about the delay between the latest updates - getting my family out of China before the virus shut everything down was... stressful. They finally got their US visas just in time for the virus to interdict travel - their flights kept getting cancelled. They actually got out literally one day before China shut down internal travel, then we had them in voluntary quarantine in my house for two weeks to make sure nobody had the virus.
I actually ended up getting quite sick with the flu (I had to confirm that it wasn't COVID-19, even though my wife and kids were never near anyone with it) for a few weeks myself. I attribute that to the stress of the past bit. I'm finally back on my feet and getting caught up on orders from my Etsy shop.

Sorry about the delay between updates - my life became insane on a truly epic level, and it's been all I could do to tread water for a while. I'm starting to get things back under control now. Long story short: running a business is hard. Running a business while dealing with US immigration for estranged family is insane.
In any case, the update you all wanted to hear: Dice manufacturing is now complete! The dice will likely end up arriving sometime shortly after Chinese New Year.

updates.update_userinfo: Good News, Bad News, and a Look Into the Dice Manufacturing Industry
updates.update_content:
Hi everyone, I hope this update finds you well. This is the kind of update I hate giving, because I have to announce a delay in shipping. 
The Good News: According to my factory rep, the Healer's Dice molds are done.
The Bad News: The factory has not started production yet (which was supposed to be done, with the dice arriving with my receiving company 24 days ago), owing to the Christmas rush.

Hi everyone! Sorry it's been so long since the last update. Starting a dice business is a lot more work than I anticipated. I've brought my brother in to help manage finances and the business end of things (he's way better at that than I am - I'm a product person). 
The dice molds are, according to my manufacturer, almost done - it would have been much faster to make resin molds, but I opted for acrylic to improve the regularity of the design (and because we had to make about 40,000 dice). They should be testing the molds this week, then delivery will happen shortly after that. As soon as the dice are delivered to me I'll begin fulfillment. After gaining more experience through my Etsy shop, I feel comfortable stating that I can complete fulfillment on 40-50 orders a day. Unfortunately, this means that some of the orders may arrive a little later than anticipated, as the dice are getting to me considerably later than I anticipated.

Hi everyone! I've been a bit quiet lately, but I've been working my tail off.
First, the deposit on the mold is with the manufacturer, and I'm expecting it to be done in a few weeks - as soon as I get the announcement I'll send out an update to you all! We're on track for fulfillment in December.
Second, I have an announcement on the Healer's Dice themselves - the initial production run of these dice is it - 4,000 sets will be made, but after that this mold will be retired per my licensing agreement. I'll likely create another mold in the future - a different design for Healer's Dice, but these 4,000 sets will be the only infinity-edge Healer's Dice ever made for the Arcanist's Armory. More than half of those sets have already been sold through the Kickstarter.

updates.update_userinfo: Back From China, Cards Charged on Backerkit, and Updates!
updates.update_content:
Hi everyone, sorry about my radio silence the past bit - I ended up overstressing my body a bit while in China and ended up with one of the worst colds I've ever experienced. Trust me, flying 12.5 hours with a cold is not a fun experience at all. On the flip side, after meeting with the factory I got to see my wife and daughters, who I haven't seen  in person in over a year (visa issues have kept them in China for the past two-and-a-half years). 
Meeting with the factory was great! We worked out production for the Healer's Dice in depth and I signed the contract. After that we planned out the next Kickstarter in a fair bit of depth and I was able to build a good relationship with the factory staff. I feel confident that they'll make some awesome dice for you all! I also had a LOT of ideas for future projects, and am looking forward to receiving some prototypes in the very near future - stay tuned for pictures.

Hi everyone! First, if you haven't yet, please finish your backer survey. If you need it resent (or a new link to it) click the following link:
https://healers-dice.backerkit.com/
Second, I'm currently in China meeting with the manufacturer I ended up selecting. campaign.story:
Final Days TLDR version:
So you just got here and you want the fast version?
There are seven map sets available:
Forest
Cavern
Mountain Pass
Heathland
Dungeon
Extra Detail Tiles
Linking Tiles
All the sets contain 30, double sided tiles printed on playing card stock. 
Just choose how many sets you’d like, and pledge for that many. You’ll be asked what sets you’d like after the campaign ends, in the survey. 
Shipping is included - there’s no more to pay. 
The digital pack that gets you all the tiles in a format suited to virtual table tops. 
Every physical reward pledge level gets you the digital pack at no extra cost. 
For more detail, read on!

Battle maps are awesome! 
Everyone knows that having a wonderful resin scenery set-up, or a fancy neoprene battle map for those set-piece battles is great. 
But what about random encounters or locations you haven’t planned for? Or what if (like me) you simply don’t have the budget for loads of scenery? 
And how do you even transport all that stuff to the game anyway? And even then, how do you keep things sufficiently varied?
When I started using maps and miniatures for my own RPG games these were questions I had to find answers to. 
And that’s where my map tiles come in. 
Supplied in sets of 30, my double-sided, card-stock map tile sets will fit in a coat pocket and won’t break the bank. 
Designed to be extremely flexible in usage they cover 4 main locations: Forest, Mountain Pass, Heathland and Cavern. 
The art is all hand-made. I use digital painting programs rather than 3d renders, so everything has a nice handmade feel that blends right in with painted miniatures.
They’re six inches square - a size I have come to really love in my home games. It’s a great balance of flexibility, allowing you to build very different encounter maps from a few tiles, with extreme portability. 120 tiles will fit in your bag with ease and allow endless set ups on the fly.
Here's the bullet points: 
30 tiles per set
4 Sets available: Mountain Pass, Forest, Cavern and Heathland
Full colour
Double-sided 
Printed on 270gsm card-stock
Highly connectable within each set
6 inches square
Gridded and Grid-free options available 
Digital versions available for virtual table tops 
Shipping is included in your pledge
Each tile is repeated in the set so you can have at least one more than one of a particularly useful tile in any set up. Each set has at least twenty two unique faces - I've added more of any given tile where it seemed useful to have spares.
And of course, if you want to be really fancy, just pledge for two lots of each set, and then you can make whatever you like without restraint!
The tiles are full colour, 6 inches square and printed on card-stock, in the USA. It’s important to note that it’s a key feature of the design that these tiles are NOT board - they're not made from the stuff board game tokens are made from. They're printed on 270gsm card-stock, and with good reason: 30 board tiles just wouldn’t fit in your jacket pocket, and would cost a lot more!
This is an important point. With many years in games production under my belt I could have these made on board, or indeed other, fancier materials. And maybe another time I'll make something more demanding and expensive. But for this nice straightforward Kickstarter I want the tiles to be both affordable and transportable.
They are professionally printed, with a nice satin finish. Let's take a look at some of my samples. These are the real thing:
Here's a low resolution PDF of the whole Cavern Set.
Cavern
Classic dungeon stuff, this set features narrow passages (two squares wide on the inch grid versions, sometimes narrowing down to one), cramped chambers, and various intersections. There are also lots of tiles for making larger chambers from more than one tile. 
(The tiles in this image are home-printed prototypes, but show the kind of tiles you'll find in the Cavern Set)
There are tiles for 2 tile rooms, 3 and 4 tiles rooms, and even larger caves using the cave floor spacer tiles. It's a really versatile set for making that spontaneous troll hole along the road, or a small series of caves to explore.
Available with or without a one inch grid. You'll be able to choose at the end of the campaign.
 Forest 
A series of narrow paths through the green, this set is great for rolling travel on woodland paths. There are a variety of tiles for constructing various size of clearing. There's a tomb entrance, a pool, a woodland stream-crossing and more.
The Forest Set is available with or without a one inch grid. You'll be able to choose at the end of the campaign.
 Mountain Pass 
The Mountain Pass set works as a variant dungeon too, but is intended for crossing mountain terrain. It has cliff edges both up and down for walls. There are loads of stepped levels in this set, and tiles to make large arenas in the rock.
Here's the real thing in action: 
The Mountain Pass set, like all the sets, is available with or without a one inch grid. You'll be able to choose at the end of the campaign.
 Heathland 
The Heathland Set one doesn't have the obvious paths or passage ways of the other sets - well not quite. It features rolling open wilderness, scattered with depressions, gullies and rocks. And there's a selection of road tiles that run through the open country. Here's half the set of 30 tiles in action:
The Heathland Set is available with or without a one inch grid. You'll be able to choose at the end of the campaign.
For this Kickstarter we have just four stretch goals. They have all been unlocked. 
Our aim here is to keep things nice and easy for everyone, and to deliver in a timely fashion. 
These are the entirety of our stretch goals for this Kickstarter:
£500 - We fund UNLOCKED!
The tiles become real! 
£750  - Linking tiles UNLOCKED!
These "linking tiles" bridge between the sets, allowing you to mix them together. There will be 30 tiles in this set, with just the same specification as the initial sets. To get these, simply amend your pledge to include an additional set of tiles.
£1000 - Extra Detail Tiles UNLOCKED!
This is another set of 30 tiles you'll be able to add to your pledge, which feature more specific detailed locations to each of the pre-existing tile sets. To get these, simply amend your pledge to include an additional set of tiles.
(Mock up to come!)
£6000 - Dungeon Tile Set UNLOCKED!
This is another set of 30 tiles you can add to your pledge, which features rectangular dungeon chambers and corridors. To get these, simply amend your pledge to include an additional set of tiles.
Here's a mock up of the Dungeon Tiles in progress:

The art is complete for the initial four sets, layout is done, and they’re ready to be printed. 
Work on the linking tiles and the extra detail sets is well underway, and is a case of customising existing files, rather than making new images from scratch. So if we're lucky enough to unlock those, that won't delay us, nor move the estimated delivery date.
The Dungeon Tile set was a surprise addition, but is in layout now.
We have to wait 2 weeks for KS to process pledges, during which time I'll make any additional art I may need to.
Printing will require a proofing process which takes a few weeks. Once we’re happy with the proofs, we’ll have the printer send out your tiles direct to you for US orders. For those of us elsewhere in the world we’ll order a single large batch to the UK and dispatch from there. 
We are aiming to be all wrapped up way before Brexit makes things anymore complicated.
I make art, write and design games. You may have seen my work in Dungeons & Dragons, The One Ring, Adventures in Middle-earth, Warhammer Fantasy Roleplay, Warhammer Historical, Dragon Warriors, Beyond the Wall and many other games. You may have even played the Forest Dragon, a game I made with my young sons. For a long time I was creative director at Cubicle 7. Now I run my own games company, Handiwork Games.
I also run a very friendly Patreon here: www.jonhodgsonmaps.com, from whence this idea all springs.
I'm ably assisted in this project by Paul Bourne, who is an amazing graphic designer. Paul has a ton of experience in prepping files for print, and he's helped me get everything ready for production, as well as producing the wonderful graphics you see on this campaign page.
Something I want to do with this Kickstarter is move toward the heady days of being a (more or less) lone creator with a cool thing looking for support. And if you like it, you can get some of the cool things for supporting the project. 
My aim is to keep it simple, and to deliver as smoothly as humanly possible. 
I’m a person, you’re a person, and maybe if a bunch of us get together we can make a cool thing happen! That’s super awesome and what Kickstarter is all about, right?
While I’m going to make every reasonable effort to spread the word of this campaign, I’m not going to use external, paid promoters. I’ll just rely on anyone who wants to help me to spread the word, like the olden days. And that means I'm not anticipating any huge pile of loot here - I just want to gather together everyone who sees a use for my tiles, and together we can make them happen!
I know far too many people who’ve burned themselves out and really damaged their mental health using Kickstarter, trying to please everyone and squeeze out every drop of revenue. And that’s not right for this project or for me. 
And if there’s not enough interest, or this isn’t exactly the project you’re looking for? Never mind! It’s all good! We'll have some fun along the way!
Pledging is easy - simply choose from the menu of rewards how many sets of tiles you'd like. All the sets cost the same, and are all comprised of 30 double sided tiles. Just pick how many you'd like. You can adjust your pledge throughout the campaign. 
There's a really good deal to be had in pledging for more than one set, and free shipping will not be available after the campaign ends. So don't miss out!
This section is nice and easy: Shipping is included for simplicity's sake. I've spend a loooong time working out all our costs, and it should work out just fine for us, while keeping things nice and easy for you. 

Thanks for reading this far, and I hope you like the tiles and decide to support us bringing them to life!
The beautiful Viking Dice are from http://www.dicedudes.co.uk/product/viking-dice-set/
The awesome Miniatures are from Red Box Games: http://red-box-games.com
The gorgeous Deven Rue Compass Rose is from Campaign Coins: https://campaigncoins.com/deven-rue-compass-rose/
All appear here by kind permission of their creators, and I thank them for their support and encourage you to support them in turn!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I've run two previous Kickstarters and both delivered nice and quickly. The first doubled in size through the campaign, so slipped a little on initial estimates - we really didnt think we'd enjoy such support!

Having learned from that, the second campaign was better prepared, and we delivered approximately one month early to most backers and on time to everyone else. That's our aim here too - to deliver ahead of time if we possibly can.

One "risk" is that we're not really taking requests on this campaign. If you have an amazing idea for a set of tiles, or a feature that should be included, we might be able to include that in a future campaign. But this set of tiles is all planned out, and the work is almost entirely done. So in order to meet our targets of a nice simple campaign that delivers on time, we can't change course very much.

Another is that because our work is largely done I won't delay delivery by adding more sets that need to be made from scratch, so if you're looking for a campaign that explodes with extra content, maybe this one isn't for you. But hopefully, there's plenty to enjoy from the get-go!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hello! 
The second wave of Map Tiles is live now on Kickstarter!https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/jonhodgsonmaptiles2/jon-hodgson-map-tiles-2
We have a bunch of new sets, with even more to unlock, and we're live now! All the details are at the campaign page!

Hello!
I hope you're enjoying your tiles!

Greetings friends,
All map tiles have been dispatched as of 10am on Tuesday! There are no more to send, and dispatch is complete.
Hello!

Hello!
 Shipping update: We’re almost there! I’m waiting on a couple of final boxes that customs have been holding for a while. I’ve attempted to phone them to see if we can get it moving, but no dice - they don’t discuss shipments on the phone. But we’re still on target to get all dispatch done this week. Fingers crossed we make it! Worse case scenario we slip a day or two. But otherwise it’s all going forward according to the plan. Great! Just a dozen parcels to go.
 
 New sets

Update time!
So hopefully tiles are steadily arriving with our UK and International backers! The dispatch effort has continued non stop, and my arms are now about a foot longer than before from moving tiles around! Printed paper gets heavy fast, but happily I need the exercise!

In the end I made a second order with the printer to cover the damages and build up our stocks, and on a fine-detail stocktake I discovered I do need some more sets to complete the backer rewards. The great news is that batch has positively whizzed across the Atlantic, and is through customs and en route to me right now. That’s quite the contrast to the previous batch. Again, this part of the update doesn’t really affect you as backers - the only limit on delivery now is how fast we can pack and ship, and I’m content that’s progressing at a good pace.

Estimating conservatively, by the end of next week I anticipate we’ll be done and done. I’m aiming for sooner.

In the meanwhile, let’s take a look at the new tile sets I’ve been working on, as well as some exciting new ones from Handiwork Games’ graphic designer Paul Bourne.

Hello!
I am very happy to confirm that the first load of non-US parcels went out today! Yay! Twenty-plus-change are en route!
I’m still waiting on a couple more parcels of tiles, so I don’t have the full range on hand quite yet. But that won’t stop me starting. And more tiles are scheduled to arrive tomorrow. (More duty paid, but all very reasonable.)

Hello!
Well it’s been a busy day! I took delivery of the first of what I estimate to be a 10 box delivery of tiles! So, we have some on hand, and so dispatch is officially begun to Uk/EU/RoW!

The (slightly) bad news is that the box was damaged before it reached here. To be completely honest I’m disappointed in the packaging from the printer. The parcel weighs more than 15kg, and is a single wall cardboard box. It tore itself apart in transit, which is entirely predictable if you’ve done much shipping.

So I’ll be dropping them a line about that. As much as anything else, they need to know their cartons aren’t up to the task. They’ve always been very good to me in the past, so hopefully we’ll get that fixed.

The UK carrier included an incredibly vague note to say that some of the contents of the parcel had to be destroyed, or repackaged. But that they were not liable for the damage since it occurred before it reached them. So I don’t actually know at this point if we lost any tiles sets.

No one's rewards will be delayed by this. We’ll see what the damage was when the rest arrive and we can do a count. I'm telling the story only because it's all part of the rich tapestry of Kickstarter!

As to the remaining 9 boxes:

I have paid modest duty on 2 more, as requested by the carrier. They arrive tomorrow. Her Majesty's Revenue have been very reasonable in their charges, which is good news. You never quite know what to expect, and I've ring fenced a sizeable fund to cover it.

I have notification of another box having arrived with the local post office - I expect there will be some duty to pay on that one before it reaches me.

So that’s 4 out of an estimated 10 accounted for. I’m hopeful over the coming days the rest will make their presence felt. And that there are no further damages. The delights of international shipping!

I’ll let you know when the first packages head out from here. It’s very likely to be tomorrow!

Thanks again!
Jon

Hello!
Just a quick update for those of us awaiting tiles outside the US. Progress was great until the 23rd, and the tracking has been stuck there ever since. I've seen this before, and large shipments like this do have a tendency to just show up at our door, or suddenly get a bunch of tracking updates in one go. Fingers continue to be crossed.

campaign.story:
Not sure which reward to get? Consider backing with any amount at the "No Reward" tier to stay updated and get all the PDF content. Become a Dragonbonded backer today and discover this Draconic universe we are creating for your entertainment! 
Last chance to join, final hours of the campaign.
Gargantuan dragons of 200mm tall, with unique designs and dynamic poses. For painters, collectors, gamers, and dragon lovers alike!
Dragons are intriguing creatures of absolute intelligence, wit, strength, and magic, are the indisputable kings and queens of mythical beasts, taking part in the birth of fantasy as a genre. Being a recurring figure in several cultures since ancient times, has given them an arcane mysticism which has captivated and fascinated our minds.
Hence, and bound to their will, we present you this passionate project, so you can take part in this quest and join us to pay proud homage for these most compelling and enchanting beings. 
The mythical kings of beasts have been part of tabletop games since the first red dragon graced the pages of RPGs. They have been enemies, main antagonists, rulers, greatest of calamities, and even allies in some games. Nevertheless, whichever is their motivation or drive, they always evoke greatness and an ever present sense of danger and omen to the players. In war games, dragons  are tide changers in battle; fielding one of these creatures makes the opponent completely focus their efforts on it, hoping to eradicate it before it can wreck their plans. Due to its nature, no matter the instance or occasion in which a dragon gets involved in the plot, it will never fail to play a role of crucial importance or to cause great commotion and awe among those who behold its majesty. 
The Red Moon, being in truth a Dralorian misnomer for the planet of Drakha, is the residence to the Great Wyrms. 
Kadmos, the first dragon in existence, kept a great desire to make more beings of its likeness, achieving it through a rare fission process. Each new dragon was unique in their own way, and from them, in time, 33 broods conquered every corner of the Red Moon.
The Great Wyrms, direct descendants from Kadmos, rule their own broods and pursue their ideals and desires. Draconic offspring and dragonkin are usually present on the Great Wyrms’ lair but each and every brood retains singularities which differentiate them from the rest. 
As expected from any Great Wyrm, eldest and most powerful among the ancient dragons, these miniatures are really huge and fall in the ‘Gargantuan’ category, with around 200mm of height! 
These dragon miniatures can be used in all fantasy roleplaying games and war games. We will provide backers with stats for 5e, the 9th age, stats for our Draco system RPG and other games where you might want to introduce your dragons.
This is not just another Kickstarter campaign, this is the beginning of a long and exciting journey in the best Draconic setting you will ever see. Join us today on Kickstarter, and fly with us for many years to come in every new release of this Draconic saga.
Whether you are a dragon fan, a 3D maker, a role-playing gamer, a war gamer or a collector, we want to reward you for your kind support toward this project and you will receive awesome rewards for your contribution. 
Final product and colors may vary from those shown
what is included in the STL bundle pledge
what is included in the STL bust add-on

 Kickstarter exclusive notice: Please note that some of these rewards might be exclusive of this campaign. Even though we can’t confirm yet what is exclusive and what is not (even the actual miniatures), we can assure you that pledging now will get you extra perks and/or additional items at a discount depending on your pledge level.
Delivery date notice: You may notice that pledge levels for miniatures are limited. We can produce around 150 gargantuan miniatures to ship on December 2019. From there, we can produce additional 150 miniatures every 6 months. This affects in two ways:
Reward tiers for the same delivery date might have their availability changing to always have at least 1 left for each. When that is not possible, that shipping batch will be closed and we will open new reward tiers for a new shipping wave (6months).
When we open a new shipping batch, the delivery date will display 6 months after the previous one.
Please note that this was calculated with the worst case scenario so we might run into happy surprises and be able to ship extra copies if everything goes smoothly and/or if we are able to expand our workshop.
In this Kickstarter, we want you to be part of a premium experience and as the campaign's funding progresses we will improve what you get in exchange for your support. Some stretch goals are freebies while others will allow us to cover modelling and fixed costs to enable add-ons.
These busts are available as add-ons for $25 USD each. Cast in resin with 75mm height
Applies to reward levels including full-body dragon miniatures. Includes an art print (a5 format) with the original artwork from Tom Babbey! You can frame it or just keep it as reference for painting your dragon.
An alternate sculpt of the head; opening its jaws if they are closed in the original sculpt, or closing them if it is the other way!
This head will come as an extra in your resin kit (it is also included in the .stl pack) and if you are good with magnets you will be able to have both head options on your awesome dragon! 
Now that Nixis is unlocked we will start working on the body design and 3d sculpt. We will share the progress with you!
Nixis will be available for any 'Shipping wave 2' pledge level. The 'x4 dragons' reward tier will go live on Wednesday March 20th at 10am Pacific daylight time in case you are all-in for these great wyrms. 
This bust is included in the digital .stl bust bundle ($15) or as a separate bust casted in resin ($25) and will ship on wave 2 and further.
Scenic bases will be unique to each dragon in both style and size to fit the very unique dragons. The prices for each base is explained in the add-ons section below. 
Epic Encounters are designed as awesome fights where the dragons lore, attributes and unique abilities really come into play.

There is a song, known and intoned by dragons all over the Red Moon. For the longest of times, there never was a record of it, for it only was learned and repeated in the tongue of the dragons. The following transcription can be found engraved in a stone, a painstaking recreation of that song, most likely made by an unfortunate dralorian, dragged there many redmoons ago. Design
The dragons were masterfully drawn by Tom Babbey, with his expertise and knowledge of wildlife and anatomy of real animals, he manages to create fantastic creatures such as dragons that look as if they could be real. This incredible skill coupled with the complex lore and personalities thought for the creatures, resulted in unique and amazing dragons which are the beginning of a bigger and very rich universe.
The drawings are then brought to life by interpreting the detail and emotion from the image and translating it into a 3d model, keeping as much detail in both, proportions and pose, to stay true to the original concept. 
The 3d model is then printed in a jewelry quality resin printer, the model is split into pieces to optimize number of parts while keeping the most detail and achieving the best result while casting the pieces. 
The final result is a model truly incredible to behold. As a center piece, the final challenge for the players, a statue on a shelf, a painted entry to a contest, or anything you want it to be.

Manufacture
Our resin is of the highest quality, vacuumed and pressure cast to release and avoid most imperfections. We have the highest standards and discard any large imperfections that do not meet what we know people expect to see when they receive their miniatures. We have been producing miniatures for over a year now and we have increased our output and quality exponentially. With these dragons we will deliver our best quality yet, and what we know every collector, painter, gamer, and dragon lover is hoping for.
You can read more about or workshop and trajectory in this project update.
Packaging
The miniatures will be produced in high quality resin, they will come unassembled and will need washing with warm water and soap to remove the de-molding agent used in production. The pieces will be keyed for better assembly and small pieces will be stored in plastic bags so they don't get lost in transit or inside the box.
All miniatures will arrive in a premium draconic box which we are still designing and inside you will find the unassembled parts ready to prime, glue and paint. If we unlock stretch goals with alternate heads or parts, you will be able to customize your own dragons.

Reward tiers for the same delivery date might have their availability changing to always have at least 1 left for each. When that is not possible, that shipping batch will be closed and we will open new reward tiers for a new shipping wave (6months).

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
OBJECTIVE 
With this campaign we want to make majestic and top-quality resin miniatures at our own workshop. Some components in this campaign, including the miniatures themselves, might not be obtainable elsewhere. Our Kickstarter Exclusives / Promos are available only for Kickstarter backers or at special events and fairs directly with us.

We are working with some of the best partners for this project based in the universe from Draco Gaming (Dragonbond:Dragons of the Red Moon).
Concept Art & dragon design by Tom Babbey, 3D sculpts by Axolote Gaming, manufacture with Draco Forge, Kickstarter management by Draco Gaming, pledge management with Backerkit and fulfillment with Quartermaster Logistics and La Caravana.

POLICIES 
This the third campaign for a physical product of Draco Studios and second for Resin miniatures produced by Draco Forge. Just as the last time we are committed to do everything right and connect with people from around the world who share the love for DRAGONS. 
We can refund you within 7 days of the campaign’s end, fees included. After that, we have a policy of no questions asked, though that’s minus Kickstarter and payment processing fees (between 10% and 12%). This policy lasts until the time when we lock orders in our pledge manager, after that point no refunds are possible. If we realise a component cannot be delivered after many months of trying, we refund that completely, including fees.

This will be a transparent campaign, if any issues occur, we will let you know through project updates – which will be regularly posted after the campaign is funded. At least once per month.

We are so committed to publish our products with the best quality, that we will put money from our pockets if needed in case of any undesired events.

BackerKit is our preferred software to manage the pledges and to ensure a smooth process for our backers for selecting add-ons. Backers should answer their surveys before the indicated deadline to expect to receive their rewards at the promised time. Otherwise, their rewards will be sent on a second wave of deliveries or incur in extra shipping charges.

Manufacture will be held in Mexico. If your product arrives damaged after shipping or has any missing pieces due to assembly problems, we will send you a replacement for no extra cost. We might ask you to return the other copy and send proof of the issue with a picture (in case we need to file a claim with the postal service).

Any Kickstarter Exclusives are available by us only on active Kickstarter campaigns and special events such as gaming conventions. Availability on pledge manager is not mandatory and we reserve the right to take that decision.

CHALLENGES 
Even though we are trying to offer you a flawless campaign, we don't know if this campaign will get enough backers to reach the funding goal. We have a large team that will work on fulfilling this project. We would like to ask for your help to spread the word with a friend, a local store, or your social media.

RISKS 
Third-party issues happening during shipping will be treated in a case-by-case basis. We will share with you every progress related to the project. 
The most probable delays are: 
Production delays 
Shipping delays 
Customs delays 
We have added some buffer time to the project timeline scope.

TERMS AND CONDITIONS

By pledging to this project, you acknowledge that the final look, materials, colours and content of the rewards (and the project) are subject to change and may differ substantially from what is presented in this Kickstarter project page.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Magnetronic Terrain from Miniature Forge uses a unique moulding and casting process to imbed powerful neodymium magnets into high quality resin terrain. The parts snap together with a satisfying clunk, allowing you to form cinematic tactical terrain for your miniature games without worrying about glue, lost magnets, or reversed polarities. 
Our first offering is the 'Battlefield' range, suitable for sci-fi and modern-era tabletop miniature games. This range features: reinforced walls, gates, towers, and an expandable bunker system, all of which can be built in a variety of ways each time you use them.
The terrain is fun to put together, beautiful to look at, and wont break your bank balance.
Here is a quick look around the contents of our 'Checkpoint' pledge, which measures over a metre across:
PLAY

The starting point for the Battlefield range of Magnetronic Terrain is our walls. Like the majority of the range, the walls snap together allowing easy construction of you tabletop battlefield. With a mixture of straight sections, corners, gates, and end pieces, it is possible to construct enclosed compounds and perimeters for your games. 
Our Integrated Guard Towers and Bunkers are also compatible with the walls, further increasing the available options for your tabletop skirmishes. All terrain is suited for 28-32mm scales, making it compatible with the vast majority of mainstream tabletop war-games:
Miniature used in above example is of a typical 28-32mm scale, standing 35mm high and mounted to a 3mm tall base.
We have organised the Magnetronic Battlefield range into a range of pledge tiers and add-ons to allow you to build your collection easily. Start with one of our pledge tiers and then add in extra packs as needed to create a terrain set that meets your needs.
PLAY

PLAY

In addition to the pledge tiers above, our 'Support!' tier allows you to pledge as little as just £1 in order to follow along with the campaign updates and access the pledge manager after the campaign, where you will be able to upgrade that pledge to a higher tier if you so wish. The 'Support!' tier should also be used if you only wish to purchase items from the add-ons section below, increasing your £1 pledge by the value of the add-ons you have selected.
We have arranged this kickstarter into packs that will allow you to generate a variety of walls, bunkers and fortified positions. Simply mix and match the packs to achieve the terrain you need.
If you wish to add any of the following packs to your pledge, simply increase your pledge amount by the pack price(s) shown below. You will be able to confirm your selections in the pledge manager following the campaign.
I’m John Braisby, owner of Cromarty Forge Ltd. I’m a freelance miniature sculptor living in Aberdeen, Scotland. I have been a digital sculptor for over seven years, and have worked with multiple companies to make their dreams of miniature warfare domination into realities. 
The Magnetronic Terrain range, which we are kicking off with the 'Battlefield' range presented here, started as an experiment on how to imbed a magnet into a cast part. Anyone who has struggled with magnetising miniatures, only to get wrong polarities, misalignment, or magnet-pop-outs, will understand the benefit of moving the magnetisation onto the casting side of the process. Once I came up with a prototype system, I reached out to Mark Rapson at Word Forge Games to develop the product.
Together we formed Miniature Forge to bring that product to you. The Magnetronic range combines detailed sculpts, a unique manufacturing processes, and years of casting experience, to bring you a product that is a joy to use.
The 'Battlefield' range presented here is our starting point. We already have plans for additional terrain settings, as well as expansions to this line. 
Thanks so much for checking out this campaign!
John & the Miniature Forge team.
All shipping with be charged after the campaign in the pledge manager and will be based on the weight of the package. We will be shipping worldwide.
The following values give an approximate cost of shipping:
 UK: up to 2kg = £5  /  over 2kg = £8
 EU: up to 2kg = £10  /  over 2kg = £15
 US/CA: up to 2kg = £12  /  over 2kg = £17
 Rest of the world: up to 2kg = £15  /  over 2kg = £25
Certain countries may end up slightly cheaper or more expensive than the estimates stated above, but these will be confirmed in the pledge manager. 
Please note that all packages will be sent from the UK. Miniature Forge is not responsible for  any taxes or charges incurred from the import of these items.
Ah, stretch goals, my old nemesis! Magnetronic Terrain has been through a great deal of development to bring it to the stage it is currently at. We want to reward our backers for bringing this product range to life, and have done this by offering these items at the most competitive value we can.
We have all backed campaigns that have a gigantic list of stretch goals that unlock themselves every time the funding total goes up by 17p, but in order to maintain a fair price to the backer and prevent the campaign costs, logistics and fulfilment time being increased dramatically, we have decided against using stretch goals on this campaign. The product quality is already as high as we can make it and the cost associated with adding usable items make them unsuitable for use as stretch goals.
