campaign.story:
Time & Tide is my love letter to the World of Progress. Rather than focus on new rules or crunch this zine will dissect the heart & soul of SLA Industries.  What about this game has led to such a die-hard fanbase to still be active and growing after almost thirty years in print? Answers to this question will be attempted using essays, photos, fiction, interviews, art, social media posts and even recipes. Contents will include:
 Is it future or is it past? An essay comparing the themes and setting for SLA with those found in Twin Peaks and the dischordian ideas surrounding the KLF
 Real Talk / Real Time An interview with Jared and Mark from Nightfall Games about their thoughts on the creation process for SLA Industries
 The Mall of Progress Designing new brands and a massive downtown shopping center to capture the disturbing nature of capitalism
 Fan Service A chat with Ste Winwood about his love for SLA and how it led him to create and maintain several active fan forums online
 So Dark They're UV Exploring the horrors of the BPN gig economy 
 Dark Lamentations Fan created art & fiction, including work by Stuart Burns, Roger Duthie, and Ste Winwood
 Underneath It All A SLA Industries short story by Tamsyn Kennedy
 The Bigger Picture A personal account of how SLA Industries fandom helped one person through personal struggles
 CS1: Cake Sector One SLA themed baked goods! 

Following the ZineQuest guidelines, Time & Tide itself will be 100 pages, A5, have a thin card cover, and is staple-bound. In addition to this any backer who has accessibility needs will have provisions put in place to get all the content in a suitable format (large print, text files, etc). I'll be creating the master copy by hand, using chop'n'paste collage methods to cut up blocks of text, art  and other media then taping it all together. This will be photocopied into a final item that gives that old school zine look and feel. 
Kickstarter projects often run Stretch Goals that give backers more stuff for hitting certain milestones and this project will be no different. I originally set Stretch Goals based upon the number of people pledging, thus: 
 UNLOCKED!!! If we have 30+ Backers at The Deathwake Device level or above then every pledge that includes a copy of the Zine will also get a 1" round badge featuring Truffles T. Hogg (pictured above).
 UNLOCKED!!! If we have 20+ Backers at the Corporate Sponsorship level or above then all sticker packs will have a sixth design added to them in the form of a Time & Tide Soft Company ID Badge.
 UNLOCKED!!! Finally, if we have 10+ Backers at the Integration 20 level then every copy of the zine will have a two-page spread about The Dream added by hand using UV Ink!  

As we have smashed through all three of these I am putting in place the SLAYER'S CRIB STRETCH GOAL:
 For every 10% (or part thereof) over the 600% funded mark I will be able to make one free copy of Time & Tide which I'll send out to someone in the UK who is on the dole/PIP/benefits/shit wages/full-time caring for others.
 For every 10% (or part thereof) over the 800% funded mark I will be able to make two free copies of Time & Tide available for this purpose in the UK, or one copy to be sent internationally. I'll also add in a sticker with every copy of the Zine!
 For every 10% (or part thereof) over the 1000% funded mark I will be able to up this to three free copies of Time & Tide in the UK, or two internationally. If we reach this level of finding I'll also add a SLA-themed business card in with every copy of the zine!

It is hard to get by when you are waiting for the next BPN to come through so I'm keen to get copies out to folks who didn't have the option of backing the project just because capitalism is a shit method of production/resource allocation. I'll let folks know how they can get a copy this way once the KS has come to a close and I know how many copies I'll be able to make for free distro (though I won't be asking for any specifics from people and doing it on an honour system). 
In-keeping with the ethos of creating ephemeral items I will not be producing a pdf or digital download version of this zine. If you want additional copies/stickers/pages as part of your pledge then check out the FAQ to find out how to nab them. The only way to guarantee a copy will be through this Kickstarter. When it's done it's done.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I have been the publications officer for a national anarchist organisation and helped with several zine distros over the years. This has given me a wealth of experience producing zines, pamphlets, monthly newspapers, regular magazines, stickers, badges, and all sorts of other items intended for propaganda purposes. Putting together a zine like like this is part of the anarchist training package and shouldn't be a problem for me!

The main risk for this project is getting all the articles in with good time to meet my production time-scale. To account for this I've already started gathering submissions and herding all the kittens needed to make the final zine. Most of the copy should be edited and the layout drafted by the time the fund-raising comes to an end.

I'll also be sending out a production update every Friday to keep everyone in the loop as to where along the creation process things are. This will also give backers the chance to offer feedback that could make it's way into the zine. 

Some Kickstarters arrive with backers long after they predicted. As a stay-at-home mum I never really clock off and sometimes life just comes at me fast. To take this into account I've set aside four 2h slots a week where I'll just be working on the zine iteslf. I expect the actual creation process to be wrapping up some point at the end of March, however I've added an extra month onto the expected delivery timescales to take most things that could cause a delay into account. 

Finally, the fact that I'm making a 100 page zine does push us right to the limit of what is achievable with the format. I have successfully helped to create zines of the same size and so I'm fully aware of how this will eat into the amount of space I have on each page. This won't be a problem as I am hand assembling the pages of the master copy by hand, so I'll be able to know exactly how much space I have to play with rather than having to endlessly tweak an InDesign file.

Hi all!
I’m breaking radio silence to update you on projects I’ll be kickstarting in 2021. 
First up, I have just lunched a zine to help raise funds for my local indie games club. £5 for 3 full games, 5 articles, art and even some poetry! Funds raised on this project are going directly into improvements for the club. Check it out here. Even if you can't back this one, you'll be helping out a lot of geeks if you can share the link around.

With the announcement about SLA2.0 I have decided to try do two more SLA Industries fanzines over the coming months. These will be put together in a similar vein to T&T (A5 format, similar style), but with each with it's own theme and title:
-----
Ebb & Flow
-----
This fanzine will be accepting submissions that examine ideas of authoritarianism and liberty through the lens of the World of Progress. Topics include but are not limited to: militarism, capitalism, poverty/life on the dole, the rise of fascism, oppression around gender/race/ability, class society, the media and/or internet/meme culture. Submissions with an implicit or explicit antifascist/anti-authoritarian perspective will be given priority. -----

campaign.story:
Nibiru is a science fiction tabletop role playing game set in an ominous space station. It’s focused around the themes of memory, nature and artificiality, and features a rich world (inspired by Ancient Mesopotamia) as well as a quick-to-learn system that builds each player's persona based on the retelling of their pasts.
Nibiru is a space station submerged in the ocean of debris orbiting the Star of Fomalhaut. A monstrous, steel-clad vulture feeding off of a collection of unborn planets, Nibiru's purpose is unknown—at least, for those that reside in it. Near the Core of this skyless world, a group of enclosed city-states harbors the majority of the human population.
The final cover of the book is subject to change.
The characters portrayed by the players are different from the rest of the peoples of Nibiru. They come from strange places called Habitats, each functioning as an archetype that changes not just the backdrop of your memories, but the mechanics of how you recall them. From Dreamlanders—people that only seem to remember the lives of other individuals—to Vagabonds of the Machine—who share the memories prompted by a sentience-inducing computer virus—each of the five habitats holds mysteries of their own, as well as unique mechanics that make them all the more exciting to play.
Nibiru shines not just because of its otherworldly premise, but also due to it's deeply thematic and creative mechanics. The game features a very simple, skill-less system that makes your character grow as you recover the memories of your past. Each new entry in your Journal contains a narrative bit tied to a bonus (or penalty!) that serves to slowly reveal your character's strengths and weaknesses.
 As the game progresses, your journal grows along with your character, slowly revealing their true potential as well as their hidden past!
The way in which you write your memories has a power of its own. Far from being just narrative justifications for the mechanical development of your character, memories can impact the game via Revelations. Revelations enable you to add new consequences to what you write. Whether by using your memories as a message that can be stored within objects, producing a mind-shattering poison made up of your darkest recollections, getting bonuses for writing in rhyme or for telling an expansive story arc, Revelations allow for interesting tales to unfold not just verbally, but also in written form.
What are you waiting for? Try out a sample adventure and the basic MEMOs system with our free Quickstart Guide!
This Kickstarter has been launched to fund the printing of the Nibiru Corebook in a high-quality, hard cover format, with several of our goals pertaining the expansion and improvement of the book. Up until now, the game had been under development for two years—a labor of love that saw us invest heavily in the setting's portrayal, working with amazingly talented artists to bring Nibiru to life. 
Luckily for you, most of the art is now complete, as is its funding. Writing of the book is almost finished, with editing already taking place for the early chapters. Thanks to this commitment, we are able to keep our Kickstarter funding goal low and our delivery times reduced!
To avoid keeping you from playing the game for long, and given that we want every backer to feel like they get more as the Kickstarter progresses, the stretch goals we have designed are mainly geared towards expanding the content and improving the quality of our Corebook, which already includes...
► An overview of the Nibiru setting, as well as the story of the first nomad peoples that crawled out of the darkness to settle in the verdant immediacies of the Core.
► A dedicated chapter for each of the three regions of the Skyless World: Antumbra and the cradle of civilization, Penumbra and its humble colonies, as well as the untamed expanse of Umbra, where silence and darkness reign uncontested. Included with each area, we also feature a sample settlement with interesting story hooks, and a host of characters to meet, so that you can dive right in with your group.
► The mysterious Habitats and their Vagabonds, rumors about their nature as well as advice on how to write your memories, tap into the story-weaving elements of the MEMOs system and everything you need to remember your past while securing your future.
► Details on the bio-electric life forms of Nibiru, as well as the intelligent machines that are part of humanity's daily lives—each of these beautifully illustrated and showered with story ideas for you to utilize.
► A chapter focused on narration, and running games and story arcs centered around the recovery of the characters' memories, including tips on weaving plots in which your characters drive the story via their ambitions, face world-shattering events, escape dark conspiracies and fight to stay alive.
► A one-shot adventure designed to get you exploring the station from the get go!
Either if you just want to dip your toes with Just Awakened or you want to explore the full potential of Nibiru as a Whisperer, there are several different pledges for you to choose depending on how much you want to get involved! As we move past the funding goal, you'll see how your pledge gains value with each unlocked stretch goal, the bulk of which will be focused on adding to the Nibiru Corebook with extra content.
The Vagabond pledges come along with a choice: the choice of where your adventure starts. You'll receive a map of the region and their featured settlement, as well as an adventure set in said locale in PDF.
Antumbra, where Nibiru's city-states stand proud—each older than the other, each a beacon of hope for those escaping the harshness of the lower depths. Your character will need wits to navigate the complex social networks of the city-states, hiding in plain sight, and slowly carving a place for themselves amidst the masses that make this, the sprawl of the Core Sectors, their home

The discovery of massive tunnels under the Core Sectors delivered the Antumbran peoples a promise of new beginnings: Penumbra, the depths beyond. With time, however, their colonies grew increasingly isolated from the Core—and soon enough, they found within them the strength to cut ties. Your character will need to be bold, facing both the dangers that lie neath the shadow of the world and the conflict that plagues the struggling societies of Penumbra.
The domains of the Darkness are highly hostile to human life, with pressure 50% higher than Earth's gravity. Even with that, some exceptional people manage to thrive in Umbra. Weird folklore, mysterious locales, and the ever-looming dangers that crawl beyond the light; the Darkness is only for the strong and the mad. Your character will need to be brave to face the mysteries of Umbra—accepting of the fact that the place will change them forever.
Regarding shipping...

Once we are past our initial funding goal, we have a host of stretch goals to improve your experience! Most stretch goals will be focused on overhauling the Corebook. When more backers hop onto the campaign, everyone wins. Spread the word!
You can purchase add-ons for your pledge, with the options listed down below. Some pledges provide you with one option of a particular product (for example, a specific adventure or map). Buying add-ons allows you to purchase other products not included in your pledge.
To buy an add on, make sure to add the amount charged for it (see below) to your pledge. After the campaign is over, we'll notify you when it's time to process your order—where you'll get to choose the add-on you want to include.
Remember that physical add-ons might increase your shipping cost slightly. Our currently available add-ons are...
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We know how first-time Kickstarters can be—and that's why we've taken extra provisions! 

The Nibiru project has been going on for two years to ensure the most costly part of the it (art production) is done almost in its entirety, so that we can deliver promptly and without hassle. We are doing fulfillment via GamesQuest, and the team is personally going to be helping out to hand pack the pledges. We've looked at options to overcome possible challenges (such as Brexit, for which we've consulted with logistics agents, the likes of RPG shipping specialist Garry Harper). For this reason we've chosen to take shipping payments after the Kickstarter is over.

The writing in the book (with the exception of parts that might be expanded via the Kickstarter) is almost finished; the game mechanics thoroughly tested, and editing & proofreading is underway. All of this helps us focus on outreach, promotion of the game, and its production. We'd like to continue to produce quality material, and we know that the importance of getting our first project right cannot be overstated!

Federico Sohns, author and game designer of the game, is a full time Assistant Line Manager at MODIPHIUS Entertainment; publishers of the "Start Trek Adventures", "Achtung! Cthulhu" and "Conan: Adventures in an Age Undreamed Of" role playing games—among others. Under the flag of Araukana Media, he intends on releasing narrative-driven games with evocative settings and creative mechanics.

Questions? Suggestions? You can write to me via Kickstarter or to federico@nibiru-rpg.com !
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Nibiru Update #53 - New Ideas, and the Future of Araukana
updates.update_content:
Hello Vagabonds!
This was an overdue update, so I'll start by saying sorry I didn't send this in time! A lot of stuff has been happening over the past few days and I took a break from working on Nibiru for a couple of weeks over the last month.
During the last update, I spoke about this one detailing plans regarding Araukana's future. I've been focusing, for a while, on seeing how the community received Nibiru, and I'm very happy with what I've seen. The way I see it, Nibiru is a niche game that has some mainstream appeal given its format and art budget. A lot of the more passionate fans seem to be mostly hooked by the lore and the world of Nibiru, which is also what I put the more work and got the most enjoyment of. The great thing about that is that it allows me to take that setting and push for different creative endeavours set within the Skyless World.

updates.update_userinfo: Nibiru Update #52 - Nibiru, the Indies, and the Production Model
updates.update_content:
Hi Vagabonds!
I took a bit longer to sit down and write this update since in a way we are writing the epilogue to this whole adventure, and had to collect my thoughts and plan what I wanted to talk about in the last few updates. In this one, I wanted to make a reflection on ethical production of games and Nibiru in particular. Warning: it's LONG :P
There's a lot that I have talked about (and would like to write about) regarding the vision of Nibiru, and the stuff that I wanted to accomplish with it. To push for new, interesting mechanics with clearly defined objectives, to play around with the design space as much as I could, to create a deep world that knows the kind of themes and stories it wants to communicate, and to do so while taking a lot of care for the aesthetic feel and the style we bring to the table.

Hi Vagabonds!
I wanted to quickly check in with you to wish you a happy new year, and to let you know that Nibiru will be shipping out tomorrow, with all packages expected to be shipped by Friday :) the warehouse has confirmed that, from today, people should start receiving their packages in about 4-5 business days (for those closer to the UK!).
I hope you are having a great time through the holiday season, and take good care of yourselves :) I'm super looking forward to knowing that you're happy with the game, and will update you close to the 20th of the month for another monthly update and views on the future of the game. I'm also prepping to release the game to the wider public within the next weeks, so if you didn't have a chance to hop in and you are reading this, make sure to follow us!

updates.update_userinfo: Nibiru Update #50 - New Year and Shipping!
updates.update_content:
Hi Vagabonds!
Christmas is looming on us and so another update is due! Last time I wrote about the delays we had with the local printer, which we've been pushing for weeks now to get them to deliver. Fortunately, last wednesday, they did so for the last remaining adventure, and now all of the rewards are in the warehouse! Yay!
At the moment, the GQ team are going back and forth with me to make sure everything is set for fulfillment, and packing up rewards accordingly. A couple of you might have received emails to add a few details reg. shipping, and we appreciated the quick response! We are set to ship out rewards on the , and to give you an idea of the timeframes, (some less, depending on the size of the package and thus the carrier we'll be using).

Hi Vagabonds!
I wanted to drop a line here because we were expecting to have shipped by now, and the past two weeks have been a sort of logistical hell on our end with Solopress (the company that is printing the maps and adventures for Nibiru).
The idea is that this company was going to get everything printed for Dragonmeet, and they only fulfilled half of that. They tend to be quite quick, but from the get go they started to delay shipment of the product until yesterday. So far, they've sent through the maps and one of the three adventures (with the last two supposedly arriving tomorrow).

Hiyo Vagabonds!
Dragonmeet is now past us, and we're pretty happy with the results :) so I wanted to weigh in on how everything went, and what are the plans for the future.
Not gonna lie; last week was pretty trash, since the printing service we tend to rely on locally to turn around stuff fast delayed our order in several instances. Although they managed to get the maps to us in time for the convention, the adventures didn't make it (and will be delivered to us on Monday). Even with that, we managed to fulfill about twenty something orders for backers during the con, as well as selling a lot of stuff, chatting about the game, generating interest, etc.

campaign.story:
Designed by Rory (11), Ben (8) and Dad Jon (45), The Forest Dragon Bang & Twang is the latest installment in the Forest Dragon Story. We hope you’ll come along for the ride!
The Forest Dragon Bang & Twang is a fast and fun game of keeping up with an ever-changing piece of music, played by a variety of characters on a variety of characterful instruments from the world of The Forest Dragon.
The musicians gather at crossroads and campfires across the forest. They produce their instruments, tune up and begin to play! They play tunes both weird and wonderful, with many a twang and bang from their array of amazing musical implements. As the tunes get faster and more complicated, the musicians wrestle to keep up and challenge each others’ musical ability.
With amazing art from Rory, Ben, and with just a little help from their dad, games-industry veteran Jon Hodgson, The Forest Dragon Bang & Twang is a fast and exciting game for the whole family!
The Forest Dragon centres around 3 special cards. On one side they have “Bang” and on the other, they have “Twang”.
There’s also a deck of 24 other cards, from which players draw a hand of 2 cards. Players must try to match the sequence shown on those special “riff” cards with the cards in their hand. They can flip one of the riff cards, or they can move one of them. If they can match a riff they "bank" that card. Or they can play a special card that has special effects. 
A round of play takes around ten minutes, and play moves around the table nice and fast!

We’ve made the game so there’s almost always something to do on your turn, so no one gets left out. And for younger players, you can just play along and have an enjoyable time. For older players though, there’s a lot more strategy - remembering who has “banked” what card, and deciding which of the possible moves is the best one on your turn adds a lot more depth.
There are 8 special cards in the Bang & Twang deck, and these cards form “the tune”. If you want to change the tune for the next game, you can take out those 8 special cards, and replace them with a different set! This makes gameplay really varied!
Bang & Twang features 6 sets of special cards - 6 “tunes”, and totals 67 cards in the box!
You can download a print and play version of Bang & Twang right now! It doesn’t have art - we’ve kept it very simple for home printing, but you can try out the first “tune”, absolutely free! Download it here: https://www.dropbox.com/
In 2016 we Kickstarted our first game together. The Forest Dragon by Rory Age 9 proved to be a huge success. We raised way more support than we expected, and doubled the size of the game through the campaign! It was an amazing ride!
The Forest Dragon was created by Rory when he was 7. He’d been thinking about games, and described the whole thing in pretty much one breath. We wrote it down and slowly over a couple of years turned it into a playable game. And with your help on Kickstarter we made it into a reality. You can buy our first game in selected stores and on line.
Clearly, this isn't really just about making another game. I want my kids, Rory and Ben to continue to learn about hard work, games design, probability, art, layout, writing rules, product design, costings and all kinds of things that are good to learn about. 
Making a game with them has been a way to show them a creative path, and how the whole world around them is someone's idea put into practice. With this second game, we’re learning about sticking with something, persistence, and all the trials and pitfalls of making that second game. Can we do it? We think so!
I really want to show the boys the reality of how games get made, and all the different processes involved. With Bang & Twang, we’re learning about what it means to make an “intellectual property” and how we approach a line of games, rather than just one game. 
Our first game was made with print on demand technology that let us order one game for each person that backed us. This time we’d like to try to go one further and make a full print run of the game, and get it deeper into more shops around the world! If we fund, it means we’ll make the game through print on demand once again. And we’ll be very happy with that. But if we can reach some of our stretch goals, we’ll be able to make a more fancy box, and do a whole print run, which will be a big learn for the boys! (Dad has made many such boxed games in his day job, so you’re in safe hands!)
To help build towards our goal we had some great Add-Ons. These are extra things you can pledge for. If you decide you’d like an Add-On, then up your pledge by the appropriate amount. You can pledge for them before they are unlocked if you wish - that will help them get unlocked.

If we do manage to unlock some of these Add-Ons we’ll make some new pledge levels that include them too, for your convenience.

Made by the coin experts at Campaign Coins these are really amazing. They come in a set of three, and are perfect to replace the riff cards in the Bang & Twang box for the fanciest game imaginable!

One of our playtesters who is old enough to know better suggested the whole game could be re-skinned as “Burp & Fart”. This will feature the adorable “Greedy Boys” characters sat in a ditch, holding a burping and farting contest. If we unlock this stretch goal we’ll make a whole new base game available as an Add-On. It will have the same rules, but all new, deeply ill-mannered card art. 
WARNING: Will contain pictures of burps and farts drawn by giddy children.
Many of our fans are friends and family who don't know much about Kickstarter. Thanks for making it this far! We love you!
Kickstarter is a website that allows project creators with an idea to pitch that idea to the audience of the Internet. There's usually a product at the heart of a Kickstarter campaign. In this case, it's the Bang & Twang game. 
If people like the idea they can pledge money to the project. If enough money is pledged in order to meet the campaign's funding goal by the end, the money is collected from your card by Kickstarter, they take a cut, and the rest is passed on to the creator. And the project is made a reality. If we don’t raise enough pledges no one gets charged. And we go away to think very hard about what we did wrong. 
To encourage and thank supporters, or "backers" as they are known, we are offering a range of Rewards and Add-Ons. These start out at the game itself, and you can get more stuff like artwork, your own expansions and more!
Another encouragement to spread the word and convince others to join in, are Stretch Goals. These are milestones which unlock extra rewards. Sometimes they allow backers to buy something new, by upping their pledge. Other times they add something to existing rewards for free. 

Throughout the period of the campaign, you can amend your pledge up and down as you see fit. Only once the campaign ends is the amount you pay locked in. So it pays to keep an eye on progress, and pledge for everything you'd like!
If you have any questions at all, please drop me (Jon) a line via PM, email, text or whatever method suits you best, and I’ll do my best to explain how to back us! Don’t be shy, we understand that Kickstarter can be daunting if you’ve never used it.
To pledge to our campaign you need to hit the Pledge button. You'll sign up to an account, decide how much you'd like to pledge, select what kind of reward you'd like - you can choose to just give to the campaign out of kindness, or you can select what you'd like to receive for your support. We'd love you to have a copy of the game.
You can throw in whatever you like above the basic pledge levels - there aren't fixed amounts you have to give.
You'll provide some payment details and, if enough people chose to support us, at the end of the campaign your card will be charged. The project creators get in touch a short time after that to collect any additional information they might need.
Following a Kickstarter campaign is a lot of fun. A community of supporters is created, who can all share their excitement and support in the comments section, as well as ask questions or make requests of the project. You'll also receive updates throughout the campaign either here or by email.
For our second campaign we’re playing it very safe - the whole of the base game is done. 5 additional Expansions are completely made. With children helping to make the core reward we needed to know they'd be able to finish the project. And they have. We just need money for printing and shipping it to you. We are not spending any time after the campaign on further development, testing or art for the core game. It’s done. This does mean we won’t go much beyond 5 additional expansions, but we feel that’s the best and most honest way to do things. We have not yet completed work on the art and graphics for “Burp & Fart” but should we be lucky enough to unlock that stretch goal we’ll get it done as soon as possible! It won’t take long.
Stretch goals are each unlocked as we reach their milestone in our funding level. If we’re lucky we’ll reveal more as the campaign progresses!
£1500 This is our basic goal. At this level, we’ll make a print on demand version of the game in a nice tuck box and send it to you with our thanks. 
We’ll reveal more stretch goals if we do well!
Praise for the Forest Dragon by Rory Age 9
Don’t just take our word for it, here are some thoughts about our first game, The Forest Dragon by Rory Age 9:

I knew I was onto a winner when they were picking up the cards and having games without me :) ” - Newt Newport, game designer

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We’ve successfully made our first game and delivered it to people all around the world. 

We're keeping things very simple. We have our game completely planned, made and costed. Everything is already completed at a digital level, except the Burp & Fart reskin. Everything will be ready to start printing at the end of the campaign. 

Like every kickstarter creator, we’re a bit worried about shipping - the price of moving stuff around the world can change a LOT in a short time. We hope we've done our sums right.

Where we print the game will depend on how well we do. If we fund at a lower level it will be printed in the UK. If we manage to unlock the fancier version it will be printed in Europe, and dispatched worldwide from the UK.

We want to deliver in a timely fashion, using processes we understand, even if that means a lower final figure. We’re ok with this. We will not be adding any new stretch goals beyond those in our plan.

campaign.story:
Z War One - Exodus is a standalone game for 1-5 players that combines intense tactical combat, resource management and an engaging comic book narrative.  
The Kickstarter edition of the game comes jam packed with four different game modes, including 2 separate comic book campaigns & two difficulty settings. Ultra high quality components, plastic coated cards & finely detailed miniatures make this the ultimate survival horror experience!
                                                                                                                                           The Exodus comic book campaign, which can be played either solo, or 2 player co-operative (for 4 player co-op details see "Kickstarter" section), sees players taking on the roles of two war veterans, stranded on an island ravaged by a rapidly mutating super virus. Their perilous journey will take them from infested towns and harbors, to the claustrophobic corridors of an abandoned cargo ship and even out onto the open water, where untold horrors lurk.  
The comic weaves a narrative around the missions in the manner of a video game cutscene
Comic book "cut scenes" link the increasingly challenging missions as the heroes work to complete objectives across a variety of hostile locations. Resources roll over from one mission to the next, so they will need to scour the environment for ammunition & craftable items to build & replenish their inventory.
The more time that is taken over your shots, the greater your accuracy. When ammunition is limited every bullet counts!
The "pregame lobby" feature allows players to level up their heroes between missions, choosing from a wide array of available "perks". They may also freely craft items, reload weapons and assign equipment. At this point, players also have the option to "save" the game, but choose your save point wisely, as there are just 3 available save tickets for the 7 chapter campaign.
Hop aboard a rib and head out into the open water for a terrifying tussle with the aquatic Reavers!
 The above tutorial video shows the basics of Exodus game play, for more detail you can download the work in progress version of the Exodus Rule Book here: Part 1 & Part 2
The 2-5 player Director Mode is a game variation which allows an extra player to take on the roll of "the director". Through the use of director cards, this player can stack the odds against the heroes, manipulating spawning, pacing & enemy behavior to suit their own evil design. A director can even be added to the campaign, but only if you're feeling brave!
The Kickstarter edition of Exodus comes complete with the intense & emotionally charged "Dark Tide" expansion. Experience the terror of the initial outbreak from the perspective of two desperate parents, fighting to get their daughter to safety.  
This ferociously tough prequel campaign introduces new characters, locations & monsters to the Exodus roster!
Dark Tide also includes the 2-4 player "Renegade Mode". Work individually or as a team to collect as many loot cards as possible, use director cards to hinder your opponent's progress. If you are taken down, continue your fight from beyond the grave, using your freshly infected hero to tear apart the opposition!
Utilising elements from the base game, expansion & all unlocked stretch goals, the "The Kickstarter Cut" is an expanded & extended version of the Exodus campaign. 
This game mode is balanced for playing with either 2 or 4 heroes & is exclusive to this Kickstarter!
The miniatures are created using 3D sculpting techniques. They are then 3D printed and cast in polyurethane resin (near identical to Forgeworld and Warlord resin) or metal. We will confirm your material choice through the pledge manager. 
To add an "add on" to your pledge simply increase your pledge by the stated amount, your selections will be confirmed in the pledge manager.
Z War One - Damnation was the first Z War Game we made, you do not need it, or any of it's components to play Z War One - Exodus. You can find out more about Damnation on BGG here and on the previous campaign page.
 For More information about Damnation issue 3 visit the website here.
The game is currently available in English. Later in the campaign if there is enough interest  from our foreign backers we will add a stretch goal for translated versions of the rule book & cards for some or all of the following languages: French, German, Spanish & Italian.  
Shipping will be charged after the campaign finishes and will be subsidised for all areas. Approximate rates are as follows:
UK (£5 - £7) 
EU / USA / Canada (£10 - £12)
Rest of the world  (£20 - £25) 
We will begin shipping pledges as soon as our copies arrive and we expect to have dispatched all pledges within a month of them arriving. Obviously our time scales are subject to change but we believe we have padded our estimates enough to account for this. Our products will ship from within the EU so as it stands there will be no import taxes etc for our EU, USA, Australian & Canadian backers. 
For more information on all things Z War & Dice Sorts  visit our website or our facebook page

updates.update_content:
Hey guys,

So after many conversations with UK officials, major exporters,  & various industry people we finally have some clarity on the EU shipping situation. As I feared we do indeed have to pay the tax on the goods twice if we want to send them to backers duty paid. The HMRC say that VAT should not be charged again on transactions which took place prior to brexit so they will not refund any of these transactions, the various exporters / shipping companies & other people I have spoken to have said that in practice VAT is being charged on everything at the boarder (even things that are below the 20 euro threshold).

Hi guys, 

First up the good news. All USA pledges have now either shipped by UPS or are currently crossing the ocean to the distribution hub, the last of these will land with backers in around 4/5 weeks at current estimate.

Over the last couple of months I have been speaking to various officials about the unusual situation that we find ourselves in regarding the change in VAT laws. Our campaign was tagged as being "EU friendly" meaning that the VAT and duty was covered by us & not chargeable to the backers on delivery. At that time we were part of the EU and under the legislation of the time the VAT was paid to the HMRC at the point of supply (the VAT quarter that we took payment from the backers).  I spoke to the governments official brexit advisor on two occasions & also spoke to my accountant who had sat in on a seminar with a another Brexit advisor and the conclusion was that backers should not be charged any additional fees in this circumstance. That should be the solution to the problem, however it appears, after speaking with various courier & fulfillment companies that this may not be the case & we are going to be in the bizarre situation of the same goods possibly being taxed twice. I say "possibly" because I have heard reports from various sources of not VAT being charged on items below £130 and then other cases of 20% vat being charged + additional massive handling fees imposed by various countries cowboy couriers. In short, it's a huge mess.

Hi folks, quick update to let you know where we are at. Non U.K. is shipped, priority US is shipped, none priority US is being collected on a pallet Tuesday to be shipped to our hub in the US by sea then finally fulfilled by Last Mile Game Logistics within the USA, the total transit time for these orders should be 5/6 weeks. Please note that the will be no tracking information available until the games have reached the USA. There are around 50 US pledges packaged up for sending UPS next week as UPS charges are based on volumetric rather than actual weight so for the really heavy pledges UPS still works out cheaper for us.

Hey Guys,  

I have had a few queries about the packaging and contents of pledges from backers receiving their stuff so i thought it would be easiest to address it in an update for all to see.

Packaging

Hey guys,

As covid-19 continues to wreck havoc on our fulfillment plans we are having to look to alternative shipping solutions.  In the last 12 months shipping rates have increased by a whopping 140% with a standard pledge delivery going from £12 to £28+. (as bad as that sounds I have a friend who's import from China just jumped from £1500 to £7000!) as we are in the midst of what the BBC is calling a "global shipping crisis". With this in mind,  at the suggestion of some backers  we are offering a priority shipping option with UPS to fulfill some of the US orders quicker for those that wish it.

Hey Guys, 

Just a quick one to let you know where we are at. 

Basically, we are 2/3 weeks behind where I was hoping we would be at this point thanks to a 4 hit combo of unfortunate events. January we only actually managed to work for 2 week as we had to close for several days and isolate after family of staff contracted Covid 19. We came back to work for 2 days only then to be hit with a 2 day power cut, 1 day back in work then closed for heavy snow, I managed to get back in for a solid week before my partner was rushed into hospital for emergency surgery which left me at home with the Kids.  So far 2021 is really giving 2020 a run for it's money.

Hey Guys, 

After the problems at the end of the year with EU road freight we have had to shuffle around the fulfillment order. Currently road freight is still not available through our courier for EU we expect this to be resolved really soon, in the meantime we have a building piled high with stock which we need to clear ASAP as such we will be fulfilling UK orders first.

Hey guys, 
This morning I have awoken to the news that freight into Europe has been banned & options to ship into the EU  have been removed from our carriers web site.

Howdy folks, 
Lots of stuff to cover in this update. Originally planned to do it at the weekend and get a few more pictures in but my little girl broke her collar bone throwing my plans into disarray.
First things first, last week our fulfillment company took delivery of the card stock from Wingo!

Hey guys, 

Super quick update to say that we received notification for the Wingo card stock to be landing in the UK November 5th, it generally takes around a week to clear customs and arrive at our fulfillment centre. Word Forge have now completed casting & the last 10 or so boxes of minis will be getting to us next week so lots of clipping cleaning & packing still to do. I was hoping to do a bigger update with some photos of minis packing etc but I haven't had time. I'll do a better update with final minis set pics etc next week as all the blue hero resin looks pretty awesome (I actually prefer the breakwater SG versions  of the heroes to the originals.

campaign.story:
PLAY

Four resin ships!
This Kick-Starter project is to help me to take this from a heavily play-tested prototype to a fully manufactured game. I have already used my own money to make the prototype and it has been play-tested over the last 9 months by seasoned table-top gamers and children 6-10. At the UK Games Expo 2018 the game was heavily demoed with a huge range of ages from 5 - 55 and throughout the weekend the feedback remained extremely positive. This experience is what has led to me believing in Hyperleague Racing as a product that can be enjoyed by the whole family.

How to try the game for free!
On the website is a free 'print and play' version of the rules and all the current All-Star cards for you to mess about with! I recorded some 'how to play' videos with Luke and Rich from the Glory Goals YouTube channel and you can find them here on YouTube. 

Interviews and reviews
The amazing Nerdling Mum did a great interview about all things Hyperleague Racing on her Blog page. Check it out here!

Rory from Stepping through Games also interviewed me and we spoke about the game but also about Mad-Dad Games and why I choose that name. Read it here!  

Tris from The Hairy gamers gave the 'Print and Play' version a go with his 8 year old daughter! You can read about his experience over on their Facebook page!

At the UK Games Expo 2018, Beasts of War did a short interview with me. You can watch it here! 

I mentioned the awesome Luke and Rich from The Glory Goals YouTube channel earlier. While we were playtesting the game, we recorded a play through with a chat afterwards. You can find that on their YouTube channel here. 
Beyond Kickstarter 

Once Hyperleague Racing has finished, I will work my socks off alongside the manufacturers and artists to get the game made! Good news is that the conversations I have had with these partners have been extremely positive to date, so I expect no issues going forward! When they are complete, I will open a Pledge Manager to allow you to confirm your shipping address and postage. I also promise to update you on our progress on a weekly basis at least!
Hyperleague Racing has already got two expansions scripted and more beyond. The Sector 98 setting has a storytelling game within it that my daughters and I made up over a year ago and there is more. But all that depends on whether this is successful first. 

Shipping Information!
I have looked in to this and shipping will be charged after the Kickstarter concludes based on the actual costs incurred to ship. We will collect this via our pledge manager after the campaign ends. This is so we can be fair to all our backers (shipping is rarely one size fits all). As a rough estimate, the game will cost about £5-10 to send within the U.K. and roughly £10-15 to ship within Europe and approx £20-25 elsewhere (for a 2kg parcel), but that is a rough estimate, and this may well change by the time we get to shipping due to socio-political changes in the U.K. and abroad. The only assurance I can give is that you will pay the exact postage it costs me to send your game to you.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This game has a few key challenges ahead of it but I'm fortunate to be surrounded by several experts in the gaming industry who are doing a marvellous job of keeping my anxiety at bay :)

Challenge 1: Manufacture 
The prototypes and ships are being made by Dicesports and WordForge Games respectively. I have a great amount of respect for both Rob and Mark and they have successfully Kick-Started several projects between them. I have already discussed quantities, shipping, distribution and am confident that unless a major disaster befalls the project, the game will be able to be manufactured and distributed on time. 

Challenge 2: This goes bigger than I anticipated! 
If the volume exceeds 2000 units, then it may be a case that the date for dispatch will be put back as the manufacture may have to leave the UK for distant shores. I have already approached several overseas companies with good track records of producing quality products. If this is the case, then we will keep everyone informed with regular updates through Kick-Starter and through social media. 

Challenge 3: It's my first project. (But not my first rodeo...)
I have less experience in table-top games design specifically but I do have over 20 experience in writing and running live role-play systems. 

Most notably, Shadow Wars; which won Best Medium Sized LARP at the UK Live Roleplay Awards in 2016 and ran for 10 years.

campaign.story:
Dragon Dice is a collectable dice game for 2 or more players. Originally made famous in 1995 by TSR, Dragon Dice has continued to expand and evolve under the reign of SFR inc. and currently offers a large range of truly exceptional dice to be used with its innovative tactical game system. 
The Swamp Stalkers are one of Dragon Dice's most loved races. Out of print since 2007, the player community chanted for their return and the gods of Esfah have answered. Pledge your service to the swampland gods and see the Swamp Stalkers rise once more!
The mutated Swamp Stalkers or ancient Treefolk - who will you command?
Dragon Dice has a huge range of available dice, each offering different rules and tactics, allowing you to compose your perfect army. Due to the large number of options, new players should always start with our 'Starter Rules', which give players an insight to the core mechanics of the game focused on the 2-player experience.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We have been developing the project for 3 years and the game rules and component design have been through many versions but are now complete except for some final approvals on components, the rules and counter sheet layout. The core game is locked and will not change regardless of stretch goals. The rules themselves are ready to go in to layout in late June. In order to reduce any risks of delays we've taken a number of steps as follows: 

1) We have started the tooling process to speed up the 'pre-production' part of the development for the base game and the Masters pledge. This is the expensive production of the metal moulds to cast the plastic miniatures and is usually where you can get delays. We're committed to making Kung Fu Panda the Boardgame so getting this part of the process underway saves us a lot of time later on. 

2) We are keeping the Stretch Goals simple and manageable, either with content that is already designed (but would cost to add to the game) or that is easy to develop (though still adds cost to production). 

3) There are no add ons to make the project fulfilment complex and this also helps reduce shipping costs as we'll only be packaging one of two different boxes.

Of course games are made by people though, and we've experienced our fair share of life intervening in well laid plans. If this happens we'll let you know and what our plan is to resolve any issues. 

Factory production can encounter delays - as mentioned above the tooling can sometimes require changes based on the quality of samples (which is why we're starting now), errors in print files or formats and other issues can add up. With our experience we try hard to avoid these problems but it can still happen.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Air Flix is a fast paced, Second World War, dexterity based dog fighting game for 2 or more players. In an all-action battle of strategy & skill, you will need to outwit and out-flick your opponents to achieve total aerial dominance!
Slick, intuitive game play, multiple game modes & variants combined with components of the highest possible standard, make this the perfect action dog fighting game for both hardened wargamers & casual players alike. 
The Kickstarter collectors edition of Air Flix comes bristling with ultra high quality components, including a massive 3'x3' neoprene play mat, laser etched acrylic discs, highly detailed plane miniatures, thick, plastic coated card stock and custom combat dice.
Exclusive free content!
Dice Sports take to the Skies with Air Flix!
                                                                                                Supremacy Mode - Duke it out at 30,000 feet in classic "fighter versus fighter" dogfight action. The rules are simple, just shoot down the opposition! The last team standing wins the game.
Players take it in turns to move their planes around the mat by flicking, ensuring that they only touch the rear of the base within the plane's contact arc. Planes may be rotated within their turning arc, either before the flick, for greater maneuverability, or after, for greater accuracy. 
Planes may not finish their move touching any of the hexes they are in contact with prior to being flicked, ensuring a minimum movement distance. Players may also ask their opponent to "lift" a plane so that they may fly under them.
Tally ho!
Once all planes have been moved, shooting is resolved simultaneously. Every plane that has a target within it's firing arc is eligible to shoot. Roll the number of attack dice shown on the pilot card, adding any additional bonus dice gained for short range or rear attacks, with any hit results being subtracted from the target plane's damage points.
The squadron board shows which planes have been moved, any damage sustained, penalties incurred & also the time remaining before reinforcements can be deployed.
After all shooting has been resolved, any planes with no damage points remaining are removed from play. If at any point only one player has planes on the map they win the game!
Diagram showing the various arcs on a plane's laser etched acrylic base
Blitz Mode -  An asymmetric mode in which one team is trying to bomb key targets on the map, while the other team is doing everything they can to stop them. This mode is played using both fighters and bombers, with only the bombers able to hit the targets.
Bombs away!
To hit a bomb site, a Heinkel bomber must be flicked so that its base is at least partially covering one of the bomb site symbols on the map. The Axis forces win the game by hitting a predetermined number of bomb sites, if the bombers are shot down before achieving this, the allies win the day!
Relive the epic tank battle at El Alamein with Annihilation Mode. Both sides use a combination of fighters and bombers to obliterate the opposing player's tanks! 
Work in progress El Alamein Map
The El Alamein battle pack contains:
The El Alamein 3’ x 3’ battle mat, 
3 Hawker Hurricanes 
3 Junkers Ju 87 (Stukas) 
6 pilot cards 
Bombing map & scenario rules for Annihilation Mode.
Be part of one of the pivotal moments of modern military history with Evacuation Mode. Allied forces are desperately trying to get home, with Spitfire squadrons providing cover overhead but quickly running out of fuel, how many lives can they save?  
The Dunkirk battle pack contains:  
The Dunkirk 3’ x 3’ battle mat 
1 battle damaged Heinkel he 111 
1 fuel tracker board 
Bombing map & scenario rules for Evacuation Mode.
Increase your pledge by the required amount for add ons, we will confirm your choices in the pledge manager
Ace Pilots are optional pilot cards that put wartime aces at the controls of your fighters. Aces each have a deadly special ability bringing a multitude of new tactical options to your table top dogfights.
Hunter Mode is a supremacy variant in which each side it vying to shoot down the opposing teams ace. Do you play it safe and protect your ace, or throw them into the action to make the most of their skills?
Barrage Mode is a blitz variant in which the defending player may strategically place 2 large barrage balloons to protect their bomb sites.
Air Flix will be available in 4 different languages: English, French, Spanish and German. We will confirm your choice via the Pledge Manager.
Shipping will be charged after the campaign finishes and will be subsidised for all areas. For UK backers shipping will be charged at £5, EU and USA backers will be charged at £10 and the rest of the world will be £20 (sorry guys).
We will begin shipping pledges as soon as our copies arrive and we expect to have dispatched all pledges within a month of them arriving. Obviously our time scales are subject to change but we believe we have padded our estimates enough to account for this.
Our products will ship from within the EU so as it stands there will be no import taxes etc for our EU backers. Any and all updates on shipping and production will be posted here as a Project Update for everyone to see.

updates.update_content:
Hey guys, just a quick one as we are very busy packing & shipping. 

All EU shipments will be sent duty paid (including in colour sets) before the end of the month.
Regular US & ROW (battle of britain & Total war) are currently being shipped & should also be out by the end of the month.

Hi guys, 

Just a quick update to let you know where we are. As we stand all UK total war & Battle of Britain pledges have shipped. All US pledges that paid for priority have shipped. In the meantime we are picking and packing all other orders (EU, US & ROW) I estimate that this will take us around 2 weeks to complete. There will be an expedited option for ROW which i will post about next once we have more pledges packed.

Glyn (our painter) is currently beavering away on the painted sets and these are going to start shipping to UK backers this week as we receive them from him.

Hey guys, just a quick note to say that UK battle of Britain & total war pledges are 95% shipped. The remaining UK total war pledges will be shipping tomorrow. US priority option has been taken up by quite a lot of backers  so it's probably going to take tuesday / wednesday to get all of those out. I'll update again on shipping before the end of the week.

Below (finally) is the flicking technique video (filmed on a small dogfighter mat). The things i'm showing here are nice to practice general maneuvering, unfortunately once the actual battlefield starts swirling it's rare you get setups as easy as these!

Hey guys,

Just a quick note to say that shipping has now officially started, UK orders started going out today & I will be working through all of the UK total war and BOB pledges over the next week or so. I'm speaking to our painter later this week as we now have space (and he is now allowed) to come in and paint so we should be able to get these moving within a week or 2 of the unpainted sets going out.

Hey Guys, 
As many of you already know the french boarder closure at the end of last year left us with an absolute logistical nightmare that took us 2 weeks to sort out. We only actually managed to get 2 weeks in work throughout January as we had to close for several days and isolate after family of staff contracted covid. We came back to work for 2 days only then to be hit with a 2 day power cut, 1 day back in work then closed for heavy snow, I managed to get back in for a week before my partner was rushed into hospital for emergency surgery which left me at home with the Kids. I should be back in action next week and finally in a position to start picking and packing Air Flix.

Status Report 
Hey guys, I managed to take some pictures over the weekend but had to do the update from my work PC this morning so apologies for the delay.

We ran into more problems with staff testing positive for covid, being closed down for 2 weeks, returning to work for 2 days 7 then 2 production staff being pinged with the track and trace & having to isolate for another 2 weeks. On top of that, the company that were holding our mats in the UK were also closed down meaning we only managed to get them over and into out warehouse week before last. It's been an absolute nightmare, every single thing we have on to do is now several weeks behind & the brexit clock is ticking.

Hey guys,
To fill you all in on exactly what has been happening. I was supposed to take over a print company back in March, it was already a going concern & was already doing most of the Dice Sports manufacturing work (prototyping etc).  My intention was to bring in extra staff to deal with all things games related. What actually happened is that by far the biggest customer of the company I'm taking over went into administration immediately at the beginning of lockdown (& the rest of the work dropped off to virtually zero). Manufacturing jobs that were underway stopped entirely as trade suppliers & services ceased to operate. Staff have been (and still are) furloughed with it still unclear as to weather there will still be jobs to come back to at the end of furlough next month.  What should have been a very smooth transition solving all of our problems has turned into a fight for our very survival.

Hey Guys, just a quick one today to let you know where we are at.
Base cleaning & testing is currently sitting at 4500/6000 I managed a good run on them last month but tore off my thumb nail in the process which then set me back a bit. I'm currently in the process of taking over a family print business & while staff there are currently clearing up their pre-virus backlog it is my intention to get some extra bodies onto this project in around 2 weeks time which should dramatically speed up the final stage.

Production Update 
Many apologies for not making the weekend update, working hours are all over the place at the moment as my partner has taken shift work at a cake factory. Her actual business (baby photography) is completely dead in the water so we are alternating child care at obscure times.

Hey guys, I hope all of you are well & staying safe during these testing times. 
As of this time our offices, warehouse & fulfillment company are all closed down due to the Coronavirus. I have been steadily working my way through the plane bases, testing and cleaning etc. but I cannot stress enough quite how time consuming the  process is. Each base has to have it's backing peeled, surface & edges cleaned, and in most cases tidying up done to get the desired action on the mat. This process takes 1-2 minutes per base and there are 6000 of them. Up to this point i have been using my free time (mostly mornings) to work through them, however current lockdown circumstances mean that I do have now much more time at home to do this. As such, instead of returning defective bases to Poland for them to be fixed and sent back here for me to then test again I have asked to supplier to send me all of the remaining based that they have for me to do here. Once this last batch arrives from Poland we have all of the components, it's just a case of the time it will take to finish off everything at this end.

campaign.story:
Shipping added when you pledge, starting from £8!
 Want more Wreck and Ruin in your life, or want to split postage with a friend? Available to Warrior pledges and above, simply adjust your pledge by the amount listed. Save money on shipping!
Available to miniatures pledge and above, add more minis to your pledge for the price listed. Make your Wreck and Ruin games bigger, or use them in any other game you'd like!
Dominate the Wastes by commanding one of 4 factions, using a range of post-apocalyptic vehicles and unique abilities to outmaneuver and outgun your opponents. Tactically use your limited actions to grab your own objectives whilst simultaneously preventing other players from scoring - shoot, ram, and wreck your way to victory! 
A seamless blend of boardgame, skirmish and wargame, this is a fast and frantic multiplayer combat game with elements of objective grabbing and resource management: this is not a game of territorial dispute - this is all out war! 
Use the unique flame peg damage system to record damage with no need for tableaus - when you cause damage you set it on fire! Know your enemy's situation at all times, and look good whilst doing it. 
Look at all that battle damage!
20 vehicle miniatures in 4 faction colours - 5 for each. UNLOCKED: Factions have their own unique models! 
70 flame pegs - track damage and look cool doing it!  
7 double-sided map tiles - create your own wasteland. UNLOCKED: 3 additional map tiles for more options!
16 faction cards - powerful one-off abilities unique to your faction that can change the tide of battle. 
56 salvage cards - one-off buffs and attacks that can be used to strengthen your vehicles, or mess with your opponents. 
16 event cards - the rules of the wasteland change each round! UNLOCKED: 8 additional events to keep you on your toes!
Player guides, quick setup rules, tokens, dice - it's game time!
Ready to play at Airecon 2018
Want your game to look even better? Have pro painter Michael Mordor paint your miniatures wasteland ready and grab one of the limited painted pledges before they're gone!
The painted pledge - awesome, right?
Sounds pretty cool, right? But don't just take my word for it - this game has been played at UKGE, Dragonmeet and Airecon by hundreds of gamers, each one with a smile on their face. That not good enough? The game has been to many reviewers in the UK and the States, and here's what they had to say:
The earth as we know it has long been destroyed, replaced with a barren wasteland. Our once great cities, our achievements, all gone: buried beneath the sands of time. Yet life still exists in this bleak future: a number of factions roam the wasteland in search of salvage - technology from the byegone age - to continue their existence: driving relics from a time long past, they use vehicles to survive the harsh and inhospitable Wastes, and are suitably armed, and armoured, for the task. The sands are ever-shifting, revealing ruins ripe with tech ready for the taking. And take it you will - if you can get to it first. Only the strongest will survive...
There are no doubt countless tribes, gangs and settlements spread out across the wasteland, but these are the 4 main factions that the players control:
The Salvoes, short for Salvagers, are people who eke out an existence from the barren wasteland. A tough existence has taught them how to survive the harshest conditions and outlast their enemies. Their abilities help them to stay in the fight longer and gather more resources to outplay their enemies. 
Reapers live only to sow death and destruction. They are violent and aggressive, and follow only the most powerful warriors. Their vehicles are adorned with the trophies of the their previous kills, a testament to their fighting prowess. Their abilities favour aggressive players, from hijacking vehicles to striking fear into the enemy ranks.
Ruin is the only city that is known to exist - the Ruin Army is tasked with protecting its inhabitants from threats and collecting valuable supplies to keep its people fed and its technology working. Ruin was built around an old military installation so they have access to the most advanced technology to perform their duties. Their abilities use tactical training and experimental tech they can call upon to aid their cause. 
Choosing to lead a simpler existence following mankind's fall from grace, the Desertkin thrive in the wasteland. They have formed a symbiotic bond with some of its inhabitants, hulking creatures which have evolved to survive their habitat. Their abilities allow them to use the wasteland and its creatures against the enemy.
Select a faction which suits your playstyle or choose one at random - your game, your rules!
Michael's Reapers, ready to join the fray
The real stars of the show, these highly detailed miniatures allow you to ride across the wasteland in style. These miniatures are designed to fit within the 30mm hexes, from the small scouts up to the hulking big rig at over 60mm long! Although there are many different vehicles out in the Wastes, they broadly fall into 4 size categories:
Each vehicle has its own set of stats as well as a unique ability - using the right vehicle for the job will improve your chances of success! Miniatures have pegholes in them to represent damage and are supplied unpainted in their faction colours, unless you go for the painted pledge!
The objective of Wreck and Ruin is to raid more salvage sites than your opponents by the end of the game: this is a game of resource management, tactical planning and dice chucking as players battle to collect their own salvage tokens whilst stopping their opponents from doing the same. How do you do that? I'm glad you asked!
A player will spend their action points to move, shoot, and ram with their vehicles.
Any salvage tokens that a vehicle moves on top of are classed as occupied: at the end of the turn they will be flipped from their red side to green, showing they are ready to score!
The Desertkin buggy holding a site
In order to stop an occupied site from scoring, an opponent must inflict damage on the vehicle either by attacking it, or ramming it: ramming also has the advantage of being able to push smaller vehicles off occupied tokens and allow you to claim it at the same time! If an occupying vehicle takes damage the token is flipped back to red as it has been contested.
Once all actions have been taken, any tokens still green are removed as victory points and new tokens are placed on the map to replace them. All occupied tokens then flip to green again, ready for the next player to contest them!
The wrecker holds the site, but the scout has crashed!
Each turn will have players spending their limited actions to move to claim sites as well as attacking other players. Throw in salvage cards, faction powers, and global events and you're guaranteed a white-knuckle ride to the finish line.
Action points are the limited resource you have each turn to activate your vehicles. A vehicle's stats show how powerful those actions are:
The scout's stats: fast but weak!
Move: spend an action point to move that many hexes. Each turn of a hex face costs 1 of your movement allowance.
Attack: shoot an enemy within range. The stat shows how many dice you roll - the bigger the vehicle, the more dice it rolls! Every roll equal or above the target's armour stat is a hit, placing one flame peg on it.
Ram: The bigger the vehicle, the harder it hits! When ramming an equal sized or smaller vehicle, not only do you get to damage it, but you get to push it too! Use this to clear enemies off sites and get you onto them. Ramming uses the armour stat as well as the vehicle's size to determine the winner.
Need to know more? Read the rulebook here!
 Friendly shipping to the EU, US, Canada and Australia - no customs fees! Get your game for the price you pay on the campaign with no hidden surprises.
Kickstarter was set up to help creators like me bring something to life that wouldn't exist otherwise, and I believe in this whole heartedly. I have put as much money in myself as I can - all the artwork and sculpts are all paid for, I am also putting my own money in to keep the funding goal as low as possible, but it is only with your help that people like me can dare to dream big!

campaign.story:
Based on the MourneQuest Novel by Garry McElherron
An Adventure Game filled with Myth & Folklore from the heart of the Emerald Isle.
MourneQuest is a cooperative board game for 1 to 4 players. 
Average playing time 60-90 minutes.
Players assume the roles of the book's heroes and must journey in the Mourne Mountains to work together to defeat the evil Shimnavore before it is too late. On their quest they’ll encounter many enemies, including infuriating Bogbeans and terrifying Nightmares like the Banshee, the Changeling and the Dullahan. To triumph, heroes must gather charms, equipment and magical relics, to increase their powers and use their skills and combat abilities effectively. 
A little bit of fun inspired by comments from those who got to see MourneQuest in the flesh at the UK Games Expo. It's a work of art apparently!
                                    WELCOME BACK
Over the last 8 weeks, we have been working hard to bring MourneQuest back on to Kickstarter.  We want to thank everyone who supported us back in March and offer our appreciation for the feedback that we received during and after that campaign.
In this campaign, we have done our best to answer the points and suggestions that were raised.  This includes offering a lower entry-level option for backers, as well as including all the quality improvements that were originally planned as stretch goals as automatic upgrades in all games.  We have also found ways to reduce our production costs so we can now offer MourneQuest to everyone backing on Kickstarter at a new special price.   
In addition, MourneQuest author, Garry McElherron, has now agreed to offer a Free eCopy of his first novel 'MourneQuest. The Secret of the Silver Orb" to ALL BACKERS, who pledge for a copy of the game.
Follow our progress and help spread the word on kicktraq.com
                       Click above to view video
                                                           
             Download a low res version of the rule book here.
   
There are six hero characters to choose from.
Each brings something different to the game with various levels of Courage, Strength & Magic and a unique skill they can use during the quest. Heroes can also find some relics such as weapons, jewellery and perhaps a magical dandelion clock left behind by the Elderfolk, which they can use to improve their chances against their enemies.
PLAY

PLAY

PLAY

PLAY

PLAY

At the start of a game players chose a hero to play, and take the matching Character Card and miniature. During the quest, they must make sure to visit the Nexus Points to gather weapons and items to increase their starting abilities and make themselves into more formidable warriors. By the end of the quest, your team of heroes should be ready to take on the Shimnavore with all the skills and weapons they’ve accumulated! 
During MourneQuest many enemies will be out to hinder, hurt or destroy the heroes.
First it will be the pestering Bogbeans, who will more often attempt to steal than to kill; but as the heroes strive to free the terrifying Nightmares, tougher Bogbeans will be spawned and stand in their way. If the heroes cannot Cast-out the Nightmares before they are released into the Kingdom of Mourne, they will then be forced to fight them and suffer misery or even death, from their evil powers. On the Enemies’ Phase, enemies move and attack the nearest hero, more are spawned and occasionally relics are revealed. But do you risk collecting a relic when a Nightmare is close by?
There are three types of Bogbeans in MourneQuest.
The first, and smallest are the Snipes. They stand about one foot in height and have mottled brown skin with yellow stripes. The second type are Speedwells. They look a lot like a white mole, but despite having a well know taste for worms, they are far from harmless. Beware ….
Finally, there are the Worts! Worts are tough, three legged creatures that like to sneak up on you, do their devilment and leave you in a very bad way… Bogbeans are out to steal your loot, but if you fend them off, they will probably drop items that they were carrying, so you can grab it for yourself.
And then there are the Nightmares!
These powerful foes are at the behest of the Shimnavore and if not Cast-out from its grip, will break into the Kingdom of Mourne and hunt down the heroes. Irish mythology has foretold of these creatures, no-one believed it…but they are real, terrifying and wanting to destroy. Each Nightmare has an Evil Power which they get to use on the heroes during the Enemies Phase.
PLAY

PLAY

Nightmares attack with great power and must be beaten on each ability of Courage, Strength and Magic before being defeated. So, its best to gather the Charms required to cast them out before they come after you.
PLAY

The dreaded Shimnavore, trapped within the Silver Orb, bound by the Mighty Mourne Wall is stirring. It calls to all manner of evil nightmares to aid in its escape. The Elderfolk wizards are long gone, so it’s up to young Jack Turner and a few friends of the Hawksbeard Clan to stop them. But time is not on their side, evil magic is being used against them and their skills are untested against such formidable enemies.
Can they release the Nightmares, defeat the Shimnavore and save the Mourne Wall before it’s too late?
All combat in MourneQuest is resolved with a single dice roll. There are four levels of Combat dice. Players add the dice results, together any extras from equipment, to their chosen ability level for each fight, (either Courage, Strength or Magic). They must equal or better their opponent's ability level which can vary depending on the current phase of the Moon to win. 
Relics can give heroes additional power or abilities to increase their chances in battle.
 Prototype copy shown. Some components may vary. ** Miniatures supplied unpainted.
                                           We are dedicated to our retail partners worldwide therefore we are delighted to offer you a retail pledge for our new Kickstarter.  
Information about the MourneQuest retailer pledge options can be found here.
  MourneQuest will be manufactured in China, with one of Backspindle Games' long-term production partners, ensuring the highest quality of game components. The most complex components are the miniatures. Poducing quality miniatures is a long process, which will require us to approve samples and then check the final production quality. Estimated production start date is about 3-4 weeks after the campaign ends and the lead time for most components is 90 days. The custom dice, miniatures and all deluxe edition components may add up to 25 extra days, but we're confident that final delivery time will not be affected.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Backspindle Games has been publishing quality board games since 2011. We successfully funded Luchador! Mexican Wrestling Dice on Kickstarter in 2014 and delivered to backers early. Since then we have published Discworld Clacks in three languages, Codinca and Dance of the Fireflies.

We have been partnered with a number of leading hobby industry companies over the last seven years. Using these experiences, we are constantly improving our processes, decreasing any potential risks and have the knowledge, and the experience to face any possible challenges that arise.

To ensure we fulfill our obligations to you the backer, we (Backspindle Games) will be organizing production of the game. Every game project is subject to potential delays, but we will be controlling the production quality and manufacturing of this project directly and believe we've allowed enough wiggle-room to bring MourneQuest to you on time.

PLEDGE MANAGER & FULFILLMENT 
Our Pledge manager is likely to be a pledge manager company in the US and fulfillment will be through a leading distribution channel in the UK. All of our previous games have been delivered 'ahead of', or 'on schedule' and we aim to do the same with MourneQuest. This includes the EU-friendly shipping.

MISSING/DAMAGED ITEMS 
We are producing, packing and shipping large quantities of games, so there is always a chance of human error or damaging some game components. In any such case, please email our customer support on info@backspindlegames.com and we will try to resolve the matter swiftly, and to your satisfaction.

We are ready to meet this challenge for MourneQuest. Thank you very much for your support.
