updates.update_userinfo: Ding ding! It's the next round!
updates.update_content:
Good evening wasteland warriors one and all, it's the update you've been waiting for! I've been a bit quiet on the social media front, but I've been prepping for the relaunch and the date has been decided - 29th May is the day we start our engines and race off into the wasteland once more.
.

It has been a tough journey through the Wastes for all of us, but I know that you are strong warriors. I have seen you fight, and bleed, for your fellow brothers and sisters - will you follow me into battle once more? We will take no prisoners, we will give no quarter. I will lift my head up high as we cleave our way through any stand in our way, until only we remain. We will stand atop a mountain of burning cardboard, meeples, cards and dice littering the ground. No-one will stand in my way, for I am the wrath of the wasteland and i will not stop until Kickstarter is mine.

Man, doesn't time fly by when you're having fun? Only 1 week to go and I've been working hard trying to craft the best page possible - I'll share it with you soon, promise.
Some of you may have already noticed some more reviews come in on the facebook page recently - The Dice Odyssey took it on without really knowing anything about it and loved it - here's their video if you want to see for yourself.

updates.update_userinfo: Less than 4 weeks until we storm the Wastes!

updates.update_content:
Welcome warriors old and new, come join me around the camp fire and I will tell you a tale. A tale of one man's journey into the Wastes, and what he walked out with....
Well, we didn't fund- I wish it wasn't the case, but those who have been here for a while, especially the kickstarter pros, will have known for a while that this would likely be the case: the most important days that determine the chances of funding are the first few days, and whilst we had a decent start, it just wasn't enough momentum to carry us through. We maintained a steady stream of new backers throughout, and then ended on another high. This is what it looked like

updates.update_userinfo: The final battle - less than 12 hours left!
updates.update_content: The clock has started ticking now, we've already gained a few more warriors so let's keep it going that way! Any ideas on how to spread the word? I'm on twitter, Facebook and boardgame geek, so let's get talking and sharing. Think you can handle that? Course you can, you're awesome Wasteland warriors! Let's take the fight to everyone's doorstep and show them we're a force to be reckoned with

updates.update_userinfo: 48 hours till we drive off into the sunset
updates.update_content:
Welcome new warriors, 200 backers is a milestone worth celebrating! I'm so happy to see that new backers are still getting involved at this stage in the campaign. We're also coming up to the 48 hour mark which will hopefully pull in a few more backers that have starred the project- very exciting!
On another note, today is Halloween - and what better way to celebrate than to dress up as a Wasteland warrior?

Evening warriors, what an exciting day it has been! Thank you to all the new backers that have joined the cause, our total has gone up by the most it has since the first few days and that's down to you :)
We're now 3 weeks in and just over a week to go, and when I did our last update we were sitting at £7k with no real hope of funding. Now I'm daring to hope - the kind of hope that keeps a man alive against all odds. Is it a longshot? - yeah, but we've already achieved more than I had hoped and it ain't over til it's over! The plan remains the same: the campaign will run to its end, and even if we don't fund then we will still be in the best possible position to relaunch and smash it next time.

campaign.story:
Who is Dog Tag Miniatures?

Dog Tag Miniatures are a new company wanting to bring a range of 28mm Historical miniatures to the collector and wargamer. To begin with we will start with a range of WW2 motorbike units that are not currently being manufactured. This is our first Kickstarter and with this we aim to start small and grow.
What is the Aim?
We aim to fund the production costs of manufacturing an initial unit of motorbikes for the Russian Army in World War 2 with the option of male and female riders.
Bike Masters
So far 8 out of 10 sculpts completed for the male and female Russian units. The male and female sidecar riders remain to be sculpted; and these are currently on the sculptor’s desk and we will release pictures as soon as we get them.
2 Russian greens before master moulds were made
Two different motorbike options have been made for this project along with their sidecar options.
Male and female riders on first master casts

The two motorbikes are; the Russian DNEPR R72 and the other is the German BMW. Master moulds have been made of the motorbikes, sidecars and the riders. The miniatures will be cast in Resin with metal handlebars.
Painted Master casts
Sculptors involved in this project are Bear Head Miniatures, Richard Humble and John Robertson.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As with any project there is always some risks and challenges involved.

The main issue so far being the handle bars. They were to delicate when done in resin; as a result of this issue the handle bars are now going to be a separate piece. These will be cast in metal and will be the only part of the manufacturing process not done in house. We are confident this will have little impact on delivery times. 

We anticipate we will deliver this project on time.

campaign.story:
"Classic" Car Work in Progress
  "Little" Car
We are, initially, looking for £500 to enable us to begin production of the first of our Kickstarter Vehicles - the Family Saloon car!
The Cars are modelled in 32mm scale and fit beautifully with a range of Tabletop and Wargames miniatures suitable for many Tabletop games and modelling projects. Plus, they look cool, and take paint beautifully.
 The 3d masters for the first few designs are already with us, and we are delighted with the quality - the following photos don't show the wheels or wing mirrors, as we only have 1 set of Masters to use and don't want to go gluing them in until after we have lifted Moulds from them.
 So, our initial Funding goal is £500 - this will enable us to not only mould and produce the Saloon, but also to fulfill the pledges necessary to reach the £500 goal. Once we've funded though, the fun really begins!
BIGGER PLEDGES!
As we now have many designs funded, its a good time to explain the Pledges - you can pledge for as many Vehicles as you like, at any quantity and variation you like. 
Simply add +£10 per design you want after the first 3.
 I.e. you'd like 2 x Saloons and 2 x SUV's, simply take the £30 Pledge and add +£10.
 Do you want 6 x Luxury 4x4's? Select the £30 pledge and add +£30, and so forth.. don't worry about the specific selections just now as those will be covered in the Questionnaire once the Kickstarter concludes.
 You want 20 vehicles? Take the Parking Lot pledge and add +£100 - you also get 2 x FREE Tuktuk's as well!
 Simply increase your pledge per additional vehicle for now and let us know later what your choices are!
NEW PLEDGE LEVEL - Parking Lot!
 For £100, you will get any 10 Vehicles from those funded in the Kickstarter in any combination that you like. Want 10 x Taxis? No problem! 10 Muscle cars? Its your Parking Lot! In addition, you will receive, a FREE Tuktuk!
       We will not be selling the Food Van Tuktuk - but reserve the right to use it as a giveaway in a future Kickstarter project or 2. However, if you spend £100+ or take the Parking Lot Pledge level you will receive this awesome little Tuktuk completely FREE! Additionally, this will unlock the Food Van Tuktuk for you at +£5 per Tuktuk.
  Saloon Car
  Saloon Car 3d Render
  3d Master Print of Saloon
 Next up, the SUV!
SUV Stretch Goal
  SUV
  SUV 3d Print Master
  Render for SUV
 The SUV will be funded at £1000 of Pledges, and then we hope to move onto the 4x4 Pickup!
4x4 Pickup Stretch Goal
  4x4 Pickup
  Prototype 3d Print
  4x4 Pickup Render
 Those are the first 3 designs, they take us nicely up to the £1500 stretch goal - but we have already designed a few more other Vehicles and hope that the journey will allow us to bring those to the tabletop as well!
 In addition to funding the initial line up of the Saloon, SUV and Pickup - we are dropping in a special "Bonus Design" - the Luxury 4x4 is joining the "Funded" lineup!
BONUS DESIGN!!
 Yes! Thats right, we have added in a whole 4th design as 1 of the options! The Luxury 4x4 is a high end spacious 4x4 which comes with all mod cons and is the lap of luxury.
   - Keep an eye on this design, we may well revisit it slightly later in the campaign..
  We have opted for a slightly retro looking Taxi cab - mainly because we think it looks stylish! This taxi has elegant lines and a little bit of chrome and would look great gracing the Streets of New York or Gotham City!
Without wheels or wing mirrors!
        The Yellow Cab!
 And after the taxi...?
We don't want to reveal too much too quickly.. but as we achieve each stretch goal we will reveal a new design from further down the Kickstarter Journey. 
We have been teasing you with some blurry images of the Muscle car - but here it is in all of its glory! A bit of Classic American Muscle hits the road!
      This is a fast car, make no mistake - now.. after this.. we really should Fund something that just might catch up with it..  
So, whats after the Muscle car?
  That Muscle car is packing a whole lot of Horse Power.. you just know that its going to attract the attention of the Law! Luckily, this lawkeeper is driving a high Speed Pursuit car, which should be able to at least keep up with the Muscle car!
       The Delivery Van! We see them on just about every street in every town and city. The simple Delivery Van is one of the hardest working and commonplace vehicles on the roads today - and we will bring this van to your tabletop!
     The Van Stretch Goal will be a two-fer.. 
 In addition to the Delivery Van - shown above, when we fund the Van we will also add the Security Forces 4x4 to the Kickstarter as well!
Security Services Armoured 4x4
     I am a big fan of of Series such as Torchwood and other programmes with Men in Black type factions. I mentioned this to our Sculptor, John, and he surprised me with an armoured version of the Luxury 4x4. I can imagine a line of these very cool 4x4's being driven by some very severe men and women in black suits with earpieces and mirror shades.. 
 I loved the surprise so much that we decided to simply add it into the Kickstarter as an option, when we unlock the van.. we unlock the Security 4x4 as well!
 The People carrier, or Moms / Dads taxi! There are hundreds of these in every town and city - of all makes and models. 
    Pledge levels
We are keeping this Kickstarter as simple as possible! There are 3 Pledge levels;
  1st Gear Pledge Level
 For the 1st Gear Pledge Level you can select any 1 Vehicle of your choice from all that we fund!
2nd Gear Pledge Level
 For the 2nd Gear Pledge Level you can select any 2 Vehicles of your choice from all that we fund!
  Top Gear Pledge Level
  For the Top Gear Pledge Level you can select any 3 Vehicles of your choice from all that we fund!
Parking Lot Pledge Level
For the Parking Lot Pledge Level you can select any 10 Vehicles of your choice from all that we fund! These can be in any combination that you desire and you'll also get a FREE Exclusive KS Tuktuk Food Van!
 I want more than 3 vehicles! How do I pledge?
If you want additional Vehicles, or even multiples of any that take you over the 3, simply add +£10 per additional Vehicle to your Pledge amount. 
NOTE: Postage is based on 3 vehicles, if you purchase more this will be a heavier and thus more expensive Package so there will be an adjusted shipping cost when the Questionnaire is issued. We cannot tell you exactly what this will be until we know how many vehicles you want as 10 Vehicles will cost a lot more than 5 to post, and New Zealand is more expensive than Germany, for example. If in doubt - please pm us! We will always package well and ensure that we use the best and most economical post that we can for all Pledges.
How big are the cars?
Most of the "regular" cars are fairly similar in size and dimensions. They are scaled to be perfect for 32mm miniatures but with the wargames industry having such a massive array of sizes and scales - they are a good match from about 25mm to 35mm heroic scales and everything in between.
 If we use the 4x4 Pickup on my painting board as an average of the overall length, width and height;
Just over 120mm long
  A little over 42mm wide
  Approx. 40mm in height
 - Here is an image of a the Pickup with a range of miniatures from a variety of games to give you an idea of the size (please note - the 40k Space Marine, Mantic Miniature, Daruma SLA Character, Infinity Caledonian, Harley Quinn and Westwind German Officer miniatures are included purely to give an idea of the scale of this vehicle).
A range of miniatures
    Length of a Rhino
   The detailing and scale on the cars is excellent! As the Campaign progresses we will reveal more vehicles but the majority are similar in size to the Pickup seen above (but not all.. some might be a bit bigger..).
Addons!
In order to keep this Kickstarter as simple as possible and ensure the smoothest and quickest possible delivery times - we are avoiding too many addons. However.. the TukTuk Food van is just too cute to not offer out - you will receive it FREE at the Parking Lot Pledge level but if you'd like a TukTuk Food Van added to your pledge, simply add +£5 to your pledge level and this uber cool wee KS Exclusive will be added to your Order. Note - if you want multiple TukTuks, or are a Parking Lot Pledge whom wants more than 1 - also add +£5 per additional TukTuk Food van. Remember, the TukTuk Food van will not be available to retail or online after the Kickstarter!
Tuktuk Update
You can add Tuktuk's at +£5 each to your pledge, or - as they are KS Only exclusives you can take 2 x Tuktuk's as a Vehicle choice. This keeps it fair and makes them more available whilst still keeping them exclusive. We appear to have a bit of a Tuktuk fanclub and have had many positive comments and requests on this cool wee Vehicle.
Please note - we are also going to give a few of these out as prizes and 1 or 2 will be going to Friends within the Industry as samples / prizes but the Tuktuk Foodvan will always be a very limited run and never available via Retail. Thats not to say that we may have some ideas for alternative Tuktuk's.. ;) 
Tuktuk Food Van
LARC VTOL's
Our last kickstarter was only a couple of short months ago - we managed to complete and dispatch it in a short time period and the LARC KS is now complete. We are about to Retail launch it and have a 2nd wave of Casting almost ready to start for Retail and Showstock. I've had a few requests from Backers whom missed the original KS so have decided to offer them as an "addon" for the Tabletop Cars Project. 
If you would like any of the following LARC designs; 
Civilian LARC
Talon Gunship
SLA Shiver Gunship
Eagle Newschannel VTOL
Nightingale Medevac VTOL
Nightingal Medevac Chopper - thanks to Paul Inman for painting
  Military Loadout: Talon
  Civilian LARC
  SLA Shiver LARC
  Eagle News VTOL
If you would like any of the LARC loadouts - please add +£35 per LARC to your pledge and we will ask you which version you want.
 You can see from the sample photo of the Shiver LARC - the 32mm Feaney miniature gives an idea of scale. These are surprisingly big Resin models and you also have the option of adding an acrylic flight base for an additional +£5 each. 
What are they made of?
All of our vehicles will be cast in high quality resin, which holds detail superbly and offers strength and flexibility whilst still being lightweight. Our caster is looking at the options of either having them as a 1 piece cast with the wheels and wing mirrors being included in the single cast or having the Wheels and Wing mirrors as separate pieces - we will make that decision shortly but either way, the price will be the same to yourselves and the quality will be there.
When will my pledge arrive?
We have said that we are looking to deliver in January - however.. this is to give ourselves sufficient time should there be any hiccups or the Kickstarter climb higher than we anticipate. We always prefer to deliver on time or early if possible so set expectations accordingly.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Every Kickstarter comes with unique risks and challenges - and this is no exception. Resin casting has pitfalls such as mould failure, requiring new 3d prints to be made, tricky details, etc.. However - we have a good team whom are all dedicated to making this Kickstarter a reality and we have taken great care to try and cover all eventualities. 
 Out last Kickstarter (The LARC) was delivered nearly a full month ahead of time and in a remarkably short time frame. We have allowed extra time on the Tabletop Cars as we don't know how many backers we will get and allowing ourselves extra means we shouldn't disappoint anybody and deliver on, or ahead of time. We very much follow the Montgomery Scott philosophy on planning..

I'm packing and posting packages every couple of days this week - and finally feel very much like I'm on the home straight. The Caster is sending me fairly regular updates that reassure me that he is back on with everything and that the last bits will be with me by my next shift off of work - Tuesday of next week. So, in about a week or so we should be 100% delivered. 
I have got a slight overrun on everything coming just in case there are any hiccups or anything, so we should (all going well) be in a position to call it finished very soon!

After a lot of consultation with our Sculptor and some careful planning.. we are in the position to be able to offer a few Alternate pledges for the Project;  
1. 15mm Pledge - initially the Goliath, but as each vehicle is unlocked we will make it available as an addon to the 15mm Pledge. The Goliath will include the Engine and all 3 trailers for £20 - if we make fund more trailers, those will be added to the Pledge automatically. We have altered the model a little from the 32mm scale - each trailer is a separate entire piece, and has space for a magnet to attach it to the Engine / next Trailer. As each additional Vehicle is funded, we will make it available as an addon at this scale.

Evening all, just a little update - i've messaged everyone whom has reported any miscasts, etc to me - so please let me know of any issues if you haven't already.
 I've spoken to the Caster about the underneaths of the cars which doesn't appear to be a consistent issue (some of them are clean as a whistle top and bottom) and will ensure that moving forward, the quality is far better. The Big vehicles will be mostly molded in a different manner, and have a different approach to the parts and casting - so we shouldn't have these issues again.

Good Evening all!
I'm down to the last couple of batches of Global / US post which will go out in the next few days. That means that the KS will be 100% delivered! campaign.story:
Death Path is a race to the end of a maze with 2 or more "Subjects" taking turns simultaneously. To navigate through the Death Path, Subjects will reveal cards at the same time. Much of the Death Path consist of Clear Path cards but occasionally you will run into a choice with multiple options. This will cause your deck to split in hopes of finding a quicker path to the end.
Navigate the Death Path by revealing cards!
You may also encounter Pathfinders, crude government-controlled robots trying to slow your progress. There are weapons.... and you'll need them!
Each time you reveal a Stash card from your Maze Deck, you will draw and Item Card and have the option to equip it.
Each weapon you find will have a custom die associated with it. D8's for one-handed weapons and D12's for two-handed weapons. These are truly unique dice and not numbered traditionally. The number on each side indicates the amount of damage inflicted if you hit. Some weapons, like the volatile Fusion Staff, have higher and lower damage results representing more risk/reward while others like the trusty Power Nux are more consistent with the damage they inflict.
If you encounter another Subject, you will be forced to fight them by an unscrupulous Death Path Bailiff in a 3 round bout (cue the fighting video game clip...."Round 1...FIGHT!"). If you win the fight, you will get a head start to finishing the Death Path while your opponent is licking their wounds and falling behind.
The first Subject to finish revealing all the cards in their Maze Deck is the winner. If any Subject loses all their Health tokens, they are dead and out of the game. In a two player game, this means their opponent wins. When playing with 3 or more players, the others keep navigating through the Death Path until there is a winner!
A 2 player game takes approximately 20min to play, while adding additional players can increase that to 30-40min.
Take a look at the rules PDF here. (May have some minor changes before production)
There are expansions planned for additional Subjects,  solo play and playable bad guys too!
Check out the pledge levels for details how to get your own create-a-character in the game!
How about a gameplay video?
Thanks to JP's wife, Heather, for the support, playtesting and of course losing gracefully in this gameplay video! 
 Note: Final art and design may be changed slightly before production.
Note: Prices do NOT include shipping. Shipping will be charged later based on actual shipping prices when production is near completion.
At the base $29 pledge level, you get the complete 2 player game in this Kickstarter. You also get all applicable FREE stretch goals unlocked during the campaign and access to buy any add-on stretch goals we unlock.
This 2 player set consists of Subjects, Mizzy Pazzone and Zo Joxxer.
You get a large-sized Subject card detailing their background and special rules along with 3 Attack and Defense D6 dice for each of these two characters.
Note: Every Subject produced for Death Path will have custom Attack and Defense dice based on their character class to showcase their specific fighting style.
You also get 2 full Maze Decks consisting of 109 cards. They include the various sections of the maze you will be revealing while you make your way through the Death Path.
You get 1 Item Deck with 16 Item Cards. These includes weapons, shields, health stims.... and traps!
You get 9 custom Weapon Dice which represent the damage inflicted with each of the various weapons your Subject can use. As mentioned above, the numbers on each Weapon dice are different and non-sequential, based on each type of weapon.
50+ Social Shares - Metal Coin
Kickstarter Exclusive Death Path Metal Coin Unlocked - FREE to all backers $29 and above!
100+ Backers - New Item
Kickstarter Exclusive Neutralizer Gun Item Card - FREE to all backers $29 and above!
$10,500 - New Subject
Kickstarter Exclusive Subject entering the Death Path, former Government Operative, Agent J - FREE to all backers $29 and above!
$11,000 - New Subject
Kickstarter Exclusive Subject entering the Death Path, Exterminator by day, Hitman by night, Bryx Chel - FREE to all backers $29 and above!
$12,000 - New Item & Weapon Die
A weapon that could not only inflict damage but also disarm your opponent? Unlock the Hell Whip Item Card AND New Custom D8 at $12,000!
$13,000 - Death Path Comic 
The art in Death Path already lends itself to the comic book style, so why not enjoy a taste of a future comic based on Death Path with a PDF Of Issue 0 when we hit $13,000?
What's next? Find out when we get close to $13,000 funded!
CHARACTER PACK 1
More characters means more fun!
While the Death Path core game comes with an Athlete class (Zo Joxxer) and a Master class (Mizzy Pazzone), you can add $20 to your pledge for Character Pack 1 and round out the other classes in the game.
(From Left to Right) Del Zhing is a mercenary, looking for the highest bidder. What does the Government want with him? He falls under the Militant class. Rozi Rondi comes from a long line of underground street fighters and can be more deadly without any weapons! She represents the Brawler class while convict, Chuck Janson, is clearly the Ruffian in this group of misfits. He bites. No joke, he does. Last but certainly not least is the Beefy class Subject, Dyna Moto. She's as intimidating as she looks and can even quickly dispose of Pathfinders with her Shock Treatment ability.
Your games of Death Path will be that much more interesting with 4 new characters in the mix, and each of them coming with 4 new sets of custom and colored Attack and Defense dice. 
Add on Character Pack 1 for just $20 now!
ITEM PACK 1  
The base game comes with Power Nux, Energy Gloves, Stun Blades, and a Fusion Staff as weapons. Plus Heath Stims, Traps, and Combat Shields as other items.
Remember, every weapon in the game has both an Item Card and a corresponding custom Weapon die. More weapons means more Death in Death Path!
Let's make some more weapons and other items available, shall we?
Add $15 to your pledge to get Item Pack 1 consisting of 2 Fire Daggers (with 2 orange custom D8's), 2 Life Stims, 1 bad ass shield that negates Pathfinder damage, and oh I dunno.... possibly a Magic Zlurpee item that has some pretty amazing effects when consumed.
Plus one more item that we don't have clearance by The Government to discuss just yet!
Did we forget to mention that the Fire Daggers may actually hurt the Subject wielding them? Worth it.
Art concepts still being worked on!
Please excuse the terrible image above. No art yet for most of these new items, but rest assured these new Items will add even more mayhem to your games of Death Path! 
DEATH PATH PLAYMAT
The people asked us at Gencon for a playmat. Who are we to stand in the way of progress? 
Each Death Path playmat is designed for 2 players sitting across from one another. If you intend to play Death Path with 3-4 players, you should get two mats and place them side-by-side -- or 3 mats for 5-6 players, etc.
Increase your pledge amount by $25 for each playmat you want to add on!
This 2' x 2' mousepad style playmat is created by Maelstrom Gaming Mats. Unlike some other mousepad mats, this one also includes stitching on the edges to lay flat. 
 Check out more of their work here!
"I seriously dig the concept! It has a Running Man meets Unreal Tournament meets Hunger Games/Maze Runner mash-up feel. This could be something really spectacular." - Brent Spivey, Bombshell Games (Designer of Techno Bowl, HAVOC, Mayhem, and Rogue Planet)
"Looking forward to seeing this on Kickstarter. Love the splitting of the deck and how fast the fighting can be." - Eric Huffman, Artist
"I'll be backing it as I found it to be a fun and enticing game that's fast and brutal." - Randy Jenkins, from Zlurpcast Studios Facebook Group
"Looking forward to picking this up. Where is the shut up and take my money button?" - Lawrence Ashmead, from Zlurpcast Studios Facebook Group
Coverage on most recent Zlurpcast, (iTunes) answering many questions about the game -- some not even answered here!)
 Video Review from David Witek of GarageHammer TV.
Check out my interview with Brody Sheard from Everything Board Games. We discuss the overall gameplay and future plans for the game!
In the not too distant future of 2100, the United States has gone from democracy to dictatorship to full police state. In 2088, they passed the ironically titled, Freedom Directive, which gave The Government the complete and unopposed authority to do as they please in the name of “safety for all citizens”. Rights were s tripped from Citizens to make the masses feel at ease whether they approved or not. The Government has now assumed power and control over all of North, Central, and South America.
This is only the beginning. By 2150, total world domination is planned, but it will take soldiers.
The only “recreational” activity the Government allows is called the Death Path. The Death Path takes the entertainment and brutality of a gladiatorial fighting pit and combines it with a violent and complex maze. Citizens watch the action unfold live on their holo-terminals while chosen Subjects enter the Death Path, ready to battle for their survival.
As a Subject, you will be navigating through the Death Path and will most likely encounter one or more other Subjects in the same situation as you. The Government will force you to fight them. The two ways a Fight will end is after 3 rounds, or someone dies. Pretty simple rules for a sadistic human bloodsport like this. You may also injure another Subject long enough for you to take the lead and reach the end of the Death Path first, ensuring your survival.
Subjects will also encounter Pathfinders, Government-controlled robots on a mission. They are there to put these Subjects through even more rigorous testing — and more brutal entertainment of course. During their journey through the Death Path, Subjects will have many options within the maze presenting multiple routes. The right one will be a Hidden Path and lead directly to the end of the maze. The wrong one, well, let’s just hope you don’t run into a Path End and have to r retrace your steps.
What is the end result of the Death Path? The winning Subject get to live. And the Government gets a new recruit for their impending war for control of the world. Win-win?
Jonathan Peletis - Lead Designer of Death Path. You may know him as JP, Jonny P, or Main Guy from the tabletop games podcast, Zlurpcast. Before creating Death Path, JP was involved with the rules committee and worked directly with game designer Jake Thornton to assist with the rules for the sci-fi skirmish game, Deadzone by Mantic Games. He also published a variant of that game using walkers, called Mechzone.
Bryan "Xtreme" Mitchell - Assistant Designer of Death Path. You may know him as Other Guy from Zlurpcast but he's also the co-founder of Zlurpcast Studios with Jonny P. Well-known in the world of Blood Bowl as the organizer of one of the largest tournaments in North America, Zlurpee Bowl, Bryan has some top secret projects in the works and also does commission painting services as X-Painting.
Jonny P and Xtreme of Zlurpcast Studios

campaign.story:
Kore Aeronautics
  Welcome to the Kickstarter for the KA101 LARC - Low Altitude Rotor Craft. The first in a new range of post modern / sci fi Flyers from the Kore Aeronautics Design Lab. 
 The LARC is a 32mm Scale Flyer, the design is a homage to many VTOL's that you will see in Hollywood Movies or read about in many sci fi novels; we have intentionally created it to look like a workhorse with a gritty science fiction image that could be set anywhere from the near future to perhaps a century or 2 down the line.
 The LARC is not a high tech, super futuristic design - rather, its the versatile and highly utilitarian Work chopper of the Future. It is easily adapted to a number of roles and utilises tried and tested technologies - many of the components of which you will see in other Kore Vehicles and VTOL's. The ideas here, is that within its setting, it is easy to maintain, low cost and efficient - and also simple to adapt for your Corporations needs.
KA101 LARC
 We have several designs planned - to give you the option of including your LARC in a range of scenarios perhaps as an objective or a scenic piece? Our own, initial designs include
KA101 LARC: Civilian light aircraft  
KA111 “Nightingale”: Medevac / rescue aircraft  
KA141 “Talon”: Multi-role combat aircraft  
KA103 “Eagle”: Dedicated reconnaissance / news report aircraft
Master Print of Talon Variant
- Each of these is a distinctly different Variant on the basic LARC hull - and each comes with a different loudout of equipment and tech. You can, with a little imagination, even mix and match the designs to perhaps have a Military rescue LARC with both Combat and Saviour pods, for example.
   We are keeping this Kickstarter very simple - with 3 pledge levels;
 For the £35 Pilot Pledge you will receive - a Civilian LARC with any choice of 1 Upgrade from all variants that we unlock.
 The £65 Flight Officer Pledge will give you 2 x Civilian LARC's with a choice of any 2 Upgrades from all variants that we unlock.
  The £90 Wing Commander Pledge will give you 3 x Civilian LARC's with a choice of any 3 Upgrades from all the variants that we unlock. 
Aim of the Kickstarter
We have already had the 3d Imagery for all 4 initial variants rendered - and had 3d prints for both the Civilian LARC and the Military Talon Variant. To pay for the production run, mould costs, etc.. we want to keep the Kickstarter Goals tight.
  Kore Aeronautics are delighted to introduce their first foray into the aeronautical engineering market, the KA101 LARC. The LARC has been designed to integrate leading edge technology with old fashioned solid reliability, embedded in a robust and highly adaptable airframe. With a number of dedicated variants available on demand—from civil aviation to reportage, from emergency response to military operations—there is a LARC for you, whatever your specialty. The LARC has been built with your needs in mind, sharing a catalog of readily available components* with many other Kore Industries vehicles. With extensive third-party supply contracts already in place, the LARC has lower maintenance sensitivity than most of its competitors. This means less time on the ground, and more in the air.  
 “I’ve flown light helos all across the Territories and in more disputed zones than I care to remember. I’ve never found a bird as easy to fly as the LARC. She’s forgiving, fast, surprisingly low maintenance and easy on the eye. Hell. I prefer her over my third wife! Cheaper too.”  
Attributed to FLT O Hendrik O’Bannon, 3rd Valkyrie Hussars Mercenary Command.
We initially want to raise £2,000 to fund the Moulds and first production run of the basic Civilian Model. If we achieve the funding, we can then move onto the really exciting stuff! 
Variants as addons!
We can add in the Talon / Eagle / Nightingale resin upgrade packs as an Addon in the Kickstarter, for +£5.00 you can have any of the addon packs that you wish. This means that you can either;  
A) Simply add +£5.00 for the variant pack that you desire, or  
B) If that variant funds, and you get it included in your pledge at no additional cost, you can perhaps purchase an additional Variant addon to use the parts for creating your own loadouts! You can even perhaps get yourself a SLA Loadout and mix and match the alt. weapons load!  
Yes - that means that you would get the 2 x ELSA Pods from the Nightingale for only £5.00 but as this is Kickstarter, and we really want to get the Primary 4 x Variants out there (excluding the SLA Shiver LARC) we figured that this is the best compromise and if we fund the variants, you still get them included in the Options that your pledge already covers!
 We at Kore Aeronautics recognise our clientele’s need for a versatile helo capable of performing a number of functions in a broad range of operations. The Talon is such a craft. In keeping with Kore’s corporate ethos of low cost, high value, the Talon is available in a variety of configurations. The Talon is designed to optimise end-user flexibility with a weapons load-out that ensures our customers can rely on the Talon in any hostile environment. Whatever your mission parameters—be it ghost-op, hot retrieval or escort—you can rely on the Talon and its triumvirate of weapons systems. Whilst the dual ‘Handy-Gat’ configuration offers market-leading firepower, both the Koffin AGL and twin quad-mounted Sky Streak missile systems can be further personalised to your operational requirements. Put simply, the firepower to weight ratio of the KA141 Talon allows it to punch well above its weight.
“So I’m called in—on a Sunday no less—on an emergency contract to rescue some dumb Corporate Raider from a hostile LZ in West-Sheffield. So when my usual helo is down for maintenance (again!), the local Kore Aeronautics rep offers me the keys to her shiny new Talon. At first I just thought, ‘Damn! That thing’s so small! I can barely carry a six-pack in the back, let alone extract a Triple Rate bonus boy from an office ‘plex two blocks south of a warzone.” I tell ya though, that bird can fly! I took a left turn at the Cineplex on Main, headed straight down Winchester and landed her on the Corporate Restaurant on the roof of the Stiel Werks Building. Int. Sec. tried to slap me with a no parking permit, but the Koffin and Handy Gats took care of them, and I’m sure glad that my K.A. rep. loaded the Sky Streakers with A.A.: I downed two inbound Interceptors before delivering the package to a safe zone 200 klicks south. Would I fly her again? I won’t fly anything else. Have you heard the sound system on that baby? Nobody—and I mean nobody—on the market can match that bass.”  
Lt. Jayne Mendosa, Postal 7 Close Protection Operative.
The Talon is a much larger kit than the basic Civilian LARC, as it includes a number of additional components. It is loaded out for a Multi-role aspect, capable of taking on most of what the modern battlefield can throw at it. 
Koffin Dodger Automatic Grenade Launcher
  Sky Scream Quad Missile Launcher
  Handygat Chain Gun - door mounted
 Please note - on the Model, these can be modelled in a variety of positions, including locked forward; you can imagine this being useful in 1 man solo missions where no side gunners are available. 
 Kore Aeronautics are proud to present the brand new Eagle VTOL. A further variant on the industry standard KA101 LARC, the Eagle brings the LARC’s reliability and performance to the demanding 24-hour rolling news market. This versatile aircraft is equipped with not only a leading edge, nose-mounted, multi-optic camera, but also two racks of highly maneuverable and durable drone cameras. Whilst these drones can be piloted by the Eagle’s crew, they are also equipped with an A.I. capable of autonomous control. These innovative drones will help your news teams get the best camera angle for any remote shots. They’re also fully integrated with the Eagle’s comms system, ensuring footage can be relayed directly to any news channel taking advantage of the Eagle’s advanced capabilities.
 “The Avondale Veterans riots were a fecal-storm that nobody else wanted anything to do with. I mean, there were angry people down there with firearms and military training. Fortunately the drones on my Eagle meant we could get cameras in good and close without placing ourselves in harm’s way. Not only did we make the headline news, but the footage helped the cops identify the ringleaders. Oh, and did I mention we won the Lead News Award for best footage?”  
Chad ‘Rad’ Denver, NXT News
The Eagle has a smaller loadout than the Talon - but its own Variant Chin turret and a twin rack of 2 drones.
Hi Optics Camera Package
   Civilian Variant Military Spydrone
   Kore Aeronautics is proud to unveil its first foray into the medivac market, the Nightingale. A further variant on Kore’s flagship LARC VTOL, the Nightingale’s suite of features places it at the forefront of modern emergency response solutions. Whilst the Nightingale’s fully stocked pharmaceutical bay and organ storage cabinet are industry standards, the Nightingale’s twin ELSA (Emergency Life Support Apparatus) pods set this VTOL apart from the competition. The result of Kore Aeronautics’ new 10-year deal with market leader Oshigawa Medicine, the Nightingales’ twin ELSAs are variants of Oshigawa Medicine’s world-renowned, A.I.-enhanced Florence VII. Lightweight and highly portable, these ELSAs are the most advanced life support pods on the market (outside of military installations and corporate hospitals) and are two full generations more advanced than the nearest competitor can offer.
 “There is no way—No. Way—Lieutenant Baker should have lived. When we extracted him from Pelham Parkway he’d lost almost seventy-five percent of his blood volume and suffered major trauma to the pelvic and abdominal area. But the Florence pods kept him alive long enough for us to get him to Lincoln Medical and into theater. They did the rest. That guy owes his life to the Florence and my Nightingale VTOL. “So make no mistake, if you want a medivac VTOL that has the ability to keep the patient alive AND is quick enough to get them to the trauma center in one piece, then the Nightingale simply has no rival.”  
Danielle Studebaker, Lincoln Medical Center, NYC
 The Nightingale comes with 2 large ELSA's - emergency survival pods, and you can imagine this Variant being used by Corporate, Military and Civilian Medical pilots in a broad range of environments. The Pods are a gorgeous piece of kit on their own!
ELSA
 SLA Industries - Shiver Loadout
   We are delighted to be presenting the first of our Crossover LARC's - we have spoken to the great guys over at Daruma, and they have given their blessing for us to create a Shiver Loadout! This version sports 2 x Reaper and 2 x Reaver cannon. You can just imagine a Shiver manning the door guns and hosing down a pack of Carrien as they patrol the Cannibal Sector!
- We will make this an upgrade option for all Pledge levels from the moment that the Civilian LARC funds! And we are almost there..
Addons!
We are now creating the first of our addons - we will have some cool Merchandise later today, but for now - we have been asked about purchasing a few parts separately, so after consulting with our Resin Caster, we present the first 2 parts that are available to purchase on their own!
Rotor Assembly
Single Rotor Assembly
 A single Rotor Assembly is approximately 70mm in diameter, and useful for all sorts of creative Conversion work. If you would like to add any Rotor Assemblies to your pledge, please add +£5.00 per Assembly.
ELSA Pod
- The ESLA Pod is approx. 34-36mm in length - and bulky enough to look like it will comfortably contain a 32mm miniature. These are ideal for all sorts of gaming - from scenery to objectives! If you would like to add an ELSA Pod to your pledge, please add +£4.00 per pod.  
Overview
So, those are the Funding and next 3 stretch goals! We have a few very cool ideas beyond those, and hope that the Kickstarter journey takes us there in the coming days and weeks!
We are also talking to some 3rd Parties about perhaps making a LARC variant for their gaming systems.. but more on those if they happen as its early days yet and we wouldn't want to spoil the surprise. 
NOTE : If you happen to have a Post Modern / Sci fi game and you like the idea of adding the LARC to your game, drop us a line, we would love to hear from you!
Whats it made of?
The Model and all variants will be cast in high quality resin by one of the UK's leading Resin casters. Already highly experienced in the manufacturing of vehicles, the casting of this gorgeous kit is in good hands. Our 3d Sculptor is also a modeller at heart, and has taken great care to ensure that not only are the right parts made a little chunkier (i.e. the skids are heavy enough to take the weight of the LARC parked and will support it well - and she's not a light bird!), but that the assembly will be straight forward, simple and easy for any modeller from a novice to an expert!
 With that in mind, you'll find that if you are an expert, and enjoy working with magnets and conversions - the LARC should be a joy to work with! The chin gun, chin plate, camera and drones will be capable of being magnetised on the Talon and Eagle variants as well, the Master print for these are enroute and we will put up more detailed photographs once the components arrive. 
 The rear area of the LARC is fully detailed with 4 seats in the Civilian Variants and 6 seats in the Military. Clearly, the Civilian LARC has been constructed with comfort in mind. 
 The doors are separate on all variants and can be modelled from closed through to fully opened. 
 The Rotor assemblies are sturdy and well designed to take a bit of abuse - and the connections on those are also hefty, with the option of you being able to rotate the rotors to just the right position that you want. 
 Our Resin caster has given us very realistic time frames to expect volumes of Casting, and we believe we can deliver this Kickstarter very swiftly - as soon as we fund, he begins casting! As soon as the casting is complete, we dispatch. 
How does it scale with other Miniatures?
It fits in smoothly with most 28mm - 32mm and heroic scale Sci fi and post modern minis. The model is a good size and we have had a play with practice renders for crewmen, etc and can assure you that it will take a 6ft scale pilot easily, plus a co pilot and 6 seats in the military version! The Civilian LARC is, of course, rather more comfortable with only 4 seats in the back.. 
The Dimensions of this model are;  
Length: 165mm  
Width: 220mm  
Height: 65mm
- as you can tell from the photos and the Scale, this is not a small model. It has real presence on the tabletop and looks fantastic.
Talon Master Print
 The Kickstarter
Welcome to our Kickstarter! We have 4 very cool initial designs, lots more in waiting (and possibly 1 or 2 surprises) and will be unveiling a few exciting addons in coming days. 
After the Kickstarter - we will be selling the LARC (and all variants funded) directly and via any interested Retailers or 3rd parties. At the moment, its looking like the Civilian Hull will be approx £35, with the variants coming in at around £40 due to the extra components and subsequent requirements for additional moulds, resin, casting, etc. The KS versions begin at £35 for either a Civilian or Variant version, and if you buy a few you'll pay even less - this means that not only will you get your KS version sooner, but at a far lower cost than at retail! 
We will also, not release any of these models to Retail, until the last Kickstarter pledge is posted!
Civilian LARC & Military Talon 3d Masters
   Postage and Packaging
We have a fair idea of the weight and bulk of the LARC's - so have set UK postage at £4 and Global at £6. This should offset the majority of the cost for shipping, and they will be sent in robust packaging, within a couple of months of the close of the Kickstarter.
We have already sourced Warehousing and Dispatch for the entire delivery - our Caster has given us an excellent projection on how many he can cast per day, so we are confident that we can have the entire run in our Warehouse well before end October, and have additional resource available for Dispatch should we need it. This is, in terms of logistics, a relatively simple Kickstarter so we won't have a massive no. of items to pack, etc per package and the set P&P costs will cover all 3 pledge levels comfortably, even accounting for some of the cool addons we have planned ;) 
Addons!
Rotor +£5.00 to pledge
  ELSA Pod +£4.50 added to Pledge
  Comedy Tee Shirt +£15.00 to Pledge
  LARC Pilot Tee +£15.00 to Pledge
  LARC Pilots bag +£35.00 to Pledge
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
There are potential pitfalls with every project like this - if the design proves to be harder on the moulds if predicted, if any components need redesigned and reprinted.. there are a number of areas that need careful management. We are fortunate enough to be working with some very professional Sculptors and Casters - they have worked closely on both the image of the LARC and the components, this has already resulted in a number of changes to get us to this stage even. We will continue to work closely with them and endeavour to ensure that the Model that reaches you, is the best we can offer.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Good morning all!
Firstly - many apologies, we were really hoping to be showing you photos of completely finished miniatures before Xmas! However.. our main Caster whom does the Resin and metal for us is based near Birmingham and last weeks snows have disrupted his schedule. He is about a week or so behind the curve on his commissions and his own work due to staffing issues, closures, etc with the unexpected snows that caused a bit of havoc "down south".

The Tabletop cars kickstarter is now live!!
https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/978361943/tabletop-cars-32mm

Good afternoon all, i've had feedback that the majority of the LARC's are now arriving far afield. There have been 1 or 2 minor packing issues (mostly me not packing 100% of the components quite right) but i have sorted all of those so far and every missing component (and there were very few) has been dispatched already!
 So.. work is forging ahead on the Tabletop Cars Kickstarter, and i'm glad to say that its progressing faster than anticipated. In fact.. its probably just about ready to go live!

It looks like the LARC Kickstarter is now, officially.. delivered! We have cast all of the pledges, printed the Tee shirts and the bags, picked packed and dispatched them and have just placed the first Order for Retail stock with the caster. The finishing touches are being put to the Online store and that will go live hopefully in the next day or 2. All that remains is for us to thank every one of our backers whom made this possible - and to start the sneak peaks on the next Kickstarter; 32mm Cars!

I've managed to dispatch another large batch today - there are only about a dozen left to go, and those will go on Monday. The only orders with a tiny delay are those with Bags and Tee shirts which are due to be finished on Tuesday of next week - so those orders will be a day later, sorry folks.
Otherwise, i've just finished the very last picking and packing so the next post wave will see everything gone.
